loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher deals in the textile business, mainly selling clothes in Hoima, Uganda.  He is a hardworking man, age 49. 

He hopes to expand his business so as to earn more income. 

He will use the loan facility to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to build a permanent house.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a married woman; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 24 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Erma has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Erma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Richelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and fishing.  

Richelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish for her making dried fish business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 47 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for eight years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sanitary pads, toothpaste, coffee, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aida wants to make improvement in her business, and she only dreams of a good life for her family. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, se siente apoyado por la institución para mejorar su negocio,  por lo que nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar barro crudo, arcilla, nacazcol y leña, se mantendrá comercializando piezas de loza y cumpliendo con las nuevas demandas de sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ha servido para mantener su negocio de venta de loza y la agricultura activo, la producción de piezas de loza es mayor con lo que tiene oportunidad de ampliar el mercado y tener mejores ganancias, su familia se encuentra saludable y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pablo feels supported by the institution to improve his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy oil, clay, nacazcol [a black dye] and firewood thus he will continue selling pieces of pottery and meeting the new orders from his customers.

The previous loan helped him keep his pottery sales business and farming going. The production of pieces of pottery has improved as he has had the opportunity to  widen his market and get better earnings. His family is healthy and with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, clay, nacazcol [a black dye] and firewood.

loans.name: Riza Joy

texts.en:
Riza Joy is 29 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Riza Joy has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shirley is 49 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Shirley has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is a 33-year-old married man with five children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He does produce selling and buying, and banana farming, along with a retail shop. He faces challenges of weather changes, but besides that, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Medard has asked for a loan to buy more maize produce to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize produce

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, considera que con la ayuda de financiamientos su tienda y comedor están mejorando, en la actualidad su negocio ha ganado mayor popularidad, su situación económica es muy favorable y las circunstancias familiares están cambiando positivamente.
Debido a las nuevas demandas necesita surtir mejor su inventario por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., tanto para la tienda como para elaborar la comida que vende en el comedor, espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Rubidia thinks that, with the help of loans, her store and cafeteria are improving. Currently, her business has won great popularity, her economic situation is very favorable, and her family circumstances are changing positively.
Due to new demands, she needs to improve her inventory. So, she opted to request a new loan to buy vegetables, staple grains, drinks, sugar, salt, etc, both for the store and to prepare the food that she sells in the cafeteria. She hopes to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, staple grains, drinks, sugar, salt, etc, for the store and to prepare the food that she sells in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad es una persona honesta y muy trabajadora, se dedica  a la venta de ropa de segunda mano lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para damas, caballeros y niños  y continuar con sus ventas para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, an honest and very hardworking person. She works in second-hand clothing sales which she does on foot through the different suburbs which are found near her place of residence.

Maria lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale for women, men and children and continue her sales to have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy grocery items for her store.

Rosalie has taken out and paid off eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Morena Antonia

texts.es: Morena de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 22 años al cultivo de caña de azúcar, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Morena está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, venenos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Morena is 42 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband and her three children. She has worked for 22 years growing sugarcane. She will sell her products in the different markets, with her earnings from her sales she will manage to afford some expenses in her household.

Morena is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve her land which is shown in the photo to be able to continue working and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve her land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de antojito como: pastelitos de carne, yuca, papas y platanitos fritos, desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su madre, la joven está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de los materiales para preparara los alimentos como: maíz, carne, papas, yuca, plátanos, aceite, verduras, etc. para poder continuar con las ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face has been pixelated is 28 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She works selling snacks such as: meat dumplings, yuca, fried potatoes and plantains. She has been doing this for 3 years, and she has many customers. She lives in her own house with her 2 children and her mother. This young woman is requesting a loan to buy the materials to prepare food such as: corn, meat, potatoes, yuca, plantains, oil, vegetables, etc, so that she can continue with the sales as this is her only source of work and, in this way, she will be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, potatoes, yuca, plantains, oil, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a grocery business in Emali town and has been running this business for 5 years now. She is 45 years old and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 4 children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of bananas, tomatoes and vegetables to resell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future her hopes are to grow her business and send her children on to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Alejandria

texts.en:
Alejandria works hard to support her family. Alejandria is married and has a business doing direct selling of personal products in the Philippines.

Alejandria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers.

Alejandria has been in this business for 3 years now.

Alejandria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

Marina has been in this business for years now. In the future, Marina would like to buy a new motor.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Benita is 50 years old and all of her children are in school.

Benita has a Food vending business in the Philippines. Benita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients to use in her food production business.

Benita has been in this business for 3 years.  In the future, Benita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to use in her food production business

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Gloria, utilizo de buena manera el crédito anterior, mejoro el inventario de la venta de frutas y verduras que ofrece a sus clientes, su familia se mantiene unida y brindándole apoyo para continuar progresando, sus ingresos no han aumentado mucho pero aun así cumple con sus compromisos.
Se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en papas, tomates, cebollas, chiles, aguacates, papayas, manzanas, etc., ofertara productos frescos y atraerá nuevos clientes, espera tener resultados positivos con esta compra y lograr tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Gloria used her previous loan well, improved her stock of fruits and vegetables which she offers to her customers. Her family remains united and providing her with support to keep making progress, her income hasn't increased much but she is still able to meet her obligations.

She decided to request a new loan to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, chillies, avocados, papayas, apples, etc. she will offer fresh products and attract new customers. She hopes to have positive results with this purchase and achieve having her own stall.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, chillies, avocados, papayas, apples, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María, tiene una familia compuesta por su esposo y dos hijos mayores de edad; su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de panes con pollo,tortillas, tostadas, etc., y algunas golosinas, de esta forma puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, sus labores en el negocio inician desde muy tempranas horas del día, su negocio está ubicado cerca de un Centro Escolar lo que le da una ventaja.
Invertirá el crédito en comprar pan, maíz, cal, leña, pollo, condimentos, etc., mantendrá una buena cantidad de materia prima en su inventario para seguir elaborando la venta y generar más ingresos.
Para  María su sueño es mantenerse trabajando reunir el dinero suficiente para construir su casa propia en el terreno que ya posee.
texts.en:
María has a family composed of her husband and two grown children. Her source of income is making and selling breads with chicken, tortillas, tostadas, etc, and some candies. In this way, she can support her husband with paying the household expenses. Her work begins at a very early hour of the morning. Her business is located near to a school, and this gives her an advantage.
She will use the loan to buy bread, corn, lime, wood, chicken, condiments, etc, so she can keep a good quantity of raw materials in her inventory to keep making sales and generating more income.
For María, her dream is to keep working to get together enough money to build her own house on land that she already owns.

loans.use: to buy bread, corn, lime, wood, chicken, condiments, etc, so she can keep a good quantity of raw materials in her inventory to keep making sales.

loans.name: Keto

texts.en:
Keto is 53 years old and is a housekeeper from Vani district. Her husband died several years ago and Keto was forced to lead the family and take care of her two sons. Because she only has secondary education and because there is a high unemployment rate in the region, Keto hasn't started any stable job. The family's only source of income is her children's orphan pension. She has a great desire to start her own business, which will help her to tackle her financial difficulties and make a good life for her sons. 

The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live in poverty.  According to the above-mentioned situation, Keto lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. 

The Start-Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Keto to get a loan of GEL 2,100 to start her own business.  She will purchase a stock of merchandise and devices and start lemonade-making. Keto thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in great location and the only business of this kind in the area. 

After the factory is opened, the family will have a stable income which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start-Up program, Keto will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To open a lemonade factory.

loans.name: Nthakyo

texts.en:
Nthakyo has a carpentry business in Emali town and has been running this business for 3 years now. He is 24 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy more stock of timber to make wooden tables and chairs to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's needs. 

This is his third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he has paid back his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to have a successful business and live a good life together with his family.

loans.use: To buy mores stock of timber to make tables to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 38 years old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap, etc.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Rosalie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soap.

loans.name: Jose Edilberto

texts.es:
José, tiene un taller automotriz, su negocio ha ganado clientes por las buenas recomendaciones de los que ya conocen su buen trabajo, el oficio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de contar con una fuente de ingresos para subsistir; José es casado y tiene tres hijos de 9, 8 y 4 años de edad, los cuales ya iniciaron a estudiar.
Está solicitando capital para invertirlo en la construcción de una galera, ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes, evitara que se moje o el sol dañe su equipo y trabajos ya terminados, espera tener nuevos clientes para tener mejores ingresos con los que cancelara la deuda.
José sueña con tener más clientes y dar a su familia una alimentación y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
José has an automotive workshop. His business has won customers through good recommendations from those who already know his good work. He learned this trade because he needed a source of income to live on. José is married and has 3 kids who are 9, 8, and 4 years old, and who are in school. 
He is requesting capital to build an awning so he can offer better service to his customers and to keep his equipment and work from getting damaged by the sun or rain. He hopes to have new customers so he can have better income with which to repay the loan.
José dreams of having more customers and giving his family a quality education and good food.

loans.use: to build an awning to offer a better service to his customers and to keep his equipment from getting damaged by the sun or rain.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is 50 years old and has seven children. Matea is married and one of her children is still in school.

She is a farmer and specializes in pig fattening in the Philippines. Matea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Matea has been pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

Matea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marieta Visitacion

texts.en:
Marieta Visitacion is a 54-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom still goes to school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marieta Visitacion has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been doing for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jay Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Binati is aged 27 and is a self-motivated active women entrepreneur from Darlo village, near Titlagarh of Balangir district of Odisha, India. She is a very hard-working lady who is standing second from right with a raised hand in the photo. She resides with her husband, one son and one daughter of seven and nine years old respectively.

Binati’s husband is a good carpenter and has been running his business for the last ten years. He makes various types of funiture for domestic use as well as for official use. At present the monthly income is 4,500 INR. This income is not at all meeting the monthly expenses of Binati.  

In order to develop the business further, she formed a group of nine like-minded members of her locality and applied for loan from Mahashakti. From this loan she will purchase some tools and machinery for carpentry. Binati hopes to construct a permanent cabin for the business of her husband and a good house for her family. 

The other eight members are doing vegetable vending, carpentry, tailoring and paddy business.

loans.use: to purchase some tools and machinery for carpentry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soup, eggs, oil, detergents, basic staple foods, soft drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
For the last 11 years Stellamaris has been in crop farming, as well as dress making as a secondary business, and earns a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is 42 years old, married to Peter and is blessed with two school-going children.

Stellamaris has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use it to buy more fabric for her dressmaking.

She will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and start a school for dressmaking.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for farming and fabric for dressmaking

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is 46 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines, and has done this for four years. Rosaly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She also earns additional income from food vending.

Rosaly is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is a married man with four children, living in Masindi, Uganda.  He provides a grass cutting service and sells clothes to increase his income.  He started this business to improve his standard of living, but finding customers is a challenge. He wants a loan to buy another lawn mower.  Mario desires to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another lawn mower.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria, es una persona que trabaja día a día para generar ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades básicas de su hogar, es viuda, vive con sus dos hijos de 20 y 22 años de edad, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella; su negocio es la venta de tortillas, el oficio lo aprendió dentro de su familia, hace más de diez años que lo desempeña como una fuente de ingresos, la ventaja de su negocio es la preferencia de los clientes.
Apolinaria requiere un crédito para comprar maíz, cal, leña y gas propano, con estos insumos la productividad de la tortillería será mucho mayor, sus ingresos mejoraran cada día y satisfacera las necesidades de sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar su negocio, cancelar su deuda y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Apolinaria is a woman who works day in, day out, to generate income to cover her household necessities. She is a widow and lives with her 2 children who are 20 and 22 years old and who are economically dependent on her. Her business is selling tortillas, and she learned this trade from her family. She has been doing this as a source of income for more than 10 years. Her customers' loyalty is an advantage for her business.
Apolinaria is requesting a loan to buy corn, lime, wood, and propane to increase the productivity of her tortillería, to improve her income every day, and to meet the demands of her customers. 
Her aspirations are to improve her business, to cancel her debt, and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, wood, and propane to increase the productivity of her tortillería.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por pedir nuevamente apoyo a través de un crédito para comprar nacazcol, arcilla, barro crudo y leña para cumplir con las nuevas demandas de piezas de loza y que sus clientes estén satisfechos.
Los créditos le han dado un buen resultado al invertirlos en su negocio, manifiesta que la rentabilidad es mejor y tiene nuevos clientes.
texts.en: María has decided to ask for more support through a loan to buy nacazcol (a black dye), clay, raw mud and firewood to meet the new demands for pieces of pottery so her customers will be satisfied. She has gotten good results by investing the loans in her business. She says that she is making more of a profit and has new customers.

loans.use: to buy nacazcol (a black dye), clay, raw mud and firewood to meet the new demands for pieces of pottery

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es: Sergio de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante por las colonias aledañas, tiene mucha clientela porque el producto es de buena calidad, Sergio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor para continuar con las ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Sergio is 44 years old and lives in a house he owns with his wife and their three children. He makes a living by selling popular medicine. His business is located in his home and he also sells in an itinerant fashion in the neighborhoods adjacent to him. He has a large customer base because the product is of good quality. Sergio is asking for a loan to buy more popular medicines wholesale to continue with his sales and thus be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more popular medicines wholesale

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Jose de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de agua de coco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado a la orilla de la carretera sus principales clientes son los automovilistas, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cocos por mayor ya que ese negocio lo genera buenos ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his family. For three years he has been selling coconut water, his business is located at the roadside so his main customers are motorists. 

Jose is asking for a loan to buy more coconuts wholesale, as his business generates a good income enabling him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa. She previously borrowed 20,000 PHP to buy raw products and seasonings for her spring roll business. Her earnings were a big help for expenditures (business and personal) and for the education of her children.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marissa dreams to give her children a good life by sustaining their educational needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she also can draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her spring roll business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies. Sally has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Sally would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon is 43 years old and has two children who are in school.

Corazon has a recyclable materials business in the Philippines and has been in business for nine years. Corazon requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more recyclable materials to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman who is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has four children who are in school. Julia has a prepaid mobile load business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional cellphones and load for her business.

Julia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Julia would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cellphones and load for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 42-year-old  married man with 4 children living in Masindi_Uganda, he sells clothes to the general public.

He started the business to increase  his income but inadequate capital hinders his business plans.  He desires to have better standards of living for his family.

He wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene clientes ya establecidos que la prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, la joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young women whose face is blurred because she is 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area makes a living by selling clothing in an itinerant fashion in various neighborhoods. She has established customers who prefer her for the quality of the product and the good prices. She lives in a house owned by her family. The young woman is asking for a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to continue with her work and thus have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 40-year-old married woman with three children,  two attend school.

Virginia has been in the agricultural business for 2 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 1 time from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feedsand vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a 34-year-old married woman with six children, five attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eugenia has had a vegetable vending business for 5 years.  Eugenia requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Eugenia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Johnmary

texts.en:
Johnmary used his previous loan to buy more produce to sell. He is a married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still deals in produce, selling coffee, millet and maize as his main source of income. He also has other side businesses, such as hiring out plastic chairs, through which he earns extra income. He started these businesses to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces the challenges of competition and weather changes that affect his produce business. 

Johnmary has a vision of owning a big modern store in the future. He is requesting a loan to buy more produce like coffee, millet and maize.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell, like coffee, millet and maize.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a twenty nine-year-old hard working married woman with an 11 year old child, they  live in Kamwenge Uganda. 

She started a retail shop to improve her standard of living and earns additional income farming and operating a mobile money business. She hopes to own good rental houses but lacks the capital to meet the increasing demands. 

Patience requests a loan to buy soap, bags of sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, bags of sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is a 55-years-old married woman from Kulashi village. She lives with her two school-aged sons and mother-in-law, who receives a pension from the local government. Tina is a nurse at the local hospital and generates 200 GEL monthly. She is also involved in agribusiness, harvesting nuts seasonally and selling them locally. The income is hardly enough for food for a four member family.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. This hardworking woman somehow has great desire to increase her family's living condition and to generate more income. Tina requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor. This group does not have access to credit products and is regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low their income.

With the received credit, Tina plans to purchase stock of various home products and to start trading business locally. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family.

loans.use: to buy home products for trading.

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 47 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Judelyn has had a selling dry goods business for 7 years and requests 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase pillows and kitchen ware to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Judelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pillows and  kitchen ware to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nilda is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Nilda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, fish, noodles, etc. for her business.

Nilda has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, fish, noodles, for her business.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Dromo Naa and their average age is 40.  They live in the same area in Chorkor. 

They sell children's clothing, second hand clothing, and assorted soap. They work with the ID-Ghana micro finance institution to support their businesses. This is their forth loan with this institution and fully intend to repay it. 

Agartha will use her loan to buy more children's clothing to sell at Accra. She buys from the wholesale market and sells in Accra. She is 38 years old and has three children. She expects to achieve a good monthly profit from this loan. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also take care of her daily expenses. 

They need a total amount of 3,400 GHS to buy enough to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothing and sell it at Accra.

loans.name: Ma. Geovilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Geovilyn is a hard working woman with four children.  She is 25 years old and has three children who attend school.

Ma. Geovilyn has had a fish vending business for 3 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Ma. Geovilyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Skin Success Group

texts.en:
Secelia, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, two daughters and one son; two of them are in school and one is still small. She has been selling charcoal for one year now.  She also sells clothes door-to-door. She works form 06am to 05pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Secelia's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of building a family house.

Secelia will share this loan with her loan group "Skin Success" which consist of four member who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 31 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school and Maxima works very hard to provide for them.

Maxima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc.

Maxima has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Maxima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 54 years old and married with one child. With her child still in school, Natividad works very hard to provide for them.

Natividad runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Natividad has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, biscuits, soft-drinks, canned goods, cereals, sugar, etc. 

Natividad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 64-year-old single mother with four children.

Alice is a dairy farmer and sells second hand clothes to earn an income. She has been a dairy farmer for fifteen years. 

She has greatly benefited  from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development and has turned the farming business into a profitable venture. She intends to expand this enterprise by buying quality dairy feed to enhance milk production.  This will enable her keep up with milk demands in Limuru Kenya. 

She hopes for improved income to help her easily meet her family's needs. 

Alice is thankful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, four attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lydia has had a handicraft business for 20 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase shells and wire for her business.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase shells and wire for her business.

loans.name: Mangorano Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is John, eighteen years old. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from trainings on enterprise and financial management.

John does vegetable farming of tomatoes and kale. He is borrowing a loan to purchase fertilizer to help boost his vegetable farming. He hopes this will increase his profits and in return improve his living standards such as comfortable shelter and quality clothing.

He is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued support.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, eggs, oil, detergents, sweet bread, candy, drinks, etc., all wholesale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, con el préstamo anterior ha mejorado la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes, se ha mantenido trabajando para tener recursos económicos con los que puede cumplir con sus compromisos, mantiene el mismo núcleo  familiar.
Está requiriendo un nuevo crédito para comprar sandías, ayote, dulce de atado y variedad de bebidas, ofrecerá fruta de temporada para tener ingresos extras y continuar mejorando las circunstancias económicas y familiares.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Maria improved the selection of goods offered to her clients. She keeps on working to get the income needed to meet her obligations. She provides for her family as before.

She is requesting a new loan to buy watermelons, pumpkins, sugar cane sweets, and a variety of drinks. She will offer seasonal fruit to increase earnings  and continue improving her financial and family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, pumpkins, sugar cane sweets and a variety of drinks. She will offer seasonal fruit to increase income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María de 42 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos, dos  de ellos asisten a la escuela, el otro le ayuda al padre en la elaboración de rocolas.  María solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, su esposo tiene un vehículo en el que realiza viajes particulares.

Desde hace 5 años María administra su propia tienda, su madre le enseño como administrarla, se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana hace el desayuno, luego manda sus hijos a la escuela. El resto del día lo dedica a la tienda. Pero también para esta época de fin de año ella cría pollos de engorde para que salgan para la fecha de diciembre.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 100 pollos de engorde y tres quintales de concertado uno de inicio de crecimiento y dos del concentrado final.  Esto le ayudara mucho, ya que con el crédito anterior compro unas láminas de la casa y de la galera en donde tiene los pollos y 50 pollos.

En un futuro le gustaría construir su casa de ladrillo, actualmente vive en una de adobe; pero esto lo lograra con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo de ella y el esposo.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old, she is married and has three children, two of whom attend school and the other helps their father making jukeboxes. María was only able to complete the 9th grade. Her husband has a car that he hires for private travel.

Maria has run her own shop for 5 years that her mother taught her how to manage. She gets up at 5am every day, makes breakfast and then sends the children to school. The rest of the day she works in the shop. For the end of the year she is also raising chickens to fatten so that they will be ready by December.

The loan she is asking for from CREDICAMPO is to buy 100 chickens to fatten and three quintals of chicken feed, one for early growth and two for later feeding. This will help her a great deal, as with her previous loan she bought steel sheets for her house and for a chicken pen where she has 50 chickens.

In the future she would like to make her house brick built, she currently lives in an adobe house, however this will require a great deal of work and effort for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens to fatten and three quintals of chicken feed, one for early growth and two for later feeding.

loans.name: Poth's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Poth is now 47 years old and married. She has seven children, four of whom are dependents. Poth and her husband are farmers who grow rice as main business to support the family and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for 11 years, they are able to make daily earning of 65,000KHR and manage to save about 35,000KHR each day. 

This is the fifth loan for Poth with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice plantation and also grow her crops healthily to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Sor is 60 years old and a mother of nine children. To support her living, she grows rice and soybean with the aim of earning extra income. Sor can earn about 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of two to get a loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay labor costs, buy fertilizer and insecticides in order to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: To pay labor costs, buy fertilizer and insecticides in order to support her farmland.

loans.name: Yeurn's Group

texts.en:
A villager in Kampong Cham province, Yeurn is 62 years old and a father of four children. He overcomes his family’s hardship via growing vegetables (cucumber) and selling Vietnamese Crepes. He can earn almost 25,900 KHR per day from his income-generating activities. 

This is his fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has successfully repaid his past loans. Now, he leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds. He hopes that he can gain a good yield from cucumbers to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Yoeurn is 45 years old and a mother of five children; two of whom are in school. She earns income to support her family condition via rice cropping. Moreover, she works as construction worker to earn extra income. She can earn about 33,300 KHR per day. 

This is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. As a leader group of four, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can gain a good yield to improve her family condition.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pouy's Group

texts.en:
Pouy, 40, is single and lives with his child in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee and he has been in this business for 10 years. He earns about KHR60,000 per day and is able to save about KHR30,000 each day after expenses for future needs.

Pouy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now he is leading his group ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to renovate his old house. He hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. She sells clothes and has been in this business for 2 years.
 
She will be using this loan to buy clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans well. Her future hopes are to expand her business and live a stable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: Doña Elida de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene mucha clientela, Doña Elida está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Elida is 62 years old and lives in a house she owns with her family. She makes a living by selling clothing for women, men and children; she sells in an itinerant fashion in various neighborhoods and has a lot of customers. Elida is asking for a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to continue with her work and thus be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 41-year-old lady with 7 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells firewood and at the same time does farming. 

She has hopes of educating all her children to higher levels of learning like the university. 

She has asked for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a forty-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He carries out cattle-fattening, a business he started with the intention of generating funds to satisfy the demands of his family and to improve his standards of living. 

He also earns additional income from farming. He hopes to become rich although he faces a challenge of diseases that attack his animals.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
A local resident of Kampong Cham province, Sim is 55 years old and the mother of three dependent children. She grows rice on a two hectares area as her main source income. She also earns extra income via chicken and duck-raising. Based on this, she can earn income of about 42,500 KHR per day to support her family's basic needs. 

For Sim, this is her second loan with VisionFund; she has fully repaid her past loan. A group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a good yield and support her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary, 43, is a farmer living in Kampong Cham province and is single. For her living, she grows rice on a two hectares area.  This is her only source of income to support her condition. 

This is first loan for Sary with VisionFund. She if leading a group of two to get the new loan. As the leader, she will use the loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve her rice farm. In the future, she strongly hopes that she can expand her farm to make it larger than it is now.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to improve her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. His father works as a taxi driver where he gets a low and unstable income. His mother works as a teacher in a public school. Mohammad is a student in his second year where he studies marketing. He would like to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his studies faster.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a Food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and married with six children.  

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilith

texts.en:
Lilith is 34 years old with two children, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lilith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk, etc.

Lilith has been in this business for a year. 

In the future, Lilith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 48 years old and married with five children. With three children currently in school, Antonieta works very hard to provide for them.

Antonieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, beer, candies, etc. to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, beer, candies, etc. 

In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, beer, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 48 years old, married, and has two children. With one child still in school, Diosdada works very hard to provide for her family.

Diosdada runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like eggs, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell.

Diosdada has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, etc. 

Diosdada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like eggs, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, sanitary pads, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. Narcisa is in agricultural business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Narcisa has been doing this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Narcisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 50 years old and has two children who are still in school. Emma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emma has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Emma has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Moreene

texts.en:
Moreene who used her previous loan to buy fresh food to sell is a hard-working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She still deals in fresh food sales, as well as farming. With the proceeds from her business activities she has been able to pay school fees for her children and boost her business. 

As a good mother she wants to educate her children so they attain degrees (as a minimum qualification) and set up sustainable, income-generating activities to secure their future. Like most traders in this business she is challenged by a high rate of perishability. Her business goals are to buy refrigerators and also diversify her business to include dry foods. 

Moreene intends to use this loan to buy fresh food like tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food like tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a married man with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and salary earner. He faces challenges of limited capital. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Eric needs a loan to buy herbicides for the crops.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for the crops.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, se dispone a sembrar por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo para poder comprarse abono, semilla e insecticidas para mejorar los cultivos de maíz y ayote, espera que su cosecha sea abundante para recuperar lo invertido con mejores utilidades.
Don José ha fortalecido su negocio, tiene un nivel de vida más confortable, las circunstancias económicas van cambiando favorablemente esto es posible por la buena administración del crédito anterior.
texts.en:
José is preparing for sowing, for which he is choosing to take out a new loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to improve his corn and pumpkin crops. He hopes that his harvest is plentiful to recoup his investment with greater profits.

José has strengthened his business, has a more comfortable standard of living and his economic circumstances are changing for the better. This is possible because of the good management of the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy fertlizers, seeds and insecticides to improve his corn and pumpkin crops.

loans.name: Mirna Roxana

texts.es: Mirna de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hijo de 13 años en casa propia, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de frutas y verduras, su puesto lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes fijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas fruta y verdura por mayor para poder tener mas mercadería y asi obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirna, 31, is a single mother.  She lives with her 13-year-old son in her own house.

She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for five years.  Her stall is located in the town market.  She has a lot of steady customers.

Mirna's requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale so she'll have more merchandise and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 56 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with six children. She is a cash crop farmer and has been in this business for 11 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting and also cultivate her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her farming and become successful in life.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is 52 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 7 children. She is a farmer in Oloitoktok town, where she grows crops to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years now. She will be using this loan to buy seedlings for planting in her farm as well as to plough her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's school fees. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting as well as to plough her farm.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Teresita is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them. Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as eggs, canned goods, deodorant, sugar, bread, biscuits, cereals, creamer, coffee and more. Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years now and sells a variety of items such as eggs, canned goods, deodorant, sugar, bread, biscuits, cereals, creamer, coffee and more. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks for resale like eggs, canned goods, deodorant, sugar, bread, biscuits, cereals, creamer, coffee and more

loans.name: Shephali

texts.en:
Shephali is a resident of Dhupguri.  She is a 46-year-old who lives with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters) in Madhya Barogari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Two of her children are receiving education, one is pursuing her bachelor degree and other is in grade 10. But the son works in a saloon. She is a homemaker who looks after her children and husband and also manages her household jobs. In her spare time she helps her husband in his work.

Shephali's husband, Paresh, is a cultivator. He cultivates his land and grows vegetables.  But he wants to grow paddy on his farmland, as his current income from vegetable cultivation is not very satisfactory. His income can hardly cover the household expenses and educational expenses of his children. So Shephali, who is an enthusiastic woman has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner)

She intends to use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure for paddy cultivation and also to pay for good quality seeds. She wants to improve their agribusiness using this loan. She hopes that with it they will be able to improve its conditions and get better results from it so that next year their harvest will be better and will improve their economic stability and their family’s well-being.

She wants to purchase more lands from the profit generated from the business and provide support to her children for education.

Shephali and her husband are grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Celistina

texts.en:
Celistina is 56 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Celistina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Celistina has been in pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 48 years old, a married woman who stays with her husband Bijen and three daughters in Khalaigram, a small village of Dhupguri, West Bendal.  Sabita has completed her education up to grade 6. Sabita is a housewife and her husband is farmer. Due to poverty Sabita could not send her daughters to school. 

Sabita’s husband grows varieties of crops on his farm land and sells them on the market but his income is very low and inconsistent. Thus Sabita and her husband decided to grow paddy on their farm land to earn more income as paddy is the most demanded and profitable crop in West Bengal. They hope they can earn a good profit from this crop. 

Thus Sabita has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy better quality of seeds, fertilizer, pesticide etc. which are required for cultivation of paddy. She dreams of building a concrete house for them in future, with the profit from her business.

Her earnest and heartiest thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Kanaka Mahalaxmi - 1 Group

texts.en:
In 2010, four women from Muniguda village located in Rayagada district of Odisha, India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family by their contribution. They formed a group to avail themselves of credit facilities from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing business. Ladi is one of them who is standing second from left with a raised hand in the photo. 

She is 38 years old, living with her husband and one son and one daughter aged about 18 and 20 respectively. She has been running a grocery shop for the last seven years with the support of her husband and earning about 7,500/- INR p.m. But it is not at all sufficient to meet the monthly household expenses. Both the children are going to college also. In near future Ladi is planning to marry her daughter.  

To increase sales she wants to increase the stock of her grocery shop with the support of the Mahashakti loan. From this loan she will purchase rice, wheat, soap, shampoo, washing powder, tea, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions, etc.

The other three members are doing seasonal seed business, transportation business and a saloon.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, soap, shampoo, washing powder, tea, sugar, salt, potatoes, onions.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, dos nueras y sus dos pequeños nietos. María se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tortillas desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. María y su familia habita en condiciones muy humildes y poco a poco van mejorando sus condiciones con el apoyo de financiamientos. María desea encementar el piso de la cocina y además construir un pequeño pasamano para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este apoyo a FUSAI para invertir en los materiales de necesarios como: arena, cemento y ladrillo para proceder a la construcción de las mejoras.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in her own home together with her two children, two daughters in law and her two small grandchildren.

María has for a long time earned her living selling tortillas which enables her to provide for her household. María and her family live in very humble conditions and little by little are improving their living conditions with the help of loans.

María wishes to cement the floor of the kitchen and also construct a small seating area, for which she has taken the decision to ask for this help from FUSAI to buy the necessary materials like sand, cement and bricks to proceed with the construction of these improvements.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to cement the floor of her kitchen and also construct a small seating area.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 18 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,es agricultor, pero en estos meses se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado, vive en casa propia con sus padres, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de la casa, el joven está solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez es para comprar más ganado para poder continuar con la crianza ya que esa es única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The young man whose face in the photo is blurred is 18 years old and he lives in a high risk zone.

He is a farmer, but these months he is raising cattle. He lives at home with his parents, and with the earnings from work he helps with the household expenses.

He is requesting a loan again, this time to buy more cattle to be able to continue the breeding. This is his only source of work. He may thereby achieve a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Joan from Nandi Hills in Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming but she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married and together with her husband, is blessed with two lovely children. For the past 5 years, she has been practicing mixed farming.  Because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from her fellow farmers and she is regarded as a mentor. The income from milk, eggs, and tea selling have allowed her to earn a decent income. To earn extra income, Joan engages in a small personal business.

Joan passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on her farm have been given names of “Seroi.” Milking and feeding Seroi (the name of her cow) makes her very proud. Through milk selling, she has had quite good returns and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers, then sending text messages to her customers when milk is ready for collection, and because of using ICT, she has had a comparative edge in her dairy business. Demand has been overwhelming and she needs an extra breed of cow to satisfy fully the demand. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Joan does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow but she wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will be producing between 15-20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate to more income and Joan will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school going children. 

When anybody listens to Joan speak, one would be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming but because of her passion and determination she intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change Joan's living standards and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Hilter

texts.es:
Hilter es una padre de familia con una esposa amorosa, y un hijo de 16 años quien es el motor de su vida para salir adelante, desde hace muchos años se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de cacao en su ciudad natal, San Martin. Él sale muy temprano a trabajar, y regresa a su casa al anochecer porque cree que cada cultivo es importante y tiene que darle el cuidado necesario para que sus frutos sean excelentes.
En esta ocasión Hilter quiere comprar insumos para abonar sus plantas, es por ello que destinará el crédito para comprar dichos insumos. Él se siente muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto mejorará sus ingresos y podrá pagar la educación superior de su hijo porque quiere que su futuro sea mejor y tenga una profesión.
texts.en:
Hilter has a loving wife and a 16 year old son, who is his driving force to get ahead in life.  Hilter has been growing cacao in his native city, San Martin, for many years.  He leaves for work very early, and he returns home at nightfall.  He does this because he believes that each crop is important, and he needs to give the crop the care that it needs so that its production will be excellent.

Hilter now wants to buy supplies to fertilizer his plants.  That is why he will use the loan to buy said supplies.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that this will improve his income, and he will be able to pay for his son’s higher education.  He wants his son’s future to be better and for him to have a profession.

loans.use: to buy organic supplies to fertilizer his cacao crop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 50 years old, married, and has seven school-going children. She has been farming for the last 27 years and earns a monthly income of 8,500 KES.
	 		
She has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy chemicals and water pumps for farming activities.
 
Ruth will use the anticipated profits to provide for her family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be a great farmer.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and water pumps

loans.name: Darlin Miguel

texts.es: Darlin, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio del negrito, Yoro junto con su conyugue e hijo. Darlin es una persona trabajadora el realizaba trabajos de jornal y de albañilería. Y por necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos decidió  tener su propio negocio de venta de jugos naturales como jugo de caña, naranjas, tamarindo, nance y de otras frutas de la temporada. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y también venta ambulante. El préstamo que solicita a la institución es el tercer ciclo y es por 5,600 Lempiras con el cual va comprar materia prima como ser caña, naranjas, tamarindo, otras frutas, azúcar y bolsas para elaborar los jugos y venderlos en bolsa. Con esta inversión mantendrá los insumos necesarios para tener siempre el nivel de ventas y obtener ingresos. Sigue con su plan de hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Darlin, 23, has a child and lives in the town of El Negrito, Yoro, with his wife and son.  He's a hardworking person who was working in construction and as a day laborer.

He needed to earn a better income, so he decided to have his own business selling natural juices such as sugar cane, orange, tamarind, nance, and other seasonal fruit.  His business is in his home, and he also sells on foot.

The loan he's requesting from the institution is his third cycle.  He's asking for 5,600 lempiras [HNL] to buy ingredients such as sugar cane, oranges, tamarind, other fruits, and sugar to make the juices, as well as bags to sell them.  With this investment he'll have the necessary supplies to always have sales and earn an income.

He's still planning to expand his business and earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane, oranges, tamarind, other fruits, sugar, and bags

loans.name: Anointing Group

texts.en:
The Anointing Group consists of five members who live in Chorkor, Accra-Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 2,200 from ID Ghana to invest in an electrical welder, bakery, kenekey (cook corn dough), charcoal, fish and slippers. 

Sekina is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Chorkor, Accra-Ghana with her family. She is the featured borrower. She has been selling charcoal for 11 years. Currently, she wants to buy two bags of charcoal but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 400 from ID Ghana in order to purchase two bags of charcoal and sell them to customers. She looks forward to improving her business.

The group members will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of charcoal and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Jafina

texts.en:
Jafina is a very young woman from Dhupguri.  She is only 22 years old, married, and a mother of one son. She is married to Majibul, a 23-year-old farmer.  They live in the small village of Kholaigram in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Jafina attended school till ninth standard. Their son is too young to go to school. 

Jafina is a homemaker who looks after her child, does all the household work, and in her spare time helps her husband in his farm work. Her husband is a farmer. He is engaged in farming, growing rice and vegetables. He has farmland which is his investment and inheritance from his parents. He struggles hard to grow good quality produce. He is a person who is looking to his family's well-being. But the income generated from the farming is not sufficient to cover all their expenses. They want to grow more paddy rice in order to earn more profits.
