So Jafina requested a loan from BJS to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for paddy cultivation. They believe that the loan will help provide all of their farming needs and in that way they will obtain higher revenues.  They will be able to improve the well-being of their family.

Jafina wants to upgrade their present house with the profit earned and she is thankful to her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy rice.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, thirty-nine years old, married and blessed with three children whom she lives with. She operates a tree seedling business.

She is borrowing through Kiva to boost her business by buying more variety of seeds. She hopes that this loan will help maintain and attract more customers. She looks forward to more income, hence being in a position to cater for the family needs such as clothing.

Grace is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase tree planting seeds.

loans.name: Maa Rama Chandi Group

texts.en:
Pushpanjali is the leader of a group located at Muniguda village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is 47 years of age and lives with her husband and one son 25 years of age. She is a very active lady and wants to bring happiness and prosperity to her family.

Pushpanjali has been running a grocery shop with the help of her husband for the last 15 years on the roadside of her village. She sells biscuits, toffees, soap, shampoo, washing powder and food items in her shop. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her business. She has been managing her family with this small amount as best she could. 

The existing business was very small at the beginning. The sales were very little as the investment in her business was very little. So she decided to expand her business.  She motivated other three women of her locality and formed a group during 2009 and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She used this loan for purchasing daily needs items for her shop. The sales of the shop increased and also the profit. 

This will be the third loan cycle for the group. From this loan Pushpanjali will purchase some grocery items like oil, soap, biscuits, chocolates, shampoo and food items. She hopes that this investment will generate more income and will help her to build a house for her family. 

The other three members are doing leaf plate making, embroidery work and a salon.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like oil, soap, biscuits, chocolates, shampoo and food items

loans.name: Chhabi

texts.en:
Chhabi hails from Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri District. She is 39 years old and a mother of one son. Her husband is a cultivator by profession. Her son is in grade 10. They live in their own small mud house in College Para, in Dhupguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Chhabi’s husband is a farmer who grows different crops. He works in unity with his wife in the field. Now they decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland but they lack the capital.

Thus Chhabi is requesting this loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy fertilizers, paddy seeds, and herbicides to grow paddy. Chhabi wants to purchase more land and save money for her son’s education with the profit from her business. 

She thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila, age 51, is a hardworking housewife from a small village of Dhupguri. She studied up to grade 5, she could not got opportunities for further education due to a lack of financial resources from her parents. She is married to Baburam, who is 62 years old and with whom Sushila is rearing two sons. She is living with her husband and her two sons in a small mud house. Sushila could not provide much education to their sons, now they earns for their family. One sells lottery tickets and other is associated with farming activity. 

Both Sushila and her husband have been involved in agricultural activity for many years. They have good knowledge of paddy rice cultivation and vegetable cultivation. They are currently growing paddy rice. They grow good quality rice. That's why they have achieved a good many customers. To satisfy their customer demand and for an additional income they want to grow paddy in a larger quantity.

Thus Sushila has applied for a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner). She has requested this loan to expand her agriculture activity. She will use the loan to buy good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers etc. which are necessary things for paddy cultivation. Her ambition is to enlarge the business to a large scale.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and other agricultural inputs for their paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a 36-year-old married mother of two children who opened a mini market three years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing living  expenses of her family. 

Her business is going on just fine, but her family’s increasing needs stop her from expanding and developing her work sector. That’s why she turned to an external financial support to make necessary developments.

Today, Jeanette is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially for the coming winter season, to satisfy the needs of her customers and thus improve her family’s living conditions. She hopes that one day she can develop her store to a bigger shop, and diversify the merchandise provided.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially for the coming winter season

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 41 years old and has six children who are currently in school. Juliet has a general store business in the Philippines. Juliet has requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further grow her business. Juliet has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 27 years old and single. In 2012, Mohamed established his food market. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself. Working seven days a week, for 13 hours a day, he earns about 600,000 SLL a month.  Mohamed is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, he plans to build a bigger shop and to become an international businessman.
Mohamed extend his sincere thanks and appreciation to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc to sell

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe, 32, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Fe has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Maria Fe requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more accessories to sell. In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor because the one he had was burned in an electrical storm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: G.s. Pueblo Nuevo 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Víctor, tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y dos nietos, vive con su esposa y familia en una comunidad de Florida, Copan cerca a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 30 años de cultivar maíz, frijol y café. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para la familia. La producción que saca la vende a intermediarios de la zona. Don Víctor ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para mantener en buen estado sus cultivos. El préstamo es en forma grupal y lo va invertir en la compra de abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra por limpieza de los cultivos de café, maíz y frijol. A futuro su meta es comprar un terreno para cultivar mas café, aumentar las ganancias y darle una mejor vida a su familia. 
El grupo al que pertenece se llama Pueblo Nuevo 2, integrado por cuatro personas, que se dedican a la agricultura de granos básicos y viven en la misma comunidad. Solicitan un préstamo en grupo por 75,000 lempiras para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y granos básicos y poder sacar mejor cosecha este año. En la foto esta María Virginia a la izquierda, sigue María Dolores, Elvia y Víctor a la derecha.
texts.en:
Víctor, age 55, has three children and two grandchildren.  He lives with his wife and family in the Florida, Copan community near Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  He has been growing corn, beans, and coffee for 30 years.  This business activity is his source of income for the family.  He sells the production that he gets to intermediaries in the area.

Víctor has requested a loan for 22,000 lempiras to keep his crops in good condition.  The loan is a group loan, and he will use it to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides and to pay for the labor to weed the fields of his coffee, corn, and bean crops.  In the future his goal is to buy a piece of land to grow more coffee, to increase the earnings, and to give his family a better life.

The group that he belongs to is called Pueblo Nuevo 2.  It is comprised of four members who grow basic grains and live in the same community.  They are requesting a loan for 75,000 lempiras to provide maintenance on their coffee and basic grains crops and to be able to get a better harvest this year.  

In the photo María Virginia is on the left, followed by María Dolores and Elvia.  Víctor is on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and herbicides and to pay for the labor to weed the fields of his coffee, corn, and bean crops.

loans.name: Jagadish

texts.en:
Jagadish is an artist, a paddy farmer and a BCA graduate, proficient in designing software and volunteering in socio-developmental activities related to farmers and women's empowerment. A full-time farmer and paddy craft designer, he lives with his parents and helps traditional paddy farmers in scaling up this activity. 

Jagadish is a volunteer at Sahaja Samrudha, guiding farmers in creating new designs and shapes to promote paddy bunting. Traditional paddy varieties are becoming extinct because of mono cultures of selected improved varieties. People have shown immense interest in buying 'Paddy Bunting' for its attractive, decorative and conservative value, but it is primarily made out of traditional paddy varieties with poor productivity and market penetration. 

Through this concept, many traditional paddy varieties can be revived and introduced into the market which in turn benefits the farmers who conserve these varieties. In the past, the borrower has given new shapes to these paddy-bunting objects such as paddy-bunting frames, glass cages, etc.    

Jagadish is seeking a loan of INR 50,000 for manufacturing paddy bunting (paddy crafts and decors). He dreams of starting an exclusive rural enterprise to train more traditional farmers on paddy arts and crafts and increase the market value for paddy crafts to a larger scale.

loans.use: for manufacturing of paddy bunting (paddy crafts and decors)

loans.name: Geetanjali

texts.en:
Geetanjali is a 30-year-old married woman from Dhupguri. She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is in grade 7 and her daughter is in grade 1 in the local village school. Her husband Sanjib is engaged in agricultural activities. He is a farmer by profession. 

In India agriculture is a profitable business, most of the people earn by doing agricultural activities and farming. Geetanjali‘s husband also choose this business for their livelihood. Sanjib plants potatoes, carrots, beans, and gourds etc. on his farm land. Geetanjali also assists her husband in agricultural work. She enjoys farming activities. They sell their products in the local village market. Now with the growing needs of the family, he needs to increase his cultivation. So he has decided to cultivate paddy, the much demanded crop in his region.

So Geetanjali has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use this loan to purchase paddy seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers so that her husband has a good harvest this year. Some of her biggest dreams are to provide good education to her children. Geetanjali wants to save money from the business profit for the higher education of her children. She would like to see her children get a proper education and grow into professionals in the future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs (seeds, fertilizers, pesticides) for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa, trabaja día con día en su tienda de productos de primera necesidad y elabora pupusas para vender, en la tienda tiene un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m.; mientras que la venta de pupusas la elabora los días sábado y  domingo, además tiene un contrato informal de transporte escolar; Rosa es casada, vive con su grupo familiar integrado por ella y sus dos hijos.
Necesita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, bebidas, especias, detergentes, quesillo, gas propano y otros productos que le sean de utilidad para mejorar el inventario del negocio y la elaboración de la venta de pupusas,  espera tener mayor clientela, mejores ventas e ingresos, el riesgo es una mal selección de productos que no sean del gusto de sus clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son establecer mejor el negocio de transporte para tener una vida mucho más digna y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Rosa works day to day in her store selling staple products. She also makes pupusas to sell. In her store the schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m, and she sells pupusas on Saturday and Sunday. She also has an informal contract for school transportation. Rosa is married and she lives with her family group made up of her and her two children. 

She needs the loan to buy basic grains, oil, spices, detergents, fresh cheese, propane gas and other products useful to improve the inventory of the business and to sell pupusas. She hopes to have more customers, and better sales and income. The risk is a bad product selection that her customers won't like.

Her goals are to better establish her transportation business to have a more dignified life and to pay off the acquired debt.

loans.use: to buy basic grains. oil, beverages, spices,  detergents, fresh cheese, propane gas, and other products that will be useful to improve her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats for rearing.

loans.name: Twiteganyirize Cb Group

texts.en:
Eline Is a group leader aged 41 years. She is married with four children aged between 12 and 21 years; all of them go to school. The group is called TWITEGANYIRIZE which means “Let us save.” They sell different items, but they have a common goal of improving their standards of living. 

Eline has been selling foodstuffs for the past 12 years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and groundnuts for resale. The profit from the business will be used to pay the school fees of the children and to renovate their house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron equipment and materials for his iron workshop

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: The person in the photo is Cyrus. He is sixty years old, married and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012, to be trained on enterprise management, which has greatly sharpened his business management skills. He does vegetable farming and also operates a general shop. His goal is to expand his enterprise by adding more stock such as sugar, flour, cooking fat and other household items. This makes him borrow a loan to finance his planned expansion. He hopes to make more sales, hence more income. Cyrus plans to use the profits to pay for his children's education. He highly appreciates the support that Kiva and their lenders have offered.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat and other household items.

loans.name: Rupali

texts.en:
Rupali is a married woman 28 years old. She received education up to grade 11. She lives with her husband, Mukul, and one little son in their own kachha house (mud and straw made) in small village of Khalaigram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. 

Rupali's husband is a farmer; he is a hard worker and a very enterprising man. He works in their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow varieties of crops according to the seasonal demand. He sells them in the local market and earns money for their livelihood. 

Now they decided to grow paddy rice in their land, as paddy is the staple food in their area and it is the best time to grow paddy.

Thus Rupali requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, manure etc., so that her husband can grow good quality paddy rice in their land. 

Rupali's hopes and dreams are to be able to expand their business to give good financial support to her family, give a better life to their son and purchase a piece of land from the profit generated from the business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for growing paddy rice.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is 26 years old, married and raising two children (one son and one daughter) together with her husband. Their son and daughter read in grades 3 and 1, respectively. Sandhya and her husband have a respectful relationship with each other. They live in a small village of Dhupguri in a small mud house.

Sandhya's husband, Akshay, is 30 years old and a farmer by profession. He grows different crops and sells them in the market. Sandhya is a very hardworking and purposeful lady. 

In this era it is really difficult to run a family by one’s earnings. Thus Sandhya has been engaged in a milk supply business for last few years to give financial support to her husband.

Now she wants to expand her business to satisfy the demands of her additional customers. She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase a cow, with an aim to further develop her business. There is a high demand for milk in the locality, so she hopes to earn enough money from her business to enable her to give good financial support to her family and a good future to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for expanding her milk supply business.

loans.name: Elsi Maribel

texts.es: Elsi de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos, con las ventas que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra, para poder cambiar el techo que muestra la fotografía ya que está muy dañado y asi puedan vivr mas seguros con su familia.
texts.en: Elsi is 47 years old. She lives in her own house with her two daughters and her mother. She sells snack food, and with what she obtains from her sales she is able to cover some household expenses. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, but what she earns isn't enough. That is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy sheeting, beams and to pay for labor costs so she can change the roof that is seen in the photograph. It is very damaged and this way she and family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, beams and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 46 años de edad, viuda, madre de un niño de 11 años y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es independiente, perfeccionista, buena madre, responsable, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ de su ciudad, un lugar caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores provenientes en su mayoría de poblaciones de occidente y algunas etnias cercanas que emigraron a la ciudad (al centro pantalón oscuro, blusa floreada, abrazando un bolsón). Debido a su necesidad por expandir y mejorar su negocio, formó una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares para solicitar un préstamo.
Reyna es de tez morena, cabello obscuro largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y conoce el guaraní por herencia familiar. Su trabajo es la sastrería dónde su creatividad y experiencia se ajustan a la medida de los clientes. Entre paños, linos, agujas y moldes han transcurrido los últimos 4 años de Reyna, ella confecciona pantalones, faldas y chaquetas a medida y también modifica todo tipo de prendas de vestir según el capricho de sus clientes, conciente de la importancia del buen vestir, disfruta tanto de su trabajo que hasta se siente diseñadora y sugiere a sus clientes, con creatividad, sobre la ropa que pueden usar. Ella tiene una mesa de corte, donde comienza la aventura; con agilidad, precisión y rapidez, cualidades a las que le suma esmero y dedicación, esas manos ven el resultado: una prenda de vestir hecha a la medida. En su espacio de trabajo, ella necesita; una máquina de coser tipo familiar, una fileteadora y una máquina plana industrial. 
Su sueño es tener un taller bien equipado para atender al público, ella desea expandir su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de costurar.
Es por esos motivos que Reyna solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de costurar y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 46 year old, widowed mother of an 11 year old son. Her business is tailoring. She is independent, a perfectionist, a good mother, responsible, enterprising and very hard-working. She does her work in the 'Plan 3000' neighborhood of the city. This area is known for the multiculturalism of it's inhabitants. The majority of them come from the West of the country and some local ethnic groups that emigrated to the city. (Reyna is in the center of the photo with dark pants, a flowered blouse holding a handbag.)

Due to the need to expand and improve her business she formed a communal bank with people who have different businesses and similar needs to request a loan. Reyna is dark-skinned, with long black hair and medium stature. She speaks Spanish but knows Guarani from her family. Her work is dressmaking where her creativity and experience adjust to the demand of the client. She has spent the last four years amongst cloth, linen, needles and patterns. She makes pants, skirts and jackets to measure and also modifies any type of clothing according to the whims of her clients who are conscious of the importance of dressing well. She enjoys her work so much that she feels like a designer and creatively suggests to her clients what clothing they should use.

She has a cutting table where she begins the adventure, with agility, precision and speed, qualities that add up to care and dedication. Her hands see the result, a made to measure article of clothing. In her work space she needs a normal sewing machine, a serger and a flat lock sewing machine. Her dream is to have a well-equipped shop to serve the public. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of a sewing machine. For these reasons Reyna is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and expand her business.

loans.name: Shiddanagouda

texts.en:
Shiddanagouda resides with his parents, grandmother and a younger sister in a palm-thatched house. He owns three acres of rain-fed land, and he grows chick pea, onion, garlic, safflower, tomato and chilly under organic conditions.

Shiddanagouda completed a diploma in social entrepreneurship and then joined Sahaja Samrudha NGO as a field coordinator. At present, he is managing day-to-day activities of a Savayava Krushikara Balaga initiated organic outlet at Hubli.

Savayava Krushikara Balaga is a marketing platform for small millet growers of Hubli, Dharwad, Haveri, Gadag and Belgaum. He is very focused on promotion of millet and organic vegetables to create a market for value-added products from them.

Shiddanagouda is requesting a loan of INR 50,000 to establish a millet and organic vegetables outlet in Hubli, which will help him to increase his income.

He hopes to bring in more agro-diversity, inspire farmers and youngsters to shift to organic agriculture, and establish an organic outlet exclusive for millet and organic vegetables.

loans.use: to establish a millet and organic vegetables outlet.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 23-year-old woman. She has been running a hand embroidery business for 5 years now. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and the income allows her to contribute towards the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones in order to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Robina dreams for a bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is living in a rented house with her family. With the help of this loan, she will be able to make customer orders more quickly.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for catering more customers

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. 

In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is very famous in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns two buffalo. She takes good care of her children with the income of her business. 

She wants to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk production. Therefore she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase milk production for generating more income. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk production.

loans.name: Maroofan

texts.en:
Maroofan is a 49-year-old married woman. She has four children. 

To provide her children quality food, clothes and education, she started her business of a general store. Now she has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 that she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.name: Wendani Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2014, Wendani Self Help Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on enterprise and financial management. The person raising her hand in the photo is Verister, who is fifty-nine-years-old, married and blessed with five children. She lives with two of her children. Verister does vegetable farming, where she grows tomatoes, carrots and kale. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizers and pesticide. This will help improve her crop yield, hence more supply to the market. She looks forward to improving her income. This will help her continue supporting her children's education and meet her day to day expenses. Verister is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alive For Health Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members who formed the group called Alive for Health. It is made up of members who get on very well and work hard. They live in the same neighborhood and sell utensils, distilled water, groceries and spare parts. 

Margaret is 57 years old. She is married and all her children are grown up and taking care of themselves. She will use her loan to buy utensils and distilled water from the market to sell to customers in Chorkor. She has been doing this job for 13 years. This her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana, which indicates that she is very loyal, because all her previous loans have been repaid successfully. 

She uses her earnings to take care of her family expenses and ensure the smooth running of her household.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy utensils and distilled water to resell.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  

She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand for earning a good amount of income.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, married and blessed with four children.  

She raises vegetables such as cabbages, carrots and onions. 

She is applying  for a loan to buy fertilizer to help improve her crop yield. She looks forward to a bountiful harvest and thus more income. This will enable her to achieve her dream of large-scale farming, since she will plough back the anticipated profits to expand her activities.

Mary is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a business selling clothes for four years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. Nusrat requested a loan of 55,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy inventory of different clothes for the winter season in various sizes. She will take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season in various sizes

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 42-years-old married woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to her family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires large quantities of hair care products as well as skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening, so she has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history. Saima is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move towards a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 34 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for them. Arlene's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Arlene has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Arlene has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labour. Arlene is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un hombre de 45 años de edad, casado, sin hijos y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es independiente, constante, responsable, paciente y muy trabajador. Su labor la realiza en la comunidad ‘Pajchiri’ situado a orillas del lago Titicaca, la temperatura del lugar es fría durante todo el año y los rayos solares extremadamente fuertes.
Marcelino es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el aymara y habla español según sus necesidades de comercio. Su trabajo es la pesca de especies nativas y otras introducidas, como; el suche,  mauri, Karachi, pejerrey,  trucha y el ispi. Su rutina comienza con los rayos del sol, para introducirse al lago durante varias horas hasta pescar la cuota diaria y retornar a su hogar. Su vida la comparte con su esposa quién también colabora en el negocio encargándose de la venta. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida para traer más miembros a su familia. El desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos realizando una inversión en la compra de redes de pesca y refacción de bote.
Es por esos motivos que Marcelino solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar y refacción de bote para cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a 45 year old married man who has no children. His business is fishing. He is independent, consistent, responsible, patient and very hard-working. He does his work in the community of Pajchiri on the shores of Lake Titicaca. The temperatures here are cold all year and the sun's rays are very fierce.

Marcelino is dark-skinned, with short black hair and thin in build. His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for business purposes. His work is fishing native and non-native species like Suche, Mauri, Karachi, Ispi, silverside and trout. He starts his routine with the first light of the day. He goes out on the lake to fish for a few hours daily and then he returns home.

He shares his life with his wife who also helps with the business taking care of sales. His dream is to improve his quality of living in order to add more members to his family. He wants to increase his economic revenues by making an investment purchasing fishing nets and repair his boat. For this reason Marcelino has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and to repair his boat to fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair his boat.

loans.name: Omega Group

texts.fr: Ceru est commerçante, présidente  de la banque communautaire Omega, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 6 enfants et tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de ses parents. Elle est vendeuse des friperies dans un marché secondaire de la ville depuis  son jeune âge. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Ceru is a merchant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and the president of the banque communautaire Omega. She is 45 years old, married, and a mother of six children, who all go to school. Her husband is unemployed.

Ceru has worked selling used clothing in a town market since she was younger. She started this business with funds that she received from her parents.

[With this loan], she is going to buy one bale of used clothing.

Ceru wishes to receive more loans, buy a piece of land, and feed and school her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 23-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years now and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo for increasing milk sales, in order to cover her household expenses more efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for increasing milk sales in order to cover her household expenses more efficiently.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 43-years-old married woman and a mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Tahira’s husband, who deals in the business of selling different jewelry items to the people of his community. In this way, he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet their family expenses. In order to meet their everyday expenditures, more income is required so Tahira has contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of 40000 PKR. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase more items including earrings, rings, bracelets and bangles in order to inflate sales. Tahira is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items including earrings, rings, bracelets and bangles in order to inflate sales.

loans.name: Kamunyaka Hope Well Women Group

texts.en: The person raising her hand in the photo is Leah, who is forty five years old, married and blessed with four children. She earns her living by practicing vegetable farming. Leah is applying for a loan to buy manure to boost her vegetable farming. She looks forward to an improved crop yield, hence more supply. This will lead to increased income, thus Leah will be in a position to pay the school fees for her children. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en: Sultana is a 58-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, has been running a business selling cloth. Sultana buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Her husband is jobless and her son is employed with low salary income. Sultana is working hard to support her family and run her household expenses smoothly. Currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Sultana expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: José Heriberto

texts.es:
José es un pequeño caficultor que trabaja y vive en la zona rural del norte de Nicaragua. La zona es de difícil acceso y la comunicación por teléfono celular casi nula. Gracias a su esfuerzo para mantener a su familia; esposa y 4 hijos, PAC lo ha beneficiado en 5 ocasiones con créditos que ha sabido administrar y cancelar en tiempo y forma.
José se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 6 años, su pequeña finca cuenta con un área productiva de 4.9 Ha. de café, y con 8.4 Ha. de extensión territorial. Esta actividad agrícola es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta él y su familia, es por ello que este año ha decidido aumentar el área productiva de café, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para la renovación de 0.4 hectárea de café. 
Es importante señalar que José ya cuenta con capital propio invertido para este nuevo proyecto, sin embargo necesita el financiamiento para completar el 100% del capital demandado para todas las actividades. Su sueño es ir aumentando su producción de café a través de nuevas áreas, y de mejores rendimientos y calidad de su producto, para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a small coffee grower who works and lives in the rural zone of northern Nicaragua.  The zone is difficult to access, and cell-phone communication is almost nonexistent.  

He has received loans from PAC on 5 occasions, as part of his efforts to support his family, which comprises his wife and 4 children.  He has handled them responsibly and paid them off in a timely manner.

José has devoted himself to coffee growing for 6 years. His small farm has a productive area of 4.9 hectares (12 acres), and its land extends another 8.4 hectares (20 acres). 

This agricultural activity is the only source of income that he and his family have, and that is why he decided to expand the area of coffee production this year.  To this end, he is requesting a loan for the restoration of 0.4 hectares (1 acre) of land for coffee production.

It is important to note that José already has invested his own capital in this new project; however, he needs the loan in order to obtain 100% of the capital required for all of the work. 

His dreams include continuing to expand his coffee production into new areas, and obtaining better yields and production quality, in order to improve his family’s conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the restoration of a coffee field.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene 12 años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el joven solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This young man whose face has been pixelated is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He owns a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells a range of beautiful fine furniture, a job he's had for twelve years. He thanks God that he has managed to keep it running.

He lives in his own house with his family. Now he is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and other items that will enable him to attract more customers. Then he will be able to achieve his objective of improving his own and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane etc.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan has a retail shop in Emali town and also sells potatoes and fruits. She is 26 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children.

Joan will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes and bananas for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. 

In the future, Joan hopes to have a successful business, make more income and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 45 years old, married and has seven children, three who are in school.

Divina and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Divina is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Divina has been a NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Divina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 41-year-old, married woman and the mother of five. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of fancy and embroidered cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Now, Nasreen has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy additional stock of different cloths for the winter season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers in order to earn more income through her greater sales.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of different cloths for the winter season

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en: Manzooran is a 39-year-old married woman doing a business selling animals such as goats, with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 2 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats for resale. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats for resale.

loans.name: Shaarkul

texts.ru: Шааркул, 47 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Шааркул среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Шааркул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади. Дополнительно у Шааркул есть земельный надел мерою 3,50 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу, пшеницу, чеснок, реализуя продукцию местным жителям и оптовым покупателям. Благодаря упорному труду Шааркул, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шааркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Шааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shaarkul is 47 and married with four children. She has a high school education and a very good reputation among her neighbours, who call her a kind and hardworking woman. Since 2000, she has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture as the primary source of income for her family. She currently has four cows, 10 sheep and two horses as well as a 3.5 hectare piece of land where she grows corn, wheat and garlic for sale to local residents and wholesale buyers. Thanks to her hard work, her business brings in about 20,000 KGS per month, which serves to cover food and everyday living expenses for her family.

With the goal of further developing her business, Shaarkul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows. She plans to use profits from the loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase her headcount of livestock

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
19-year-old Nilima is a woman of bravery and strength. She hails from Dhupguri. At this tender age, she is married and the mother of one young daughter. They live in a small village in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal.

Nilima's husband, 23-year-old Md. Hamikul, is a farmer. His income is hardly sufficient for the family. So, to help her husband financially, Nilima runs her own animal husbandry. She sells cow's milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she gives support to her family and saves money for a secure future. However, this young, ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop at this; she wants to expand her business by purchasing more cows and wants to sell milk products, such as butter, curd, cottage cheese, etc.

Nilima seeks a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of this business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Nilima will be able to reach her goals, which include constructing a new and better house for them. 

Nilima's full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Collette est commerçante, membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Salama», âgée de 61 ans, veuve et mère de 9 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 7 sont déjà mariés. La cliente est vendeuse de boissons sucrées et cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans une avenue de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le capital reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Il y a 41 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 6 caisses de sucrés. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Collette is a merchant, a client of the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the Salama group. She is 61 years old, a widow, and a mother of nine children. Two of the children go to school while seven are already married.

Collette has worked selling soft drinks for 41 years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband when he was still alive. She displays her goods from home and from one of the town streets.

This new loan is going to serve to buy six cases of soft drinks.

Collette wishes to educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system, become independent.

loans.use: to buy six cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer for her citrus fruit trees

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 54 years old, married and together with her spouse has been blessed with five children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for seven years. 

She will be using this loan to buy a cow and thereby increase her stock of livestock. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming and be successful.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is 41 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with five children. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for 13 years. 

She will be using this loan to buy fertilizer and manure for use on her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Aminata. She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 2 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are assistants. 

In 2012, Aminata established her grocery store, selling mainly mayonnaise, Peak milk, sardines, drinks, etc. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town. Aminata’s store helps people in her community because they do not have to walk or travel far distances to the center of town to buy the same goods that she sells, particularly so because she offers the goods at the same prices.

Aminata has received and repaid in full two loans. She now needs another loan of 3,000,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) to help her purchase mayonnaise, Peak milk, sardines, soft drinks, and sugar.

Aminata used the income she generated from her last loan to pay school fees, buy learning materials for her children, provide food for her family, and she bought a deep freezer which she now uses to cool drinks for her customers.

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business.

In the future, Aminata plans to develop her business, educate her children and to help her husband build a dwelling house for their family. Aminata is very grateful for the support she is getting from you.

loans.use: To pay for more provisions.

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ramazani est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise Tujikaze, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 60 ans, mère de 9 enfants dont 8 étudient et 1 est marié. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de sa famille. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires à domicile  depuis 10 ans. Elle va acheter 30 sacs de farine de sorghos. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Ramazani is a merchant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the banque villageois Tujikaze. She is 60 years old, a widow, and a mother of nine children. Eight of the children go to school, while one is already married.

For the past ten years, Ramazani has worked selling basic foodstuffs from her home. She started this business with funds that she received from her family.

[With this loan], she is going to buy 30 sacs of sorghum flour.

Ramazani wishes to receive more loans and educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

To note, there is one group member who has her child with her.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacs of sorghum flour

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Five years ago, Joseph, 27 years of age, started practicing mixed farming in a small piece of inherited land in his rural town of Siongiroi. Today, he boasts of the great strides he has made in dairy farming. This ambitious father of one earns his livelihood through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from his farm. He also does some "side hustle" to make extra income. 

Although he makes profits from dairy farming, he is faced with challenges that might put him down. Cows in his farm are affected by harsh weather conditions; hence, they become sick. He also faces challenges of properly feeding and milking his cows. 

He is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Cows require a proper resting place and proper food so that they can produce the maximum amount of milk. Without a proper dairy unit, cows will be affected with diseases, and also, they will not have a good place to rest and feed, hence, a low production of milk. 

Joseph feels relieved knowing that there are partners such as Kiva lenders who assist aspiring men such as himself to achieve their dreams. With your loan Joseph is going to change his life permanently, and the increased income from high milk production will be used in paying back the loan fully and improving his living standards.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Hasena

texts.en:
Hasena is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of one son. She is married to Ajimuddin, who is a land cultivator. The family lives in Kholaigram village of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal.

Hasena's husband cultivates seasonal fruits and vegetables on their farmland. Hasena is a homemaker and also helps her husband with the farming. They usually sell their crop in the local market. Now they have decided to cultivate paddy, because this is a very profitable crop.

Hasena needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers. So she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS). This will allow her to cultivate paddy, which is a crop having great demand in the market, and increase her monthly turnover. This way, she can increase the profitability of her business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Hasena conveys her hearty thanks to her lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Chirunga

texts.en: Chirunga is a married man and he has four kids. Chirunga owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is fees for her school going kids. He has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door where passersby and town dwellers are his potential neighbours. He faces the challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season, when it becomes difficult to operate his business. With the Kshs 50,000, he wants to add on his savings and purchase a new motorcycle because the new motorcycle is expensive. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to add on to his savings and purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Doednath

texts.en:
Doednath is 51 years old and lives with his two school-age children. He cultivates rice for the care of his family. 

Doednath finances his fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production through Seva MFI and always repays his loan on time. 

Doenath wants to renovate his house now and asks a loan of SRD 6,000. With this loan, he will replace the old roof and old walls of his home.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Atuwezeshe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Fikiri est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise Atuwezeshe, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 30 ans, mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d’une institution de la place. Elle est vendeuse et propriétaire d’une boutique à domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle va acheter de divers articles des basins, seaux, cahiers, stylos, sardines, bougies etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Fikiri is a dynamic merchant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the banque villageois Atuwezeshe. She is 30 years old, married to a merchant, and a mother of one child who goes to school.

For four years Fikiri has been a merchant and she owns a shop at her home which is on a busy town street.

[With this loan], she is going to buy basins, scissors, notebooks, pens, sardines, candles, etc. 

She wishes to increase her line of credit and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs without access to banking services.

To note, some group members are holding their children [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy various goods, basins, scissors, notebooks, pens, sardines, candles, etc

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 48 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elena 's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending  and is committed to regaining what she lost. Elena is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to  purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Elena has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Listening to Joseph referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Joseph, from Kapsowar, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a wife and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops and personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Having done farming for such a long time he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Maasai tribe (Joseph’s tribe) - where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Joseph wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Joseph has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. Joseph always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” He has planted so many trees on his farm and dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. 

Through the loan, Joseph will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Joseph has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Joseph underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training season he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits Joseph plans to permanently improve his living conditions, and to secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of cow.

loans.name: Marcial De Jesus

texts.es:
Marcial, se dedica a vender hot dogs, de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el negocio lo inicio con la compra de un carretón en el que vende refrescos y panes; es parte de una familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos que dependen económicamente de él, también tiene un puesto de venta de ropa, en la que su esposa ya tiene experiencia en atenderlo.
Con la ayuda del préstamo que está solicitando comprara un nuevo carretón, que utilizara para cubrir otras zonas, contratara un ayudante, de esta manera su negocio ira creciendo, tendrá nuevos ingresos, podrá cancelar las cuotas en las fechas correspondientes y cubrirá las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Marcial sueña con mantenerse trabajando y tener un negocio exitoso.
texts.en:
.Marcial earns his living selling hot dogs from 7 am to 5 pm. He started his business by first buying a cart from which he also sells soft drinks and bread. His family consists of his wife and two children, all of whom are financially dependent on him. He also has a stall selling clothing where his wife is gaining experience helping him.

With the help of the loan that he is seeking, Marcial will buy a new cart to use in other neighborhoods. He will hire an assistant and in this way grow his business. He will have a greater income, be able to make his repayments on time, and pay for household necessities. Marcial's dream is to be able to continue working and have a successful business.

loans.use: Buy a new cart and hire an assistant

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 25 years old. He is not married. He has a shop and has been selling in a business for two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more books, pens, biscuits, and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens, biscuits, and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.en: Fatouma is 40 years old. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 8 and 16 years, all of whom go to school. Fatouma has been selling home furnishings such as beds and sofa sets for the past 5 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more chairs, cupboards, and sofa sets to sell. The profits will used to reinvest in the business and buy food for her household.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, cupboards, and sofa sets to sell.

loans.name: Tujenge Group

texts.fr: La cliente Luzizene est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédit Tujenge, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants, dont 3 étudient et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu  de son mari. Elle est vendeuses des denrées alimentaires au marché de la ville  depuis 1 an. Elle va acheter  40kg de farine de manioc et la tomate. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Luzizene is a mercant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the loan group Tujenge. She is 34 years old, married, and a mother of four children, of whom three go to school while the other one is grown.

Luzizene has worked selling foodstuffs at the town market for one year. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband.

[With this loan], she is going to buy 40 kilograms of cassava flour and tomatoes.

Luzizene wishes to buy a piece of land and educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy 40 kilograms of cassava flour and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and pay for labor for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
This is Teresiah, who is 44 years old, married and blessed with three children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain more skills in enterprise and financial management, which helped her realize her strength. She does vegetable farming of tomatoes, kale, cabbages and onions, and also dairy farming. 

She is borrowing money to purchase dairy feeds for her cows to help improve their production. She hopes this will lead to more milk supply and hence, improved income. This will enable her to cater for the family's needs, such as education for her school-going children.

Teresiah is very happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds.

loans.name: Mutumia Mwireri Group

texts.en:
The lady on the right hand side of the photo is Janet, a member of Mutumia Mwireri Group. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She is 38 years old and practices dairy farming to earn a living.

She is borrowing money to boost her farming by buying quality fodder for her cows, to help improve on their milk production. This will ensure she maintains a consistent milk supply in Limuru, Kenya, which will lead to increased and stable income. This will go a long way in ensuring she caters for her children’s school fees. Janet is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en: Feryal was born in 1975. She is a married lady who has been trying her best to provide her children with the best education. One of her children is a student, and Feryal wants him to finish his high school education so that he will be able to register at a university. Because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is an ambitious 22-year-old man whose aim is to become self-sufficient by finding a good job with a good income. He is a second-year university student, majoring in law. Ahmad doesn’t currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Therefore, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith has a retail shop in Emali town and has been running the business for six years. She is 40 years old and a single mother of one child.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar and beans to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her child.

This is Faith's third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future she hopes to grow her business and live a stable life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 43 years old and a single mother of four children who are in school. She does farming in Oloitoktok town, where she grows cash crops for selling. She has been in this business for 10 years, and right now, her monthly income is 3,500 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

She will be using this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for planting in her farm. She will also use part of the loan amount to cultivate her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with Vision Fund Kenya, and her future hopes are to expand her farming, make more income and be self-reliant.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and also cultivate her farm

loans.name: Akonkwa Group

texts.fr: Dadieme est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Akonkwa, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 40 ans, mère de 4 enfants et  tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle est vendeuse de carburant sur la route principale de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va acheter 40 litres de carburant. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de  signaler qu’une cliente son bébé.
texts.en:
Dadieme is a merchant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and the president of the banque communautaire Akonkwa. She is 40 years old, a widow, and a mother of four children who all go to school.

Dadieme has worked selling fuel on the main town road for seven years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband when he was still alive. 

[With this loan], she is going to buy 40 liters of fuel.

Dadieme wishes to obtain more loans, buy a piece of land, and educate and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support to entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

To note, one of the group members is holding her child.

loans.use: to buy 40 liters of fuel

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 54 years old. She is married and has five children, aged 18 to 25. One of them goes to school. 

Claudine has a shop and has been working in the business for three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more soaps, rice and sugar to sell. She will use the profits from the business to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 54 years of age, a hard worker who always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He is based in Kiangoso, a rural village in the rich highlands of Kisii. He is happily married and has been blessed with five angelic looking children. 

He has been practicing farming for the past five years, and has never looked back. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Kiangoso village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living through milk and egg selling and a personal business. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. 

Charles has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow, thereby enhancing his milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Charles is kindly requesting a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. 

Through the loan, Charles is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Charles is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

Charles, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Charles save more effectively, and through his accumulated profits, he plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Sadah

texts.en:
Sadah is a married woman and has been blessed with kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Sadah operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Sadah dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 34 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 11; three of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running the business for four years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more soaps, lotions and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, lotions and rice for sale.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is a 22-year-old lady living with her family of six in Ajloun, Jordan. Her father is a retiree who currently works as a taxi driver. Walaa is a fourth-year university student majoring in accounting. She is seeking to find a job in her field of study in order to help her family financially. She is applying for this loan to be able to pay for her upcoming tuition fees and reach her goal.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is a 22-year-old university student majoring in management information systems, and she is in her second year. She is planning to find a job in her field after graduation in order to become self-sufficient. Because she doesn’t currently have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for upcoming registration and semester fees for her university studies.

loans.name: Nayfeh

texts.en: Because Nayfeh is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Nayfeh is a 48-year-old married lady living in Baqaa, Jordan, with her husband and 2 sons and daughters. Her husband has been working as a junk seller for five years, and his income isn’t enough to cover their children's needs. Therefore, Nayfeh started helping her husband in improving his business to increase their income. She is seeking to open a showroom where she can increase her sales and expand her business in the future. She is applying for this loan to buy more junk that she can sell at a good price to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more pieces of junk to resell

loans.name: Sajeda

texts.en: Sajeda is a 22-year-old married woman living in Baqaa, Jordan. She has been selling clothes for one year to help her husband improve their living conditions and pay their household expenses. She is seeking to open her own clothes shop in the future, after expanding her business and building a good customer base. She is applying for a youth loan to buy a new collection of baby clothes that her customers have requested, in hopes of increasing her sales.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Ma. Cecilia, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Gilmore, a policeman, and she has three children. All her kids are in high school. She manages her own household while operating the business.  At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses. 

Ma. Cecilia operates a business selling school and office supplies. It is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, Cartolina, and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to obtain additional office and school supplies to increase her product inventory. She is positive that her sales and income will improve as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Ma. Cecilia hopes to be able to open an outlet for her school and office supplies. She dreams to give her family a better life and send all her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for office and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: M'balu

texts.en:
