This is 42-year-old M'balu. She is married and has three children, aged 19, 17, and 11 years old. She has one additional dependent who lives with her (her younger brother's daughter), and M'balu needs to support her for schooling.  

In 2001, M'balu established her rice business. She began this business to help her provide the basic needs of her family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 

With the profit generated during her previous loan, M’balu was able to pay school fees for her children and she established another outlet where she is currently constructing a house. One of M’balu’s children is now in college, pursuing a degree in business management.

M’balu has received and completely repaid five loans. She now requires a sixth loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more rice and cooking oil for resale.

In the future, M'balu plans to support her children’s education up to the university level and grow her business into a very large rice store, so that she can begin selling wholesale to other businesses. This business has helped M’balu in raising her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in further developing her business, so that she can save enough money for her children’s education.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 38-year-old, married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like Irish potatoes. He faces a challenge of limited capital. Also, he hopes of educating his children and expanding his agriculture enterprise. Robert needs a loan to buy land for further farming.

loans.use: to buy land for further farming

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bikanaba est commerçante, membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Naboti», âgée de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 1 est marié. La cliente est vendeuse de boisson locale et cliente de l’IMF Hekima. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans une avenue anumée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le capital reçu de son mari. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des ingrédients (maïs, manioc et autres). Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Bikanaba is a merchant, a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima, and a member of the Naboti group. She is 48 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Two of her children go to school and one is married.

Bikanaba has worked selling locally made drinks for 14 years. She sells the drinks from her home on a busy street in town.

This new loan is going to serve to buy ingredients (corn, cassava, etc.) [to make the drinks].

Bikanaba wishes to educate, clothe, and feed her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekmia for helping female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the traditional banking system, become independent.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (corn, cassava, etc)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Because Fatima is a conservative lady, she has asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Fatima was born in 1967. She is a married lady who has been running her own business selling home products for one year. 

Fatima is seeking to purchase more home products that will help her in raising her profit, but because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products to resell

loans.name: Rabia

texts.ru: Рабия, 54 года, разведена, мать 4 детей. У Рабии среднее образование, сейчас работает уборщицей. В качестве дополнительного дохода Рабия с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Рабии, ее хозяйство на сегодняшний день насчитывает 2 коровы, 1 бычка, 1 лошадь и 50 овец. Также есть 1,08 ГА поливной земли, где Рабия выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 6,000 сом (KGS), чего катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. Рабия хочет помогать своим детям в воспитании внуков. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки дойной коровы и бычка. Доходы от кредита Рабия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни.
texts.en:
Rabia is 54 and divorced with four children. She has a high school education and works as a cleaner. Since 1996 she has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry as an additional source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows, one steer, one horse and 50 sheep as well as 1.08 hectares of irrigated land where she grows barley for her own use. Her total monthly income is about 6,000 KGS per month, which is far from enough to cover living expenses.

Rabia wants to help her children raise her grandchildren. Therefore, with the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock by buying a cow and a steer. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of domestic livestock, in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a steer in order to bolster her income

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: Angeline est commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaire «Changamuka», âgée de 35 ans, mariée a un commerçant,  mère de 9 enfants dont 7 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché central depuis 17 ans et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 50 paires de souliers pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Angeline is a merchant and a member of the business group Changamuka. She is 35 years old, married to a merchant, and a mother of nine children. Seven of the children go to school and two are already grown.

Angeline has worked selling used shoes at the central market for 17 years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband. After, she sought a loan with the micro-finance institution Hekima.

[With this loan] she is going to buy 50 pairs of shoes to increase her business.

In the future, she plans to buy a piece of land and educate her children.

She thanks Hekima for their support of small-scale entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

To note, some of the group members are holding their children [in the photo].

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land and build a good house.

loans.name: Valentino

texts.en:
Valentino is a fifty-eight year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He has a retail shop business where he earns a living, although he also does coffee planting to earn himself an extra income. He started this business to improve his standard of living. He has challenges of competition and inadequate capital to meet the high demand, while his dream is to diversify his business.

He intends to use the loan to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, soda, and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt, beer, soda, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 27 years old and married with 4 children aged between 2 and 13 years old. She grows maize to sell as her main source of income alongside other food crops. She also started  a retail shop to increase her income to protect against price fluctuation, inadequate capital and weather variations that affect her business.

She wants a loan to plough and weed her garden to get good yields.

loans.use: to plough and weed her garden to get good yields.

loans.name: Mukonyezi Mixed Farmers Group-Bujogoro

texts.en:
Violet is a 32-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda with 4 children. Since 2000, she has grown maize and ground nuts for food and for commercial purposes. 

Violet hopes to educate her children and she is requesting a loan to buy maize and ground nuts for planting. She is a member of Mukonyezi Mixed Farmers Group-Bujogoro where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and ground nuts for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to boost his tea plantation

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is an honest married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. A civil servant and a farmer for 14 years, he has a dream of educating his children to a level of independence and sustainability. 

Wilson is faced with a challenge of limited capital and so is requesting this loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needed agricultural inputs for corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Nyumbata

texts.en:
Nyumbata is married and the mother of five school-going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyumbata has operated a retail shop for the past three years. She sells household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from her home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Nyumbata dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, junto a su compañera de vida tienen un hijo, José se responsabiliza de trabajar para proveer de todo lo necesario a su familia; se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, oficio que aprendió dentro de su familia. Hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en su negocio.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar abono, herbicidas, semilla e insecticidas, tendrá los insumos necesarios para cultivar maíz, espera tener una buena productividad con la que pueda abastecer a su familia y tener mejore ingresos, su dificultad es que tiene que pagar arrendamiento por las tierras en que trabaja.
Sus aspiraciones son cancelar su deuda, que sus esfuerzos den resultados positivos para tener un negocio con progreso constante.
texts.en: José is in a relationship and together with his life companion has a son. José is responsible to work to provide all the needs of the family. He works in the fields cultivating basic grains, a trade that he learned from his family. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and insecticides so that he has the inputs he needs to grow corn. He hopes to have good production so that he can provide for his family and have more income. His problem is that he has to pay rent for the land he grows on. His hopes are to pay off his debt and that his efforts create positive results so he has a business that is continually progressing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
This is Marisol, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a driver, and they have two children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to provide for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Marisol has a direct-selling business. She sells cosmetics and beauty products like lotion, powder, cologne, cleaning agents, underwear, and other products through popular brands like Avon, Natasha, and MSE. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than shown on in the customer catalog and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every week.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan, which she will use to buy merchandise and place orders for beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries, and undergarments for her customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality. Marisol thanks God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that she will receive.   

Marisol dreams of having an outlet for all of her direct-sale personal products to further improve her sales and income. She dreams of sending her children to the best schools until college. She prays for a happy and quiet life for her family. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for personal beauty products and household cleaning agents

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio, a 58-year-old resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines, is married to Adella and has three children, only one of whom is in school. He works hard to provide for the everyday needs of his family.

Bonifacio had been in the tailoring business for 10 years already, mainly offering lace, curtains, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. He is known to be a good tailor in his community and so has regular customers. He also sells fish and fresh meat on the side. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of Php15000 a month in labor and sales.

To help him improve his business, Bonifacio is requesting an 8000 Php loan to buy more fabric, thread and other items.  He thanks God and you in advance for the financial assistance. His additional earnings resulting from the loan will a big help in sustaining his family's daily needs.

Bonifacio hopes that his business will grow.  He dreams to give his family a better future and be able to send his children to school. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric for tailoring.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 57 year old Hawa.  She is a widow and has 1 child aged 34 years. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her for the purposes of schooling.  In 1987, she established her local food stuff business selling garri, beans, groundnuts and rice. She began her business because she wants to assist in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women.

Hawa has just completed repaying her second loan and needs a third loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to help her purchase more bags of rice, groundnuts, beans and garri for resale.  Hawa used the proceeds from her last loan to buy building materials for the house she is building in her home town where she hopes to spend her old age.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 750,000 SLL every month. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit and improve her business. 

In the future, Hawa plans to complete building her house. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts, beans, garri, rice, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Her name is Violeta. She is 55 and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a carpenter, and they have two children. Together they work to meet their daily personal and household needs and school needs.

Violeta operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. She also sews pillows for added income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 11,500 in sales a month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting for an PHP 8,000 loan, which she will use to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.
  
Violeta hopes to grow her business so she can give her family a better life.  She dreams to send her children a good school until college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Bertilde

texts.en: Bertilde is 46. She is married with 2 children, ages 22 and 4 years. Both of her children go to school. She has a bar and has been working in this business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a sixty-year-old hardworking married man with five children aged 16, 14, 10, 4 and 1 living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in banana growing as his main source of income alongside the growing of coffee, watermelon and beans. He started these businesses in order to improve his standard of living. His main challenges are pests and diseases, however, he has hopes of expanding and improving his farm.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan to hire laborers to harvest coffee.

loans.use: to hire laborers to harvest coffee.

loans.name: Abesiga Masaka Farmers Group

texts.en:
Paskali is a forty-two-year old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

His main business is farming, alongside beer selling. He started this business to increase his income and have a better standard of living.  He has challenges of bad weather, debtors, and inadequate capital. However, he has a vision of increasing the size of his farm and becoming a model farmer. 

He is requesting a loan to pay his workers and buy seedlings for his farm. He is a member of Abesiga Masaka Farmers, where they have group guarantorship.

loans.use: to pay his workers and buy seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Suzin

texts.en: Suzin is 31 years old and married with two children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Suzin sells pork, and he also buys and sells coffee to earn additional income. He has a dream of being the leading pork dealer in the area despite his limited capital, which hinders the achievement of his dream. Suzin wants money to buy pigs for slaughtering and selling.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughtering and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries for her food sales.

loans.name: Somean

texts.en:
Somean is 18 years old and a student at university. She lives with her parents in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. 

Due to a lack of finances, Somean would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for four years. This loan will help her graduate and achieve her dreams. 

In the future, she wants to be a high school biology teacher.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is 50 years old and married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has operated for 12 years. Sylivia began the business to improve the welfare of her family. Sylivia has a dream of owning a shop of her own of new clothes. She is hardworking though faced with the challenges of high costs of transport and bad weather.  Sylivia needs money to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 32-year-old woman. She is married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Janet has operated a restaurant since 2008.  She began the business in order to have a source of income to look after her family. Janet is a hardworking woman with a dream of expanding her business, however, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital. Janet wants money to buy a fridge and to meet the clients’ satisfaction by serving them cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is thirty seven years old, married with three children and living in Kasese Uganda. 

He is a farmer, dealing in commercial farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, cotton and vegetables in order to generate income for his family and earn a living. He also runs a salon for men. 

Emmanuel is a honest man with a dream of expanding his business and fighting poverty.  However, he is faced with a challenge of floods and too much sunshine. Emmanuel wants money to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gehobanis Antonio

texts.es:
Gehobanis de 33 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado 3 hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad.

Gehobanis se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño un tío que siempre lo apoyaba a él y así fue como aprendió el oficio pero también Gehobanis por las tarde se dedica a la venta de pan en una motocicleta por los cantones aledaños,  en este trabajo de la panadería le ayuda al hermano y en la mañana hace el trabajo de la agricultura desde las 7 am a las 11 am.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para  comprar dos vacas que le venden unos familiares, que por el momento están un poco flacas pero que en pocos días se pueden engordar y tendrá ganancias y si salen buenas para la leche dejarlas para que le den leche a la familia y hacer queso.  

Los sueños que tiene son siempre poder cultivar  la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, poder tener su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Gehobanis is 33 years old and only studied until the third grade.  His wife works in the home, and they have 3 children who are 8, 5, and 3 years old.

Gehobanis has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  His uncle who he always helped out taught him this work, and this is how he learned the business. In the afternoons, Gehobanis works selling bread on a motorcycle on corners in the area.  In the bread-selling job, he helps out his brother, and in the mornings he works in agriculture from 7:00AM until 11:00AM. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is for the purchase of two cows that relatives of his are selling.  At the moment they are a little thin, but in a few days he will be able to fatten them and he will have a profit.  If they turn out to be good for milk he will keep them so that his family can have milk and make cheese.     

He has dreams of always being able to farm and have enough to support his household, and to have his own bakery.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 43 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their school age.  Celestina is has been engaged in operating a sari-sari store business for 18 years already. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. The said amount is so helpful to meet their family needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable product for retail. Celestina has been a member of PMPC for almost seven years. In the future, Celestina hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Evelyn has maintained her membership in good standing without record of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale, and to repair her house for a safe and decent living. Evelyn wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional hogs for commercial sale and to repair her house.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more water purification materials such as plastic and the chemicals for treating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Umaru. He is married, and has two children, ages 5 and 14.

In 2012, Umaru established his grocery shop. He began his business because he was trained in business and has a large family to care for. He mainly sells mayonnaise, butter, powdered milk, peak milk, sugar, and water. 

Working seven days a week and eighteen hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from his business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Umaru requires a loan to buy mayonnaise, butter, powdered milk, soft drinks and pure water to sell. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. 

In the future, Umaru plans to build his own house and educate his children to the university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, butter, powdered milk, soft drinks, and pure water to sell in his store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age.  Lydia has been engaged in a hog fattening business for four years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two piglets, one sack of booster feed and one sack rice bran for her hog fattening business. Lydia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lydia hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets, one sack of booster feed and one sack rice bran.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, 24 years old, is a married woman who lives in Pursat Province of Cambodia. She has only one dependent child who is currently in school. She is an active farmer on a small rice farm that is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers, she can make an income of 10 USD per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this career for six years. 

Dina wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Virginia Lisseth

texts.es:
Virginia, posee una tienda de productos básicos para el hogar, nace por iniciativa propia y por necesidad de contar con recursos económicos para cubrir sus diferentes obligaciones, la apertura de su negocio la realizo hace 6 años, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche; su estado civil es soltera, vive con dos hijos de 26 y 20 años de edad.
Invertirá en pastas, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, pan, detergentes entre otros productos, que le ayuden a tener un negocio más competitivo, cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y a seguir teniendo ingresos para resarcir su deuda y cubrir las necedades familiares.
Virginia anhela tener un negocio más grande y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Virginia has a shop of basic home products. Born of her own initiative and the need for economic resources to cover her various obligations, she opened her business 6 years ago. She attends to her customers from 6 in the morning to 7 at night. Her civil status is single. She lives with two children ages 26 and 20 years old.
She will invest in pastas, basic grains, drinks, candy, bread, and detergents among other products, that will help her to have a more competitive business, to cover the needs of the customers, and to continue having income to repay her debt and cover the family needs.
Virginia longs to have a larger business and to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to invest in pastas, basic grains, drinks, candy, bread and detergents among other products, which will help her to have a more competitive business

loans.name: Ma. Annalyn

texts.en:
Ma. Annalyn is 51 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Ma. Annalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Previously, she has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Ma. Annalyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 38 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Previously, Sandra has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Sandra aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
The group made their final payment of their previous loan to MUK on time. We heard many stories from the field; many of the group were successful in breeding their pigs. The pigs grew well and did not get any disease. At that time, they were able to sell the pigs at a satisfactory price and the group earned some profit. 

Ni Luh, also raises pigs for fattening. She sold her pigs after managing them for 5 months. She said thank you to all the Lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support. Now she can improve her income and support her husband. Ni Luh has a dream to renew her house when there is enought profit to do that. That’s why she is saving. 

After successfully paying off the last of their previous loan, the group is proceeding with the purpose of improving their businesses. Ni Luh, head of the group, is the coordinating member in the purchase of piglets. She is ensuring that all members get good piglets. With this loan, she bought three of a local variety of piglets that are sold every 2 months for pig barbeque. 

From the results of this effort, she hopes to buy new floors for her homes. Her current floors are cement.

loans.use: to purchase three of a local variety of piglets.

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is from Panalsalan, Plaridel, Philippines. He is 47 years of age, and he and his partner have 3 school-age children. In 2014, he joined Paglaum MPC. He appreciates the programs and services of the co-op.  

Rico is an industrious fisherman who is devoted to his fishing activities. He personally sells his catch in different barangays in the municipality of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He also buys the fish caught by his neighbors. His motorcycle was his only source of transportation to sell his fish at the different barangays. 

Buying and selling fish for 2 years now, Rico needs additional working capital. He is requesting a loan from Paglaum MPC for 7,000 PHP to purchase another boat engine, increase his catch, and improve his income. 

As a result, Rico hopes to be able to provide for not only the daily needs of his family but also support the cost to educate his children, this being the main purpose for all of Rico's hard work.

loans.use: to purchase another boat engine for catching more fish.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 44 years old. She is married and has one child who is in school. Carol works very hard to provide for her family.

Carol runs a general store in the Philippines. For the past fifteen years, she has been selling a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries. She is requesting a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Carol would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nayuma

texts.en:
Nayuma is 46 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Nayuma works very hard to provide for them.

Nayuma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Nayuma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sok Y

texts.en:
Sok Y, 27, lives in a remote area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of one little child who is enrolling in school. 

To make a living, Sok Y manages and operates a farming business on a piece of small farmland which is located near her house. On her farmland, she grows soybean and banana trees.  It is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business and earns, on average, an income of 7 USD per day. 

Currently, she is lacking money for farming supplies. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in her farming.

She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL and she hopes that this loan will help to increase her family's profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
In 2009, Ramon saw an opportunity to turn a passion into a business. A sports enthusiast, he developed a technology to make it easier for sports fans to track players and sports equipment (like the bat or the ball). Ramon believes “that would enhance the fan and coaching experience and generate revenue by licensing the data.” Ramon and his wife live in Florida, and it has been difficult for Ramon to find the same caliber of technology investors as one would find in Silicon Valley.

Ramon’s company, Sports Traxx (www.sportstraxx.com), has developed a following among elite professional sports organizations – a diverse group (from University of Connecticut to AFC Ajax) have found their patented technology provides an edge to their athletic programs. Now, Ramon needs a loan to pay for the marketing and branding needed to create a professional image. He wants his company to be taken seriously and wants to make sure his website and marketing material reflect the quality of his business idea. 

Let’s help Ramon change the game!

loans.use: to develop a marketing strategy for his company, Sports Traxx.

loans.name: Jurina

texts.en:
Jurina is 37 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Jurina works very hard to provide for them.

Jurina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jurina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future Jurina would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 52 years old and is a widow with five children. With four children in school, Lilian works very hard to provide for them.

Lilian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lilian has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Lilian would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Ines

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos, ella estudio hasta sexto grado porque la situacion de la guerra no le permitio seguir adelante academicamente, su esposo se gana la vida vendiendo paletas y sorbetes por los cantones. Su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan a vender golosinas, frutas y bebidas en la cancha de la comunidad, ella se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para enviar a sus hijos a la escuela. 

María tiene una tienda aparte de la ventesita que saca a la cancha, con esos ingresos tratan de sobrevivir ya tiene tres años desde que empezo con una pequeña venta hasta que logro invertir cada vez un poco mas y gracias a Dios a logrado darle estudio a sus hijos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar pan, embutidos, detergentes, azucar, frijoles, làcteos, etc. para su tienda.

Sus sueños es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profecinales graduados de la universidad, y en un futuro desea arreglar su casa tambien.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, is married and a mother of 3 children.  She studied until the sixth grade; because of the war she could not get ahead academically.  

Her husband makes a living selling ice cream and ice pops on the street corners.  Her husband and children help to sell candy, fruit, and drinks at the sports field in town.  María wakes up at five in the morning in order to send her children to school.

María has a store apart from the stand that they have at the field, and they try to survive on these incomes.  Three years ago she started with a small stall until she could invest a little more, a little at a time, and thanks to God, she has been able to give her children an education.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy bread, cold cuts, detergents, sugar, beans, dairy products, etc. for her store.

Her dreams are for her children to continue school and and become professionals, university graduates, and in the future she wishes also to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy bread, cold cuts, detergents, sugar, beans, dairy products, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 48 years old. She is married and has five children, one of whom is in school. Nicanora works very hard to provide for her family.

For the past eight years, Nicanora has run a general store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items in her store such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. Currently, she is requesting a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Nicanora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Analie has requested a 4,600 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Analie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Gea

texts.en:
Gea, 42, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Anthony and has one child who is in High School. She works hard to provide for the everyday needs of her family. Gea has been in the dressmaking business for a number of years already.

Gea is a sub-contractor of dresses to a Ladies' store in her area. She regularly makes dresses for them and has a high demand especially during special occasions like Graduation day, Mother's Day and Christmas season. She is known to be a good sewer in their area. She earns a minimum of PHP 9000 a month.

To help her continue and expand her business she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy more fabric, thread and other items needed. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. Her earnings are a big help in sustaining her family's daily needs. 

Gea hopes that her business will grow. She dreams of giving  her family a better future and being able to send her child to the best school until College. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fabrics, and thread.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José es un señor que trabaja de electricista, de albañil y en la agricultura. Él aprendio varios oficios y le a servido de mucho para sobrevivir. Esta casado y a procreado 6 hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de tamales y a veces a engordar pollos para vender, de sus hijos solo tres viven con él a quien les brinda estudio, ademas tiene 4 nietos en su casa.

El oficio de electricista lo aprendio trabajando con técnicos y en algunas capacitaciones y decidio dedicarse un poco de cada cosa, lo importante para él es sacar adelante a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar herbicidas, abono etc. para evitar que le afecte la plaga al frijol.

El futuro que él espera es seguir trabajando en varios oficios y darles estudio a sus hijos para que se conviertan en profecionales y volver a ver a sus hijas que viven fuera del pais
texts.en:
José works as an electrician, a bricklayer and a farmer. He learned different trades and it has helped him survive. 

He is married with 6 children. His wife sells tamales and sometimes she also fattens chickens to sell. Only three of this children live with him. They are still studying. He also has 4 grandchildren at home. 

He learned his electricians trade working with technicians and through some training. He decided to dedicate himself a little bit to everything. What is important to him is to make sure his family is OK. 

He is requesting a loan to buy herbicides, fertilizer etc. to ensure that the plague does not effect his bean crops. 

In the future he hopes to keep working in different trades and give his children an education so that they can become professionals. He also hopes to see his daughters who live abroad.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer etc. to ensure that the plague does not effect his bean crops.

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae works hard to provide for her 2 children. She is married and owns a general store in the Philippines.

Anna Mae is requesting a loan of 4,600 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is buying the lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Anna Mae is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money. Anna Mae knows she is also helping the environment and reducing many health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 42, is married and has 2 children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income through running a general store in front of their house. 

Hai started this business 6 years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

Hai hopes his business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock his store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers for her bananas.

Marilyn has been farming bananas for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her home before winter

loans.name: Arjuna Group

texts.en:
Arjuna group is a new group, and the members have various businesses, such as small kiosks, religious article sales, farming, and animal breeding. Arjuna group has 10 members. 

Ni Wayan, a housewife, is the Treasurer of the group. She has a small kiosk in front of her house where she makes and sells fast food. She lives with her husband, who works as a tourist guide, and they have 2 children. 

In addition to her kiosk, Ni Wayan also works as a travelling salesman selling fast food around her village. 

She will use her portion of the loan to buy more merchandise to sell in her kiosk, such as snacks and candy. She will also buy more ingredients to make fast food. With the loan she expects to produce more food and increase her profit. She will save the profits for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and merchandise for making and selling food from her kiosk.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, no cuenta con materiales necesarios para continuar con su negocio en el mercado, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar 2 qq de abono para dar buen desarrollo al cultivo de maíz, también invertirá en harina, pollo, verduras, aceite manteca, etc., para elaborar la venta de pan, tamales y otros antojitos.  
Doris está satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al invertir el préstamo anterior en su negocio, manifiesta que cuenta con más clientes satisfechos, mantiene una buena calificación crediticia y su familia cuenta con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doris does not have the materials necessary to continue with her business in the market, so she has decided to request a new loan to buy 2 quintals, or 92 kg, of fertilizer to promote the cultivation of maize. She will also invest in flour, chicken, vegetables, oil and butter to make and sell bread, tamales and other snacks.
Doris is satisfied by the good results that she had from investing the previous loan into her business. She says she has more satisfied customers, maintains a good credit score, and her family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in flour, chicken, vegetables, oil, butter etc. to make and sell bread, tamales and other snacks.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda, who is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support three children. She has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp in order to backup light in case of emergency.

Elda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she will not only save money but also help the environment and reduce health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, vitamins, vaccinations, and therefore grow her farm.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Don Juan Antonio a diario abre su negocio de pulpería desde muy de mañana para acaparar la clientela temprano, con sus ingresos mantiene la colegiatura de sus hijos quienes van avanzando en sus estudios, Juan Antonio necesita invertir en el negocio con productos como granos básicos, productos de limpieza, gaseosas, jugos entre otros, de esta manera el trabaja y ha podido salir adelante creciendo con mas productos por el cual está muy agradecido por el apoyo de crédito.
texts.en: Juan Antonio opens his convenient store very early in the morning daily for the early customers. With his income he covers the tuition of his children who are advanced in their studies. Juan Antonio needs to invest in the business with products such as basic grains, cleaning products, soda, and juice, among others, so his work can move forward and grow with more products, for which he is very grateful for the assistance with the loan.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Yanira

texts.es:
Roxana, tiene una venta de ropa y bisutería, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo, el cual asiste a la escuela, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, además de cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su hijo ayuda un poco económicamente a su abuela; de sus padres aprendió a administrar el negocio, luego su madre falleció y Roxana continua con el negocio ya como propio.
Comprará prendas de vestir como vestidos, pantalones, camisas, faldas, etc., para damas, caballeros y niños/as, surtirá mejor su inventario para la temporada de buenas ventas que se acerca, tendrá un negocio más competitivo y mejores ganancias.
Aspira en mantenerse trabajando para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y dar a su hijo apoyo para que se supere académicamente.
texts.en:
Roxana has a clothing and jewelry shop. She is a single mother. She lives with her son, who attends school. She does not have external help. In addition to covering her personal expenses and those of her son, she helps her grandmother a little economically. She learned to administer a business from her parents. Later her mother passed away and Roxana continued with the business on her own.
She will buy articles of clothing like dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc. for women, men and children. She will better stock her inventory for the best sales season which is approaching. She will have a more competitive business and better income.
She aspires to keep working to cover the needs of her household and give her son support, so that he can succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing like dresses, pants, shirts, skirts, etc for women, men and children to better stock her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and metal sheeting to improve her home

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana es muy trabajadora y sobre todo humilde vive en un caserío al sur de Honduras junto a sus hijos y compañero de Hogar .Su negocio es la venta de pescado seco, comidas y pan.
Doña Ana su negocio lo realiza desde hace 2 años en su casa de habitación y diversas comunidades cercanas a su caserío, desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más productos como pescados, curiles, también en la compra de hojladras, cemitas, bollitos, etc. que es su otra actividad que le genera ingresos.
Doña Ana espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia y poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos tengan mayores oportunidades de estudio.
 

Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Ana is very hardworking and above all, humble. She lives in a hamlet in the south of Honduras together with her children and partner. Her business is selling dried fish, set dishes and bread.  She began her business two years ago in her own home and in different communities close to her hamlet. 

With this loan Ana would like to buy more products such as fish, molluscs, puff pastry, white bread rolls, sweet buns, etc. which is another way she can generate an income.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to obtain the necessary income for her and her family to get ahead and improve their quality of life. One of her dreams is for her children to have more opportunities to study.


Choluteca, Honduras: September 2014

loans.use: to buy fish, molluscs, puff pastry, white bread rolls, sweet buns, etc. for her business

loans.name: Les Séraphins Group

texts.fr: Cigarulirwa est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire Les Séraphins, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 6 enfants et tous vont à l’école. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse des friperies dans un marché central de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter 5 ballons de friperies. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Cigarulirwa is a shopkeeper and a member of the borrowing group Les Séraphins, clients of MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. Cigarulirwa is married, 48 years old, and the mother of six children who all attend school.

Cigarulirwa started her business with funds she received from her husband. She has been selling secondhand clothing in a central market in town for six years. Cigarulirwa is going to purchase five bales of secondhand clothing. Her husband is a government employee.

Cigarulirwa hopes to receive more loans, purchase a plot of land, and educate and feed her children. In closing, she would like to thank Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase five bales of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en: An old woman living in Kampong Chhnang province, Samorn is 57 years old and a mother of six children. She works as district council to earn income to support her family. Moreover, she earns extra income from raising pigs. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Samorn will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. She hopes that her house has electricity to use, as other houses do.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

location.town: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Leng District

loans.name: Panorama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sivaghenda est commerçante et secrétaire de la banque communautaire Panorama, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 46 ans, mère de 6 enfants  scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu  de son salaire. Elle est vendeuse d’habillements depuis 16 ans. Elle va acheter 80 pièces de vestes. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, acheter une parcelle, construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sivaghenda is a shopkeeper and the secretary of borrowing group Panorama, clients of MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. Sivaghenda is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of six children attending school. 

Sivaghenda started her business with funds from her wages. She has been selling clothing for 16 years. She is going to purchase 80 jackets. Sivaghenda hopes to increase her credit, purchase a plot of land, build, and educate and feed her children. In closing, Sivaghenda thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 80 jackets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets for his business

loans.name: María Anatolia

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, es casada y madre de 3 hijas de las edades 13, 10 y 3 años, dos de ellas están estudiando.

Su esposo  se dedica al trabajo de estructuras metálicas cerca de su casa, este  trabajo lo aprendió de su padre y ahora él se independizo.

María se dedica al trabajo de corta  y abonada de café en la época en una cooperativa que esta retirado de su hogar; los fines de semana ella hace venta ya que vive cerca de la cancha de fútbol y esto le genera ingresos adicionales para  dar a sus hijas el estudio.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lamina y adobe para reparar su casa.  

Su sueño es construir su vivienda de bloque, ya que es de adobe y lamina y poder dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, studied until the fourth grade, is married and a mother to three children who are 13, 10 and 3, two of whom are at school. Her husband works close to home making structures out of metal. He learnt this trade from his father and has since become independent. 

Maria works cutting and fertilising coffee when in season for a cooperative which is far away from her home. On the weekends she sells her wares since she lives close to a football field and this provides her with an additional income that she uses to give her daughters an education.

The loan that Maria is applying for her will be used to buy metal sheeting and adobe to do some home repairs.  Her dream is to build a home out of blocks, as her current home is made out adobe and metal sheeting, and to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and adobe to do some home repairs

loans.name: Symphonie S Group

texts.fr: Manyumba est commerçante, présidente du groupe d’affaires «Symphonie S», âgée de 58 ans, veuve, mère de 8 enfants dont 1 étudie, 2 sont mariés et 5 n’étudient plus. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché du centre ville depuis son jeune âge et après elle sollicita un prêt à l’IMF Hekima. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir, elle compte acheter une parcelle, construire et scolariser son enfant. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Manyumba is a shopkeeper and president of the business group "Symphonie S." She is a 58-year-old widow and the mother of eight children, one of whom attends school, two of whom are married, and five of whom are no longer in school. 

Manyumba has been selling used shoes at the market in the town center since she was young; she later sought a loan from MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is going to purchase 10 bales of shoes to expand her business. Manyumba started with funds she received from her parents.

In the future, Manyumba plans to purchase a plot of land, build, and send her child to school. She would also like to thank Hekima for its support of small business owners who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bales of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets for her business.

loans.name: Daysi Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Daysi vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad al sur del país, su fuente principal de trabajo proviene de una pulpería, cuenta con más de 6 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad.

Doña Daysi con el préstamo espera comprar más mercadería como frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceite, café, huevos, pan, harina, etc. y con esto tener una mayor ganancia y mejorar sus ingresos financieros en su hogar.
Doña Daysi su sueño es darle una buena educación profesional a su hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.


Choluteca, Honduras -Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Señora Daysi lives with her husband and her children in a community in the south of the country. Her main source of work is a small neighborhood grocery store. She has been earning her living from this business for more than six years.

Daysi hopes to buy more merchandise, like beans, sugar, oil, coffee, eggs, bread, flour, etc., in order to have greater earnings and improve her household income. 

Daysi's dream is to give her children a good professional education and to improve their living conditions. The support that she is receiving from the loan will help her to achieve her dreams.

Choluteca, Honduras—September 2014

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, rice, oil, coffee, eggs, bread, flour, etc., for her shop

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is an 80-year-old widow who has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Genoveva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Genoveva has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Genoveva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 40 years old, married, and has three children, who are all in school. Geraldine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Geraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Speu province, Nat is 54 years old and a mother of one child. She earns an income to support her family by growing rice and making brooms. She has been involved in her business for ages and earns about 13,500 KHR per day. This is Nat's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in a good, healthy environment.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 750 avocados.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, atiende un taller de carpintería en donde elabora muebles para vender y también por encargo, no tiene empleados, su hijo mayor de 15 años le ayuda a realizar esta actividad; vive con su esposa y 4 hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela, no tiene más ingresos que los que genera con el negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.
Su negocio esté ubicado en una zona rural, solicita un crédito para invertir en la apertura de un nuevo punto de su carpintería en la zona urbana, con lo que espera atraer nuevos clientes, brindar un mejor servicio, ganar popularidad y mejorar su situación económica para responder a sus compromisos.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, mejorar la productividad, dar a su familia mejor alimentación y una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario has a carpenter shop where he makes furniture to sell and, also, fulfills orders. He has no employees but his 15-year-old son helps him. Mario lives with his wife and their four children, all of whom attend school. He has no income other than what his business generates to advance his family.

His business is located in a rural zone, and he is requesting a loan to invest in opening a new carpenter shop in the urban zone. This, he hopes, will attract new customers, offering better service, gaining popularity and better the family's economic situation, plus help respond to his obligations.

Mario dreams of expanding his business, improving productivity, and providing his family with better food and his children with a quality education.

loans.use: to invest in opening a new carpenter shop in the urban zone.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana, como una madre soltera responsable ha mantenido su negocio con vida para tener una fuente de ingresos, con los que puede cubrir las necesidades de su familia, esto es posible por la buena administración del crédito anterior, por la experiencia que ya tiene en el negocio, se está preparando para la temporada en que las ventas son mejores, pero necesita un nuevo préstamo para mejorar las ofertas a sus clientes, comprara, manzanas, guineos, güisquiles, pepinos, papas, uvas, fresas, etc., así ofrecerá frutas y verduras frescas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
As a responsible single mother, Ana has kept her business alive to have a source of income with which she can cover her family's needs. This is possible because of her good management of her previous loan and the business experience that she already has. 

Ana is getting ready for the season of better sales, but she needs a new loan to improve her offerings to her customers. She will buy apples, bananas, chayote squash, cucumbers, potatoes, grapes, strawberries, etc., so that she can offer fresh fruits and vegetables to her customers.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, chayote squash, cucumbers, potatoes, grapes, strawberries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la crianza de pollos, comercializa su producto en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para seguir con la crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 61 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She has made a living raising chickens for the past 20 years. She sells her products in the different markets found near her home. She manages to succeed with what she earns. She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and concentrated feed to continue breeding and to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su actividad es la venta de ropa, bisutería y maquillaje, cuenta con más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad.
Doña Silvia con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería blusas, faldas, vestidos, blúmeres, calzoncillos, etc. y espera que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias suficientes para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Silvia uno de sus sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a su hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.


Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre 2014
texts.en:
Señora Silvia lives with her husband and her children. Her business is the sale of clothing, jewelry, and make-up.  She has been earning her living this way for five years.

With the loan, Silvia wants to buy more merchandise like blouses, skirts, dresses, women's and men's underwear, etc. She hopes that this investment will allow her to make enough earnings to improve her and her family's quality of life a little bit.

One of Silvia's dreams is to give a good professional education to her children, and to improve their living conditions. The support that she is receiving from the loan will contribute to her achieving her dreams.

Choluteca, Honduras—September 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, men's and women's underwear, etc., for her business.

loans.name: La Merveille Group

texts.fr: Murahiri est commerçante dynamique de la banque villageoise La Merveille, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un commerçant, âgée de 24 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 1 est gosse. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une alimentation chez elle à la maison depuis 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de farine de format, 2 cartons du lait en poudre, 2 sacs de sucre, 2 carton de vin, 3 cartons de jus, 5 cartons d’eau vive, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Murahiri is a dynamic merchant in the banque villageoise La Merveille and a client with the micro-finance institution Hekima. She is 24 years old, married to a merchant, and a mother of three children, of whom two go to school and one is very young.

Murahiri owns a food shop at her house, which she has had for five years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband.

This new loan is going to serve to buy three sacs of flour, two cases of powdered milk, two sacs of sugar, two cases of wine, three cases of juice, five cases of Eau Vive, etc.

Murahiri wishes to increase her credit line and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who lack access to banking services.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of flour, two cases of powdered milk, two sacs of sugar, two cases of wine, three cases of juice, five cases of Eau Vive bottled water, etc.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 44 years old and is married with two children. She lives with no dependants in Quang Xuong, a rural town and district in Thanh Hoa province. She has a stall selling fish and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hà faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Tuấn

texts.en:
Tuấn, aged 56,  is married with two children. He lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Tuấn has been involved in his agricultural business for more than 10 years, farming poultry and cattle.

In 2014, Tuấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business and has successfully repaid two loans. The main hardship that Tuấn faces is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Tuấn hopes that his business will be successful and that his family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 61 years old, married, and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is a hardworking mother who is always out in the streets fish vending to earn money. This business is her own little way of helping her husband to support their big family. Helen is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house, for which she has applied for a loan to purchase construction materials. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. And she is thankful that all of her financing needs have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita thought of a good opportunity when she joined the microfinance group Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can receive financial assistance for her chosen business. Angelita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she requested a loan to buy additional bags of feeds for her pigs, which she is raising for commercial sale to pay for her son's health needs. She plans to add more pigs and build additional stalls in her pigpen. In the future, Angelita hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гулнар 50 лет, замужем, есть сын. Гулнар в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнар, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы и 10 овец, также Гулнар выращивает на собственном участке мерою 1,36 ГА пшеницу, кукурузу и чеснок. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Гулнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulnar is 50, married, and has a son.  She earns her living as a crop and livestock farmer, and has done so since 1999.  Thanks to her persistent efforts, her monthly income is 20,000 som on average, and she currently has three cows and ten sheep on her farm, as well as 1.36 hectares of land for growing wheat, corn, and garlic.  To further develop her farm, Gulnar is seeking a loan of 100,000 som to buy livestock, and plans on using any profits due to the loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: buy additional livestock for fattening and subsequent resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, sweets, basic grains, eggs, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Orpha

texts.en:
Orpha’s business is doing well. She earns an income to support the needs of her family especially those of her four children. She has a ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business and, at the same, sells personal products from MSE, Avon and Tupperware. 

Orpha's husband earns an income from selling fish around Dinalungan, Aurora using a tricycle. The couple are working together to generate a higher income. Their children are all attending school: at high school and elementary level. 

Orpha is the only dealer in their village: thus, to supply the demands of her customers, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy stocks of clothes, Tupperware, cosmetics and personal products. Aside from that, she wants to expand her business and offer her products not only to people in Dinalungan but also to those in Casiguran and Dinadiawan, Aurora.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes, Tupperware, cosmetics and personal products

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Thúy, aged 51, is married with two children. She lives with one dependant in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Thúy has been working in her agricultural business, farming poultry and cattle, for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has successfully repaid two loans. The main hardship that she faces is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet .

In the future, Thúy hopes to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is engaged in the selling of second-hand clothes, while her husband is in the farming business. Having five children is financially difficult, thus the couple persevere a lot to support their children’s needs. Thanks to their hard work, four of their children have already graduated from college. 

Although the couple have been successful in sending their children to school they still do want to make their businesses more progressive, thus Raquel is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 from KIVA lenders. Raquel plans to use the loan for her selling of second-hand clothes and for opening a sari-sari store business. She believes that with another business she will earn more that will surely uplift their living condition. A happy family and a growing business are Raquel’s hopes for the future.

loans.use: to buy stock and open a sari-sari store

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is a businesswoman from Tudela. She is 66 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Lita is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Lita is currently applying for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Lita continues to look for better business opportunities, proving that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Margene

texts.en: Margene wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She's taking up midwifery in Tangub City. She religiously pays attention to making good marks every semester. For this school year, Margene is requesting a loan in order to pay for her school fees. Margene has big dreams of helping her family and her siblings as well. This is why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees for this school year

loans.name: Ma. Eludivina

texts.en:
Ma. Eludivina works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Eludivina has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Ma. Eludivina is aware that by using the solar lamp, not only is she saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Luz has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from ice cream vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es: Edwin de 35 años de edad desde hace 2 años que posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, Edwin esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, sopas, huevos, detergentes, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
