Edwin, 35 years old, has had a small store located in his home for 2 years. He has many customers due to the variety of products and the good prices. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to afford some of his household costs. He lives in his own home with his life partner and son.

Edwin is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, soups, eggs, detergents, oil, sweets, drinks, etc. in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, eggs, detergents, oil, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Tứ

texts.en:
Tứ, aged 54,  is married with four children. She has no dependants to support and earns income from her agricultural business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Tứ has been working in her agricultural business, farming poultry and cattle, for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tứ faces is not having a biogas system (to treat waste products). Therefore, she has requested a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a biogas system. This is Tứ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tứ hopes to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a biogas system

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena. She is known in the area for her snack vending business. Helping the family survive, she uses her abilities as a great cook to make delicious food snacks to sell.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) supported her by providing the capital to start her chosen business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, that all of her financing needs for her business are supported by PMPC.

Erlinda hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house for a safe and comfortable living space for the family

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 36 years old and lives in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is married with five school-age children.

Adora has skill and expertise in making straw and feather dusters. She displays her finished products in her house for sale. Adora has had this business for five years now, and she earns an income in support of her husband in raising their family.

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw materials needed for her business. She wants to make more finished products to fulfill orders from her customers.

Adora has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, she hopes to own a space where she can display her products. Adora smiles at the thought of having this good fortune and business opportunity, and she is looking forward to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make more finished straw and feather dusters to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a hardworking mother of three and a very supportive partner to her husband Saturnino. She is from Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Avelina works as a Garment Production Worker.  She plays an important role in garment making processes from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Avelina is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Avelina is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative, and she had no problem repaying since the loan payment is deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response; any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to redeem the ATM card that she pawned.

Avelina wants to always have good health and enough strength in every day. She dreams for her family to have a prosperous life in the years to come. She meets with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To claim her pawned ATM card.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha, who is 64 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer of a small farmland that is located near his house and his primary activity is growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers. Pha has been working as a farmer for nearly fifteen years, with an income of USD 5.00 a day, on average. He has seven children in total; one of them is a construction contractor.

Pha is requesting a loan from KIVA. He is giving this loan to his son to contract him for one construction project. He hopes that after the construction project is finished, he could save some money to use as a capital investment to contract for other construction projects. He would like to thank all lenders for the financial support via HKL.

loans.use: to employ his son to contract him for one construction project

loans.name: Jesserie

texts.en:
Jesserie is 23 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jesserie requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Jesserie has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 26 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Lorena would like to save enough money so that she can afford to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jempiring Group

texts.en:
After successfully maintaining pigs with their last loan, the Jempiring group agree to continue their loan. Now they propose to increase the loan size. They successfully sold their pigs with a high price and earned a satisfactory profit. The reason they want to increase the loan size is because the price for feed is very expensive.

Now the Jempiring group, with 10 members, will receive 30.000.000 IDR. Ni Wayan, the leader, successfully sold her piglets and now she has a sow who has just birthed 14 healthy piglets. Ni Wayan is very happy for that. She will use her loan to purchase feed only. She must prepare a lot of feed to make sure the piglets grow rapidly. Ni Wayan hopes all the piglets will be healthy and their growth maximized to get a high price when she sells them later. With the profit Ni Wayan dreams of renovating her house.

Two members are not pictured because they could not attend the meeting, due to various reasons.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio has mastered his swine production (piglets for commercial sale) in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family. He was at his lowest point when he didn't have enough capital for his business. 

When Leoncio joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to avail himself of credit to fully support his business. Just as he takes care of his hog raising business, so with his membership with PMPC. Leoncio wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always run for any financial needs. Now, the loan of PHP 12,000 will be used to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his piglets, and will also help him to build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for his piglets and to build a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a hardworking mother who has engaged in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. Due to hardships in living, she aims to continue and improve this business to generate sufficient income.

Arceli wants to acquire more piglets to raise but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional pigs to raise and materials to improve the pigpen. 

She is hoping that she will avail herself of this loan to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins, additional pigs to raise and materials to improve the pigpen.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Clova

texts.en:
Clova came to the US in 1991 from Jamaica. She now lives in Florida with her daughter and started CT&T Consulting a few years ago. She provides various services to her clients including preparing legal documents and preparing taxes from January to March. She has worked with Accion in the past; her previous loan helped her hire two part-time employees. Clova understands the empowerment that comes with being a small business owner. She says she is most proud of “doing sales on my own and closing contracts.”

Now, Clova needs a loan to purchase updated tax software and build up her credit experience.

loans.use: to purchase updated software for the tax season

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is single and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living through a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Judith is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Foodies in the Miami area know that the best Spanish ingredients can be found at Jose’s Carmen and Lola (http://www.carmenandlola.com/). Jose says, “We began importing and distributing high quality products that were virtually non-existent in the American market.” Working with his son, Jose’s business has grown very fast in south Florida and they have developed their online sales with major retailers.  The company maintains an active social media presence, posting information on how to make the perfect paella and tempting tapas.

To date, Jose has been using personal savings and now needs to build some formal business credit to keep up the growth of the company. As a small food business owner, Jose has had difficulty getting access to capital to maintain momentum. With aspirations to contract with the major grocery chains in the area, this capital is crucial for securing his inventory. This loan will help build Jose’s formal credit and keep his business on track.

Jose’s goal is to “stabilize the company financially and live a tranquil life” – no doubt while enjoying some Spanish delicacies!

loans.use: to build credit for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for supplies like bags, labels, and organic fruit

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao, 31, is married and lives in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He has only one dependent child, who is currently in school. 

Sao is an active farmer on a small rice farmland located near his house. By growing rice and selling his crop to local dealers, he can make an average income of $2 (USD) per day. He has been involved in this career for 14 years. 

Sao wants to improve his entire family's general living conditions by building a latrine, because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. 

By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for this loan, granted through Hattha Kaksekar at a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad posee desde hace 6 años una panadería en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes pues vende el pan bien calientito y buenos precios, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, latas, y moldes, y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 47, has had a bakery at her house for six years.  She has a lot of customers.  She sells the bread nice and warm and for good prices.  She lives in her own house with her two children.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, tins, and molds.  This way she will be able to get improved earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, tins, and molds.

loans.name: Rick

texts.en:
Rick says, “I have always been interested in computers. So I started working on them, finding out what makes them work.” He has passed professional certification tests and earned a Microsoft Network engineering certificate. He runs Affordable PC LLC, a home-based computer refurbishment business. He buys used computers, fixes them up, updates them, and then sells them on sites like Amazon.com. Rick has gotten great reviews (4.4/5 on Amazon.com) with comments like “Very impressed w/ the level of communication and customer service” and “The value was very good for the product.”
Rick needs a loan to purchase inventory. This “will give me a selection of different laptops to offer, increasing sales,” Rick says.

loans.use: to purchase more laptops to refurbish and sell

loans.name: Tameka

texts.en:
Meet your cake diva! Tameka owns and operates Dream Crumb True (http://www.dreamcrumbtrue.com), a specialty bakery. She makes customized party and wedding cakes and cookies. Take a look at the pictures on the site – art you can eat! 

“I decided to start my business out of my love of baking and art,” Tameka says. She is a licensed home baker and is now transitioning to an incubator space in her hometown, Akron, OH. Tameka currently lives with her husband and two young children. While Tameka says that “watching my business grow from a hobby to a business has been very exciting and gratifying”, she acknowledges that balancing family time with business time can be difficult.

Tameka needs a loan to purchase baking equipment and make some minor renovations to the incubator space to she is moving to. She says, “I would love for my business to grow to the point where I can offer online sales (nationwide), and acquire another location for just retail sales of baked goods.”

loans.use: to pay for baking equipment

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as "determined." 

He transports children to schools for a fee and had been in business for seven years. Joseph's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are good.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be delay of payments. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to service his van. His business goal is to own a 44 seat bus within five years. 

Joseph hopes that in the future he will own a school. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his van.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 35 year old married man with four children living in Fort Portal-Uganda. 

He sells soft drinks alongside  agriculture. Peter faces challenges of limited capital and high competition.  He has hopes to expand his business to new areas and to become a wholesaler. 

Peter needs a loan to buy drinks like sodas to resell.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rodrigo Alfonso

texts.es: Rodrigo de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija,  el trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace 12 años, con lo que le pagan en su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda que es la que muestra en la fotografía cambiando el techo y poniendo las puertas y ventanas, por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar laminas, polines, balcones y pago de mano de obra, y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos y seguros.
texts.en: 34-year-old Rodrigo lives in his own home with his wife and daughter. He has worked for a private business for 12 years, with what his job pays him he is able to pay some of the costs that arise in his home. He wants to improve his home, which is shown in the photo, by changing the roof and putting in doors and windows. This is why he is requesting the loan, to buy sheets of metal, beams, balconies and pay for labor. This way he and his family will be able to live more comfortably and more securely.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, beams, balconies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has four children and describes herself as "determined."  She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and Ann is also tailor. 

She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Ann's business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are retailers. She says her biggest business challenge is theft. 

Ann will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more clothes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon describes himself as honest.  He operates a farm where he grows tea and has been in business for six years. 

Simon's business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are large scale. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of farm inputs.  Simon will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. 

He hopes to expand her business to a large scale. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. 

Priscillah operates a shop where she sells maize and wheat flour, sugar and other items.  Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more flour, sugar and other items. Priscillah hopes her business will grow financially.  She also does farming.

This is Priscillah's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Fredy Noe

texts.es: Fredy de 41 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas,  el se dedica a la crianza de ganando bovino y a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado bovino para continuar con la crianza y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Fredy, 41, is a very hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters. He's been raising livestock and working in agriculture for 20 years. He sells his products around the area. He manages to cover some household expenses with the money he earns from sales. Fredy is requesting this loan to buy more livestock so he can continue raising them and thus have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de productos de uso personal como: lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes, perfumes, etc. comercializa en las diferentes colonias y ya tiene clientes fijos por la calidad y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 49-year-old Marta lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She has earned a living for the past 7 years selling personal use items like lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, perfumes etc. which she markets in all the different neighborhoods. She already has permanent clients because of the quality and good prices of her products. She is requesting this loan to buy more wholesale products to continue with her sales and this way give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly, 38, is married with two children and lives in Tangub-Mantic in Tangub City. She is a determined businesswoman who never loses hope in pursuing her goals, despite the challenges she meets along the way. 

Sherly earns a profit from her sari-sari (small variety store). She never tires of tending her store, since she is driven to sell, and the meager income she earns from it sufficiently supports her family. 

Sherly is a full member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has taken out several loans. She maintains her membership in good standing, without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari to serve more customers and increase her sales. Sherly continues to look for better business opportunities, which is proof that she has the strong will and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (small variety store) to serve more customers and increase her sales

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: At the age of 56, Erlinda is now managing two businesses; a sari-sari (general) store and a rolling store business. Her husband, Sebastian, works as a farmer. They are blessed with four children who are now living with their own families. Erlinda's business is doing well; however, she wants to expand it and offer other products like frozen foods, and other grocery items for her rolling store like condiments, breads, detergent soap, canned goods and soft drinks. With that she is requesting a loan of 49,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that lenders will grant her request for her to further increase her income for she dreams of having a piggery someday.

loans.use: to expand her business and offer other products.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 42 años de edad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 20 años, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Julio vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos para continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Julio, 42, has been raising pigs for 20 years. He manages to cover some of the household expenses with the sales he makes. Julio lives in his own house with his life partner. He is requesting a loan to buy more pigs so he can continue raising them because that is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 61 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Thelma has been farming sugarcane for ten years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shanthakumar

texts.en:
Shanthakumar has gained profound knowledge in organic farming over the past 10 years and hands-on experience in training the field staff about sustainable agriculture practices. He is a B.A. graduate from Kuvempu University, employed with Sahaja Samrudha for the past six years and currently designated as project coordinator of the Mandya organic village project.

The borrower resides with his sister in Bangalore. His parents and a brother stay in an ancestral tile-roof house at his native place in Kodihalli Chikkamagalore. 

Shanthakumar wants to improve his income and for this reason, he is seeking a loan to develop organic farming and to buy training materials to train the farmers.  He hopes to develop a training centre in his native place and publish his learning’s through a series of booklets, which will be circulated across villages at reasonable prices that will help the farmers to understand the benefits and sustainability of agriculture.

loans.use: to develop organic farming and to buy training materials to train farmers

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Lai is 50 years old and the mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs support for three schoolchildren. To support her family, she earns income via rice farming and making brooms to supplement her income. She can earn an income of about 15,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is the group leader. Lai will spend her loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living with good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Gregoria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Gregoria de 47 años de edad se dedica desde hace 12 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: 47-year-old Gregoria has earned a living for 12 years in agriculture, especially growing corn and beans. She markets her products in the surrounding areas of the zone. With the income that she earns she is able to get ahead in life, and lives in her own home with her son. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, etc. and to improve the soil that is shown in the photo, and to continue her crops, because this is her only source of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc. and improve the soil.

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
With 14 members, the Jepun Sari Group will make the payment together of 42,000,000 IDR. During the loan period, they can manage the pigs well. With the instructions from their vet, the group keeps the pigs by giving them nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Ketut sells her pigs and earns a net profit of 2,500,000 IDR. That is after deducting the cost of feed and making her loan payment. She’s really happy for that and decided to continue her loan to increase the population of her pigs. All the profits will be used for her family's daily needs and school fees.

After calculating and evaluating the last period, the Jepun Sari group decided to continue their loan. The loans will be used to increase their pig businesses by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group received the same loan amounts.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase a sow. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan will go well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their businesses until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase a sow.

loans.name: Sivet

texts.en:
Sivet, 32 years old, is a married woman who lives in the Kompong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has no children. She is an active farmer on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers, she can make an income of 3.50 USD per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this career for 16 years. 

Sivet wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon, 54 years old, is living in Kandal Province of Cambodia. She is a single mother of five children, three of whom are married and two who are not yet married. She is an active farmer on a small rice farm, which is located near her house. By growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers, she can make an income of 2.50 USD per day, on average. So far, she has been involved in this career for 15 years. 

Sokhon wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be determined and capable. He operates a retail shop where he sells maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to expand well within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Jorgena

texts.en:
From Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Jorgena earns a living through her banana buy-and-sell business. She seeks enough inventory to continuously provide for her family. 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative has stood by her for her capital needs since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the challenges of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

To earn more, she has applied for a loan to purchase more bananas to sustain her supply and consumption. She hopes to live comfortably and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sustain her supply and consumption

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en: Nelinda’s business endeavor is doing just well. With enough patience and determination, she was able to make her sari-sari store bigger and more profitable. Aside from managing a sari-sari store, Nelinda also offers cell phone load and cooks food and snacks like rice cake, and banana que (sweetened banana on a stick). She pays one person to sell those products going house to house. Nelinda is earning at least PHP 10,000 a month. In addition, her husband is a sawmill employee. The couple is blessed with two loving children; the eldest is a college student while the youngest is not yet attending school. With her desire to make her business more profitable, Nelinda is requesting a PHP 20, 000 loan from Kiva lenders. If granted, she plans to buy more stock of soft drinks, condiments, soap and biscuits. Aside from that, she also wants to buy raw ingredients for her food vending business. Nelinda will be very grateful if this loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, condiments, soap and biscuits

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en: Kimly, 54, is a resident living in Kampong Speu province and a mother of two children. Because of her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She can earn an income about 30,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan cycle for Kimly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her lifestyle with good health after she gets this latrine.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Aun is 55 years old. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is at university. To support her living, she grows rice on two-and-a-half hectares of land and her husband is a blacksmith to earn more income. For Aun, this is her second loan cycle and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan to pay school fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Accounting.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en: Batmunkh, 28, lives with his wife in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a photo studio business since 2013. His wife works as a seller at a shopping center. As he and his wife's workplace is far away from their home, he is in urgent need of an automobile. He is requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits less smoke and then wastes less fuel. Also, he can use his car for taxi service as additional income during his day off.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Edgardo Rodolfo

texts.es: Edgardo de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verdura desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, Edgardo esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas fruta y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Edgardo, 39, lives in his own house with his wife and child.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 10 years. His business is located in the city market, and he has a lot of customers because of his good prices.  

Edgardo is requesting a loan so that he will be able to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale, in order to continue with his sales, which generate good earnings for him.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has two children who are 2 and 14 years old. She operates a food stall where she cooks potatoes to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy equipment for preparing potato chips. Her business goal is to open a restaurant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a business empire and be able to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to save.

loans.use: to buy equipment for preparing potato chips

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad se a la venta de dulces artesanales desde hace varios años, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con su hermano y su sobrino, Maria quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos donde muestra la fotografía, por eso esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra, para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros y comodos.
texts.en: Maria, 45, has been selling homemade sweets for many years. She manages to cover some of the household expenses with the sales she makes. She lives in her own house with her brother and her nephew. Maria wants to improve her home by building some rooms in the area shown in the photo. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, and to pay for labor so that she and her family can live more securely and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is 39 years old and blessed with two children. She buys and sells fruit and vegetables to generate income. She wants to make her business profitable and earn enough income to satisfy the necessities of her family. She wants to acquire more inventory of fruit and vegetables to resell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to request an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more cabbages, beans, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, garlic, eggplant, pechay and cucumbers for resale. Being a kind and diligent mother, she is hoping that someday, she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, beans, tomatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, garlic, eggplant, pechay and cucumbers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, 42, is the mother of one child. From Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia, she grows rice as her main source of income and makes brooms to supplement her income. 

Thea can earn about 13,000 Cambodian riels per day. This is the first time she requests a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Thea is the leader of a group of five members. She will spend her entire portion of the loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes she can have a good latrine for her family's use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of milk to sell. His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk to sell

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin, 43, lives with family members in a rural village in Takeo province. She is the mother of five children, one of whom is in school and one who is in university. To support her family, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, her husband is a policeman. For Sin, this is her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan amount to pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Finance and Banking. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor degree, majoring in Finance and Banking.

loans.name: Galiya

texts.en:
Galiya is married. She has one adult daughter. 

Galiya has her own business selling food items at the market. The most popular products are candies, vegetables and fruit. Galiya has been in this business for 13 years. She is hardworking, communicative and responsible. She wants to develop her business further.

Galiya is asking for a loan in the amount of 25 000 UAH to expand the range of food she offers. The loan will help her to earn more income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to expand the range of food she offers.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en: Enkhtaivan, 47, lives with his wife and younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been coordinating coal usage at a power plant for many years. His wife is a janitor at the supply unit of the power plant. Their elder son works at a mining company. Using his previous loan, Enkhtaivan has renovated his house. His younger son is currently living with them and wants to live on his own. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement and fiberglass, in order to renovate an old Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). This ger used to be his home before moving into his house. After renovation, this ger will provide a comfortable and warm place for his younger son to live in. Also, less coal will be used for heating, thus reducing air pollution in the surrounding area.

loans.use: to renovate an old Mongolian traditional ger.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 40 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Mariam has been selling palm oil since 2011. She has a dream of expanding her business; however, she is faced with the challenges of competition and limited capital. Mariam is a hard working woman and wants a loan to buy cement and bricks to build her family a house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to build her family a house.

loans.name: Claricia

texts.es: Claricia de 44  años de edad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella vive en casa propia con compañero de vid y su hijo, Claricia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Claricia, 44, has been raising pigs for many years. She sells her products near the area where she lives. She manages to cover some of the household expenses with the sales she makes. She lives in her own house with her life partner and son. Claricia is requesting a loan to buy more pigs and feed so she can continue raising them because that is her only source of work.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene  mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de maiz, chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, etc. y así continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: This young woman's face has been blurred because she is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She sells 'pupusas' (stuffed tortillas). Her business is located in her home and she has a lot of customers because of her kindness and her good prices. She lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, chicharrón (pork crackling), beans, fresh cheese, etc., so that she can continue with her work which generates good income.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicharrón (pork crackling), beans, fresh cheese, etc.

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу 60 лет, замужем, дети все взрослые, самостоятельные. Образование у Канымбу среднее. С 1974 года она занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством и полеводством, благодаря ее большому опыту и неустанному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Канымбу есть 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец и коз. Канымбу вместе с супругом выращивает на 0,60 ГА арендованной поливной земли ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Дополнительно она реализует молоко местным жителям, экологически чистое и очень вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Канымбу составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канымбу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Канымбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Kanymbu is 60 years old and married. All her children are grown-ups and independent. Kanymbu has secondary education. She has worked with agriculture since 1974 - livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. 

Thanks to her long experience and tireless work, her farm currently has two dairy cows and 10 sheep and goats. Kanymbu and her husband also grow barley for own use on 0.60 hectares of rented, irrigated land. In addition, Kanymbu sells milk to the local residents. As it is ecological and very tasty, it is in great demand. Kanymbu's monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Kanymbu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of milk for sale. Kanymbu plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and to build a livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Anabela lives in Suai. She is married and she has three children. Her husband works in agriculture. 

Anabela is applying for a loan of 700 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a clothes shop and she also sells in the market. Anabela has been involving in business activities for one year. She started with her own working capital of 500 USD. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them, so she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and goats.

loans.use: to buy shorts, pants, underwear, t-shirts and other things to sell.

loans.name: Shariypa

texts.ru: Шарийпа, 43 года, замужем, мать 4 детей, младший сын - школьник, живет с родителями. У Шарийпы - среднее образование, много лет проработала санитаркой. С 1995 года, Шарийпа занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади. Также есть земельный надел мерою 1,60 ГА, где Шарийпа и ее муж выращивают фасоль. Также Шарийпа реализует молоко местным жителям. Семья с радостью берется за любую работу, а дети активно помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шарийпа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 дойной коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота и в первую очередь для увеличения объемов получаемого молока. Домашнее, экологически чистое и очень вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Доходы от кредита Шарийпа планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и дать достойное образование сыну и внукам.
texts.en:
Shariypa is 43 years old and married. She is the mother of four children. The youngest son is in school, and lives with the parents. Shariypa has secondary education. She worked as a nurse for many years, but since 1995, Shariypa has worked with agriculture. Currently she has two dairy cows and two horses at her farm. She also has a plot of land of 1.60 hectares, where she and her husband grow haricots. Shariypa also sells milk to the local residents. The family is happy to take up any kind of work, and the children help their parents actively with the household. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Shariypa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow with calf to increase the number of cattle and especially to increase the volume of milk received. As the milk is domestic, ecological and very tasty, it is in great demand.

Shariypa plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and to give her son and grandchildren the education they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with calf in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for sale

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий женат. У него две дочери. Василий имеет свой бизнес.

Василий продает женскую одежду больше 10 лет. Он арендует торговую точку. В свободное время Василий подрабатывает сантехником. Он предприимчивый и ответственный. В будущем планирует открыть свой магазин женской одежды.

Василий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку одежды: вечерние платья, юбки, свитера и джинсы. Кредит поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых покупателей. Это увелчит его доход и поможет Василию лучше заботиться о нуждах своей семьи.
texts.en:
Vasiliy is married and has two daughters. He has his own business. Vasiliy has sold women's clothing for more than 10 years. He rents a sales point. In his free time, Vasiliy works as a plumber. He is enterprising and responsible. 

In the future, Vasiliy plans to open his own women's clothing store. He requests a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia to purchase clothing: Evening dresses, skirts, sweaters and jeans. The loan will help him increase the assortment of goods and attract new customers. This will increase his income and help him better take care of the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing to increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга замужем. У нее двое детей. Ольга имеет свой бизнес.

Ольга занимается тепличным хозяйством. Она выращивает помидоры и цветы. В своем распоряжении она имеет 10 соток земли, где и расположена теплица. Ольга также работает помощником воспитателя в детком саду. Она трудолюбивая и ответсвенная.Ольга хочет развивать свой бизнес.

Ольга просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 30 000 гривен на закупку дров, удобрений и семян для теплицы. Кредит поможет успешно провести сезон и получить дополнительную прибыль. В будущем Ольга планирует построить дополнительную теплицу.
texts.en:
Olga is married. She has two children. Olga has her own business. She works with greenhouse farming. She grows tomatoes and flowers. She has ten acres of land at her disposal, and the greenhouse is situated here. Olga also works as an assistant caregiver at the kindergarten. She is hardworking and responsible.

Olga would like to develop her business. She requests a loan in the amount of 30,000 hryvnia to purchase firewood, mineral fertilizers and seeds for the greenhouse. The loan will help her successfully carry out the season's harvest and receive additional income. In the future, Olga plans to build an additional greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, fertilizers and seeds for her greenhouse

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia, 42, is married with four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda.  

She sells tomatoes, a business she has been in for 14 years. She has a dream of expanding her business, although she is faced with the challenges of limited capital and competition. 

Melenia wants money to buy tomatoes. She is appreciative to Kiva for the services it offers since she has been able to improve her income and complete her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.ru:
Олег женат. У него двое взрослых детей. Вместе со своей семьей Олег проживает в маленьком двухкомнатном доме, который достался ему в наследство. 

Олег занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 18 лет. У него два участка земли и семь больших теплиц. Олег выращивает огурцы и помидоры. Также у него есть дополнительный заработок:  он фрезерует и вспахивает огороды своим трактором. Олег  трудолюбивый и предприимчивый.  В будущем он планирует построить большой дом.

Олег просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на закупку угля для отопления своих теплиц.  В связи с военными событиями Украине цена на уголь начала рости и Олег хочет закупить его заранее. Это поможет Олегу сохранить урожай и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two grown-up children. He lives in a small two-room house, which he has inherited, together with his family. 

Oleg has worked with greenhouse farming for a period of 18 years. He has two plots of land and seven large greenhouses. Oleg grows cucumbers and tomatoes. He also has additional work: He mills and plows gardens with his tractor. Oleg is hardworking and enterprising. In the future, he plans to build a large house. 

Oleg requests a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia to purchase coal for heating his greenhouses. Due to the military events in Ukraine, the price of coal has started rising and Oleg would like to purchase it in advance. This will help him save the crop and receive a good income.

loans.use: to purchase coal for heating his greenhouses

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and other groceries. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a good businesswoman. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and other groceries

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Jose de 44 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años especialmente al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestran la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. para continuar con las siembra y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose, 44, lives with his life partner in his own house. He has been working in agriculture for 12 years, primarily growing corn. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph so that later he can sell it near the area where he lives. Jose is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, manure, etc., so he can continue planting and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en: Emerenciana is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 62 and married in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Emerenciana is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without default. Now, she has borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventories will mean income opportunities. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family and to complete her house renovation.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a transportation business, in which she owns motorcycle for the business. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a populated place and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high maintenance costs. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy another motorcycle. She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to support her business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be capable and promising. He operates a retail business where he sells basins and utensils. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of basins and utensils. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and improve his family's standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins and utensils

loans.name: Marvin  Yesenia

texts.es: Doña Marvin de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 8 años,  con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Doña Marvin quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro de lamina en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de madera, lamina, clavos y pago de mano de obra y así volver a construir dicho muro para que ella y su familia puedan vivir as seguros.
texts.en:
Doña Marvin, age 40, is a single mother.  She lives in her own house with her son.  She has worked in traditional fishing for eight years.  Through the sales that she makes, she manages to keep ahead of her household expenses.  

Doña Marvin wants to improve her home by building a wall made of sheet metal in the area shown in the photo.  Because of this, she is asking for a loan to buy wood, sheet metal, and nails, and to pay for labor.  In this way she can build the aforementioned wall so that she and her family can live safely.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheet metal, and nails, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a female Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour, sugar, salt and other household goods. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are small scale buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more merchandise. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt and other items for resale. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more inventory of items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, salt and other items for resale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 37 years old, married and gifted with one child. Doris manages her shrimp paste making business. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well for three years, supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also supplies her food products in the nearby town for added income. Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy more kilos of shrimp for her chosen business. She wants to expand her business and would be happier to own a small truck to be used in selling her shrimp paste in other municipalities.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of shrimp to make shrimp paste to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of basins, sufurias, padlocks and other items for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain, which affects her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a hardworking businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in an area suitable for livestock farming and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her farming and be self-reliant. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Doña santos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica la venta de comida desde hace 4 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y por esa razón posee muchos clientes, Doña santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  carnes, pollos, verduras, frutas, maíz, etc. para continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Santos is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has been selling meals for four years. Her business is located in the municipal market and because of this she has lots of customers. Santos is requesting a loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit, corn etc. to continue with her sales and have more revenue.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, fruit, corn, etc.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is 55 years old, widowed and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She joined Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in January 2011. She is a good mother to her five children and proud to be a farmer who earns a living by rice farming. Eliza tried her luck doing a business focusing on her rice farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Eliza borrowed another loan to buy additional fertilizer and herbicides for a more productive rice harvest. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Eliza looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: To buy additional fertilizer and herbicides for a more productive rice harvest

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is 48 years old, married, and a resident of Santa Filomena, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through raising pigs to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years and enjoys the privileges of membership. Now, she is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to sell.

Zaida deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to sell.

loans.name: Nita Carlota

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Nita, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de  edad e independientes, con ellos vive una nieta de tres años la cual es como suya. Su esposo no trabaja por discapacidad.
Doña Nita se dedica a la preparación y venta de bocadillos bajo pedidos unas cuatro veces por semana, también prepara comida para fiestas y recepciones una vez por semana. Lleva  más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como pueden financiar su negocio, gracias a sus ganancias ellos han podido salir adelante ya que su marido no trabaja y con sus ganancias ellos pueden sobrevivir de una manera digna. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es seguir adelante y darle lo mejor a su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
In Estancilla, Tosagua canton, the La Estancia credit group meets every two weeks.  This area is known for being very dynamic.  The majority of people living there work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with great vegetation.

Nita lives in this area.  She is 53 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  She has three adult children fro this relationship, all of whom live on their own.  One three-year-old granddaughter who is like her own lives with her.  Her husband doesn’t work, due to a disability.

Nita works making and selling sandwiches four times a week by special order.  She also caters food for parties and receptions once per week.  She has been doing this for more than 20 years, and it is how they get ahead.

She is taking out another loan because this is how they can finance their business.  Thanks to her earnings they have been able to get by, because her husband doesn’t work and with her earnings they can live in a respectable way.  She is going to use this loan to buy the ingredients necessary to prepare her meals.  She has been in her credit group since the beginning.  She likes it because the loans are a great help to her.  Her dream is to get ahead and give the best to her little granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps cows that produce milk to sell. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather conditions. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper. He will use the anticipated profits to buy feed for his cows.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is 49 years old, married and blessed with a son. Her husband runs a general store in the community. He is hardworking and has been running this business for 15 years now. Her husband wants to buy additional inventory in order to provide his customers with more variety and to avoid any out-of-stock situations. Ghazala wants to help her husband by providing him with financing; therefore, she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. They are hopeful to provide a better future to their son.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es: Esperanza de 41 años de edad vive con sus dos hijas en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de salón de belleza desde hace 18 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Esperanza solicita un crédito para poder comprar productos para su salón de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 41, lives with her two daughters in her own house.  She has had a beauty salon business in her place of residence for 18 years.  She has a lot of customers because she does very good work, and she is able to pay for her household expenses with her earnings.

Esperanza is requesting a loan in order to purchase products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other things that she needs.  In this way, she will be able to earn better income that will help her to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other items.

loans.name: María Celenita

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un  hijo el cual es mayor  de edad y estudia en universidad. 
Doña María tiene un bazar y papelería  en su casa, allí vende ropa, perfumes, bisutería y cosas para regalos y útiles escolares. Tiene más de 30  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ha sacado a delante a su hijo.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya es la única forma que ella tiene para poder financiar su negocio, gracias a sus ganancias que ella puede salir adelante en sus gastos diarios y darle para los estudios de su hijo. Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  perfumes y útiles escolares. Esta desde hace 3 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
In La Estancilla in the canton of Tosagua, the lending group La Estancia meets every 15 days.  This area is known for its dynamism. Most  of the residents work in farming and raising animals, since it's an area where things grow well.  This is where Maria lives; she is 43 years old, and a single mother.  She has a son who is an adult and studying at the university.  Maria has a variety store and stationery shop in her home, selling clothing, perfumes, jewelry, gift items and school supplies.  She has had the store for more than 30 years and through it has helped her son get ahead in life.

Maria is asking for a loan again since this is the only way she has to finance her business.  Thanks to the profits she was able to get ahead in her daily spending and pay for her son's school expenses.  This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes and school needs.  She has been in the credit group for three years and likes its easy payment provisions.  Maria's dream is that her son will be a professional worker.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes and school supplies for resale

loans.name: Samra

texts.en: Samra, age 48, is married and a mother of five children. She started embroidering with the intention of bringing home some income, as her husband’s income was not enough to cover their family’s expenses. Now, she has established herself and has provided employment to many other women in her community. She is nice and friendly. She takes orders and forwards them to other women working under her, and she pays them after the completion of the orders. Currently, she needs some materials to finish some orders that are pending. She therefore has requested a loan to pay for the material expenses. She wants to start saving for her children’s marriages and education. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery such as sequins, pearls, and various colored threads.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 47 years old and married. She has three children, who are all in school. Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dolores Azucena

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es agricultor.
Doña Dolores con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante  se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una granja en su casa en la cual mete hasta 500 pollos por temporada, ella alimenta sus animalitos los mismos que compra cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a otras ciudades y vender en estos lugares, ella también vende por libras y enteros en su casa a personas de la localidad, de esta forma ella se gana algo que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido no gana lo suficiente en sus actividades.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva más de 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "La Estancia' communal bank meets every fortnight in Estancilla in the canton of Tosagua. This place is known to be very dynamic and the majority of it's inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals as it is an area of abundant vegetation.

Dolores lives here. She is 57 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has 5 children, all of them adults and independent. Her husband is a farmer. With the goal of making her own money and to get ahead she works raising chickens. She has a coop at her house that can hold up to 500 chickens for a time. She buys chicks when they are small and feeds them and keeps them for some time.

When they are ready she sells them to businesspeople who come to her house to take them to other cities. She also sells them by the pound and whole to people in the area from her house. In this way she earns some money which helps her get ahead as her husband doesn't earn enough with his activities.

This loan will be used to buy feed and medicines for her chickens. She has been in the communal bank for more than 10 years and she likes it as it helps her get ahead. Her dreams are to continue to progress and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.

loans.name: Mónica Beronica

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Mónica, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 16 y 14 años de edad, los tres menores estudia en colegio. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Mónica es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo  el cual tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, su esposo muy de madrugada se va a los campos a comprar a agricultores de la zona y luego en su carro lleva a vender al por mayor a comerciantes en la ciudad de Chone, el realiza un viaje al día. Lleva más de 15 años con este negocio con el cual se gana el sustento diario de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para su negocio. Lleva 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda el Banco. Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In La Estancilla in the canton Tosagua the credit group La Estancia meets every 15 days.  This is a place noted for its dynamism,  where most residents work in farming and care of animals since it's an area where vegetation grows well.  Monica is 39 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has four children, whose ages are 20, 17, 16 and 14.  The three younger ones are in high school. Monica's husband is a salesman.  

Monica is an outstanding homemaker who is asking for a loan to assist her husband who has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He goes  to the fields early in the morning to buy from the farmers of the area and then takes products to sell in bulk to salesmen in the city of Chone.  He makes the trip daily, has been working in this business for more than 15 years and thus meets the daily needs of his family.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables for his business.  Monica has been a member of the credit group for 7 years and likes the services the bank offers.  Her dream is that her children will  become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 32 years old and married. He has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Julius operates a textile shop and also sells coffee to earn additional income. He has been in that business since 2010. He is a hardworking man with a dream of expanding his business into a wholesale business. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital and wants to borrow money to buy dresses, shirts, and other textiles to sell. Julius is thankful to Kiva for the support given to him.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shirts, and other textiles to sell.

loans.name: Venchita

texts.en: Venchita is 58 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two grown children. Venchita and her husband earn a living through rice farming. They mastered this type of activity when they got married, which supported her children’s education until they graduated and got jobs. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in March 2012.
