She is a hardworking mother who has strong determination to pursue her goals for the benefit of her family, to alleviate them from poverty. Venchita requested a loan to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm. This will help to give her farming income a big boost. Someday, she hopes to buy a parcel of land to expand her rice production and venture into the rice selling business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase production on her rice farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Zuber

texts.en: Zuber is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to own a boutique within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a home. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is 62 years old, married with two adult children. Her major source of income is rice farming. She also engages in palay (unhusked rice) trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially for the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Cornelia wants to expand her rice production so that her customers will be served well and she will be able to supply more sacks of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase more sacks of palay to produce more rice and now she is re-applying for a loan for her rice production business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of palay to produce more rice for her customers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells timber. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La Señorita Andrea vive con su hermano, ellos hace mas de 10 años que están viviendo por el chaco. Ella tiene como objetivo llegar a culminar sus Estudios Universitarios para así llegar a su meta que es tener su propio Estudio Contable, ya que la carrera que sigue es de contabilidad y quiere poder tener un ingreso propio y llegar a ayudar a su hermano en lo Económico.
Andrea pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea lives with her brother and they've been living in Chaco for over 10 years. Her objective is to finish her university studies in order to achieve her goal of having her own accounting business. She's studying accounting and would like to have her own income to help her brother financially. 

Andrea is asking for this loan to be able to pay her university tuition, in order to keep going with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Dayanara Tatiana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Jerusalén. 
En este lugar vive la señorita Dayanara, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, ella estudia derecho en una universidad local y vive en casa de los padres. 
Doña Dayanara es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante a base de esfuerzo, ella tiene un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende dulces y confitería en general, en este local trabaja con la ayuda de su papá que es quien le administra el negocio cuando ella está en la universidad, trabaja todos los días y a diario llegan muchos clientes a realizar sus compras ya sea para fiestas o también comerciantes minoristas que recurren a su local a abastecerse de sus productos, ella tiene 1 año con este negocio el cual heredo de su abuela la cual lo tenía por muchos años atrás. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar dulces y caramelos de muchas variedades. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Jerusalén credit group meet every 15 days in the fortress of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí. It's been known for many years as the city of the real Tamarindos. This is where 20-year-old Dayanara lives. She is single, lives with her parents and is studying law at a local university. Dayanara is a hardworking young woman who likes to make the effort to get ahead. She has a small store in the downtown area of the city where she sells sweets and candies. She does this with her dad's help, as he is the one who runs the business when she's at school. She works every day and a lot of customers come to buy things for parties, as well as retailers who come to stock their products. She inherited this business from her grandmother who owned it for many years, and she's been working there for one year. 

She'll use this loan to buy sweets and many different kinds of caramels. She's gone through five cycles with the credit group and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dreams are to finish her studies and to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy sweets and caramels.

loans.name: Angélica Raquel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Jerusalén. 
En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 51 años  de edad, está divorciada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Angélica es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende joyas bañadas en oro, ropa  por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de algún producto, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lleva más de 13 años en este negocio con el cual sale adelante.	
Este crédito es para comprar joyas,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que donde vive es de su mamá.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Jerusalén credit group meet every 15 days in the fortress of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the real tamarindos. This is where 51-year-old Angélica lives. She is divorced, doesn't have kids and lives with her parents. Angélica is a hardworking woman who likes to make an effort to get ahead. She sells gold-plated jewelry, clothing and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door and she also sells out of her house where her customers come if they need something. She gives them the products on credit and charges them each week. She's been doing this for over 13 years, which is how she gets ahead.

This loan will be used to buy jewelry, perfume, lotion, cosmetics and all kinds of clothing. She's been a part of the credit group for over 4 years and she likes it because of the help she receives from the loans. Her dream is to have her own house, as she's currently living with her mom.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, perfume, lotion, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie is a widow from Sindangan, Philippines. She is 30 years old and has three kids. Tessie is manages her fishing activities. She owns a fishing boat where she hires five fishermen to work for her. She personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 50,000 for the purchase of new nets, foams and other fishing accessories.  As much as possible, she has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard her fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where she will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children finish their college education and have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets, foams and other fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: María Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Jerusalén. 
En este lugar vive la señorita María, tiene 27 años de edad,  es soltera, ella estudia el cuarto semestre de Administración de Empresas en una universidad local. 
Doña María es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante a base de esfuerzo y así salir adelante con sus estudios para mejorar su vida futura, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo. Tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí llegan muchos de sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda. ella también vende a sus compañeros de clases,  tiene muchos clientes ya que les da facilidades de pago ya que deja a créditos y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 8 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Jerusalén [New Jerusalem] meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the province of Manabí which has been known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds. 

Here lives Maria, 27. She is single. She is studying Business Administration in her fourth semester at her local university. 

Maria is a hardworking young woman who likes to succeed with hard work. Therefore, she is continuing her education to improve her life in the future. She is also involved in trade, selling clothing of all kinds. She has a small space in her home where her many clients come when they need clothing. She also sells to her classmates. She has many customers as she gives them easy payment options to buy on credit to repay on a weekly basis. She has done this work for over 8 years in order to get ahead.

This loan is going to be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been in this credit group for 8 years and likes it because it is how she started her business. Her dreams are to finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma used the previous loan to  buy food to sell in the restaurant. She runs a hotel, a business she started with the hope of employing herself. She faces challenges of weather changes and customers delaying to pay. Fatuma needs a loan to buy food stuffs like sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and peas for the the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food to sell in the restaurant.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 30-year-old lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a bar, a business she started with the hope of employing herself. She faces challenges of defaulters. Besides that, she has hopes of building a permanent house. Alice needs a loan to buy waragi (a local brew), beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy waragi, beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 42-year-old lady with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a restaurant and a motorcycle business, which adds to her income. She faces challenges of defaulters and weather changes. However, she hopes to own a poultry farm. Shamim needs a loan to buy food stuffs like matooke and cassava for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like matooke and cassava for her restaurant.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, 34, is married and blessed with three children. She lives with her family in Lahore. Her husband has run a general store in the nearby community for the past 10 years. He spends most of his time at the shop and his wife looks after the kids at home. He is the sole person earning in the family so he has to make sure that they never run short of finances to cover their expenses. In order to increase sales and start saving he is planning to buy additional inventory.

Kaneez has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy inventory. They are hopeful for a better future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Susana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Jerusalén. 
En este lugar vive la señora Susana, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad el mismo que  estudia en colegio. El marido es técnico en refrigeración.
Doña Susana para tener ingresos para sus gastos y también con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella  vende ropa, zapatos por catalogo y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por horas, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 4 años en este negocio  con el cual se ayuda a salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y cosméticos que ella vende. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The credit group Nueva Jerusalén [New Jerusalem] meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of Nueva California in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the province of Manabí which has been known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds. 

Here lives Susana, 34. She is in a common-law marriage and has a 14-year-old son who is studies in high school. Her husband is a refrigerator repairman. 

Susana generates income with her business for her expenses and also to help her husband with household expenses. She sells clothing, shoes, and products from the Belcorp catalog such as beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women. She sells from door to door, working every day for hours. She gives credit to her customers and collects payments every 8 days. She has more than 4 years experience in her business that helps her succeed.

This new loan is to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell. She has been in this credit group for two years and likes it because the loans have helped her succeed. Her dreams are to give the best to her son.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Amigas De Lucciola  (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Amigas De Lucciola.
Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido  de mucho ya que con los créditos, ellos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora  Aurora, tiene 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3   hijos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Aurora es una muy buena ama de casa que para ganar sus propios recursos y así salir adelante se dedica a la comercio, ella tiene un deposito en su casa en el cual vende agua en bidón y en otras variedades, vende en su local también entrega a domicilio en su carro, algunas veces le ayuda uno de sus hijos y otras veces trabaja sola. Lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad  con lo cual se gana sus propios ingresos que le sirven para seguir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar agua en bidón, sodas y jugos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The Amigas de Lucciola credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and its beautiful spas which are visited by many tourists.  This group is made up of ten women and two men who decided to unite and form this group.  The loans have helped them by allowing them to improve their small businesses.  They work doing a variety of activities, including commerce, providing services, and other activities.

One of the members of the group is Aurora.  She is 62 years old, married, and has three adult children.  Two of her children still live with her and her husband works as a merchant.  Aurora is a very good housewife since she earns her own money by working in commerce.  She has a tank at her house where she sells water and other items.  She sells from her home and does home deliveries with her car.  Sometimes one of her children helps her and other times she works alone.  She has done this work for five years and she earns her own income to move forward.

She will use this loan to purchase drums of water, sodas, and juices.  She has been a member of the credit group since it started and she likes it because she has gotten ahead with help from the group.  Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase drums of water, soda, and juice.

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en: Norlina of Dibacong, Casiguran, Aurora is a kind-hearted woman. In addition to having four children, she serves as the guardian of a seven-year-old child. The child’s parents left him when he was three years old and Norlina has taken responsibility for giving the child shelter and a proper education. Norlina gets her income from a sari-sari store, a xerox or photocopy machine and a computer where she does research work for others. While busy managing those businesses, her husband works a security guard. Since daily expenditures are increasing, Norlina opted to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 20,000. She plans to expand her business and buy office and school supplies and acquire a color printer for her computer. Aside from that she will purchase stock of grocery items for her sari-sari store. She also offers a catering business whenever there is a birthday or wedding.

loans.use: to buy office and school supplies and acquire a color printer.

loans.name: Yessica María

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Yessica, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Yessica y su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, ella prepara en su casa y luego su esposo las cocine en su local, ellos venden alitas asadas, chuzos y varios bocadillos más, el en las tardes instala unas mesas en el centro de la ciudad de Calceta lugar en el cual tiene muchos clientes que día a día prueban sus alimentos, allí también venden sodas, aguas, jugos, entre otras cosas, lleva 12 años con este negocio el cual les permite sacar adelante a su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar alas de pollo, carne y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The La Estancia Credit Group meets every fifteen days in La Estancilla, in the Tosagua Canton.  It is known for being a very dynamic place where most of the residents devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone of lush vegetation. 

Señora Yessica lives here. She is 35 years old and she has a common-law-marriage, from which she has two children, ages 16 and 6. The older child is studying in high school, and the younger child is in grade school. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Yessica and her husband have a fast food business; she prepares the food in their house, and her husband cooks it later in their small restaurant.  They sell roasted chicken wings, shish kebabs, and various sandwiches.  In the afternoons, she sets up some tables in the city center of Calceta, where they have many customers who eat their food every day. They also sell sodas, water, and juices, among other items. They have had this business for 12 years, and it allows them to provide for their family.

She is going to use this loan for the purchase of chicken wings, meat, and other supplies for preparing the food.  

She has been in the credit group for 10 years, and she likes it because the loans help her very much. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase chicken wings, meat, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

Lourdes earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. She has been farming bananas for five years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers for her farm and groceries for her store to sell.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm and groceries for her store to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Hello world! Meet Dorcas. Dorcas, 30, is a very dedicated mother who believes in hard work. She is happily married and blessed with two lovely children whom she often refers to as “my pride.” She is based in Kapsowar, a small remote rural town in Kenya that has bad terrain and is characterized by drought and bad weather conditions. For the past three years, Dorcas has been actively involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income is from milk and crop farming. Dorcas passionately loves dairy farming and has nicknamed one of her cows “Dadii.” Milking Dadii is her hobby and feeding her cows makes her very proud. Dairy farming is very fulfilling for Dorcas. Although this humble mom makes a living through selling milk, she faces the challenge of irrigating her farm and providing water to her animals. Kapsowar is a remote area without piped water or electricity. Since Dorcas is from a marginalized community, she is forced to walk long distances to search for water. She typically walks for two hours. Therefore, Dorcas is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the rain water in this area goes to waste and Dorcas wants to harvest the water and store it in a water tank. The loan will save Dorcas time and allow her to irrigate her farm during dry seasons and increase her productivity. The increase in productivity will translate into more income, which will provide Dorcas with financial security. Dorcas will also use the stored water for home consumption. Dorcas' dream is to increase her farming activities and provide her children with a proper education. Education is the only way that her children, who are from a marginalized community, can succeed.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, 36, is married and blessed with three children. She is a hardworking and caring person. She sews clothes to support her husband in generating income and making a living for their family. She learned to sew from her mother and this skill has helped her pay for many household expenses. Due to constant usage, her sewing machine has worn down and now she needs a new sewing machine to continue sewing and generate income. 

Due to a lack of savings she applied for a loan through Brac Pakistan, a Kiva Field Partner, to help her with the purchase. She wants her children to get educated and wants to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for tailoring clothes at her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tile to install on the floor.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул погасила предыдущий кредит без просрочек и задолженности. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем инвесторам, помогшим ей в финансировании. Кредитные средства Айнагул использовала по назначению. На сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 1 лошадь и 40 овец. Также Айнагул работает помощником чабана, получая заработную плату в размере около 3,000 сом (KGS), ежемесячный доход от ведения бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота, часть средств будет направленна на установку крыши сарая для скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Ainagul paid off her previous loan on time and without penalties. She is very thankful to Kiva and all investors who helped her financially. She used the loan amount as planned, and currently has four cows, one horse and 40 sheep on her farm. She also works as a shepherd's assistant, receiving wages of about 3,000 KGS, with a monthly income from her business of about 5,000 KGS.

Ainagul has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to increase her head count of livestock as well as to put a roof on her barn. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and to put a roof on her barn

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as disciplined. She operates a retail business, where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her primary customers are the general public. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

Her business goal is to be successful, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta lives in Suai, and she is married with four children. Most of her daily income comes from selling cows. She is now applying for a loan of $800. Antonieta started her business in 2003 with her own working capital of $500. With her husband, she was going to add money to their principal amount to buy another cow and improve their business since it has become their activity. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more cows in the future. She also raises animals like buffalo, cows, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy another cows.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a hardware business, where he sells hardware items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are landlords and tenants. He says his biggest business challenge is price fluctuations.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of hardware items. His business goal is to open another business, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own many hardware stores. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to invest back into his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his hardware sales business

loans.name: Juicy

texts.en: Juicy is a married woman and she has six children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the dry season, which affects stock availability. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that she will be self reliant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Mellie

texts.en:
Mellie is 30 years old and married, with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar, and other groceries.

Mellie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Mr. Enkhbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at a flour mill since 2013. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home, looking after their youngest child. Their daughter studies at high school. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay the high school tuition fee for his daughter, so that she will study hard without worrying about the tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for making homemade chocolates to sell, including chocolate bars, sticks, and molds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase gates and construction materials.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lucy works hard to support her family. She has an egg retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening. Lucy is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of eggs to sell to customers.

Lucy hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Elizita

texts.en: Elizita is married and there are five members in her family. She has three children and her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, including coffee, sugar, candies, scissors, detergent, oil pads, lighters, glue and other things to sell. She has been doing her business since 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is taking this loan because she wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, candies, scissors, detergent, oil pads, lighters, glue and other things to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 47 years old, is from the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married with eight children between 7 and 22 years old. For the last five years, in order to help her husband who is a farmer, Susana is engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and a hog raising business to provide for her family.

Susana is asking for a loan to buy supplies of merchandise such as candies, biscuits, cooking oil, shampoo in sachets, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar. Her loan will pave the way for her to replenish her store on time, thus maximizing her income. 

In the future, she hope to expand her business and to see her all of her children be successful.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, cooking oil, shampoo in sachets, soy sauce, vinegar and sugar

loans.name: Sheba Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sheba. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Saba is the leader of the group. She is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, living with her family in a humble house. Her husband works as a guard with a very small salary and it is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the house. Saba decided to improve the living conditions of the family. For this reason, she decided to start her own business by selling ready-made children and women's clothes door-to-door. Her income still is low and she wants to increase it but she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Saba applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some stylish and new ready-made women and children's clothes and resell to her customers.

Saba looks forward to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase some stylish and new ready-made women and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Nerba

texts.en: She started selling vegetables in their village just by walking, but now Nerba has her own sari-sari store situated in front of her home. She offers different commodities such as soft drinks, biscuits, soap, shampoo, coffee, eggs, vegetables and other daily commodities needed by her co-villagers. According to Nerba, hard work has been the key for her success. Another result of the hard work for her and her husband was they were able to acquire their own farmland unlike before when her husband worked as a laborer on other people’s farms. Nerba shared that the majority of their income is being used for the education of their three children who are all attending school. Nerba wants to increase her income. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase stock of grocery items for her store. She is very optimistic that the lenders will approve her request.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grocery items for her store

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad operates a motor transport business. She is a widow with five children, four of whom are now at their adult age and one is school age. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 13,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. Trinidad hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of Php 14,900. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Trinidad has been given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her roof

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a forty-two-year-old, hardworking widower. He has three children, aged 10, 8, and 4 years, and they live in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in banana and coffee growing, alongside selling of second-hand clothes. He started his businesses with the intention of improving his standard of living and looking after his children. His main challenges are pests and diseases, and competition from other traders.

He hopes to improve the quality of bananas produced from his farm. Caleb is requesting a loan, which he will use to hire labourers to weed his banana and coffee plantation.

loans.use: to hire labourers to weed his banana and coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is 46 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Gregoria is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers for her farm.

Gregoria has been farming bananas for two years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 21 years old and single.

She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Carol

texts.es:
En la Estancilla del cantón Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Estancia, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Carol, tiene 38 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de  8 años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. agrícola y trabaja en una empresa privada.
Doña Carol es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una boutique en su casa, allí ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos, carteras, y varios otros productos más,  trabaja todos los días. Ella también le da parte del crédito al esposo el cual tiene cultivos de arroz y necesita para comprar fertilizantes que le permitan obtener una mejor cosecha. Ella tiene 3 años con su boutique la cual le encanta ya que ahí se entretiene y se gana lo suyo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y  fertilizantes. Lleva 4 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar boutique.
texts.en:
The La Estancia Credit Group meets every fifteen days in La Estancilla, in the canton of Tosagua. It is known for being a very dynamic place where most of the residents devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals, and for being a zone of lush vegetation.

Señora Carol lives here. She is 38 years old and she is married.  She and her husband have an 8-year-old son who is studying in grade school. Her husband is an agricultural engineer who works for a private company.

Doña Carol is a housewife.  She works in sales in order to earn her own money to help with the household expenses. She has a boutique in her house, where she sells clothing of all types, shoes, wallets, and various other products.  She works every day.  

She will give part of the loan to her husband who grows rice, and needs to purchase fertilizer that will allow him to obtain a better harvest. 

She has had her boutique for three years, and she loves it because she enjoys it there, and she earns for herself.

This loan is for the purchase of shoes and fertilizer. She has been in the credit group for four years, and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans. 

Her dream is to improve her boutique.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 48 years old, married, and lives at Usocan, Plaridel, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed for commercial sale. Now, she requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily maintain sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa is a 41-year-old mother in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates a store that is the primary family support. She is driven by a passion for selling and never gets tired of tending her store.

Monalisa is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has already borrowed several loans. She religiously repaid her obligations without record of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks. This will help her to sell more stock and to generate more income. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities for her to pay land rental each month. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Bertmar

texts.en:
Bertmar is a 32-year-old production worker at a garment factory in Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. He has two children and they are already studying. Cherry Lou, his wife, also works as a factory worker and they are both beneficiaries of the employment services supervised by the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Bertmar works as a Garment Production Worker. He plays an important role in the garment-making processes, from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging, and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Bertmar, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collaterals. 

For this reason, Bertmar is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to any loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. He looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to pay for their specific needs and expenses, and also to sustain the education of his children.

Bertmar dreams of operating and managing his own garment-making business someday so that he will have more time for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members regularly to share stories of his work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for the personal needs of his family and their household expenses.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has seven children, ages 6 to 28 years old. Edna operates a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells basic household items, like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost a year. In addition, she also raises pigs.

Edna requesting a loan to buy additional stock, like coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drink, biscuits and pigs. These will help Edna to sell more merchandise and will help to improve her income. As a result, she will be able to continue sending her children to school.

Edna hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, canned goods, soft drink, biscuits and pigs.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders: meet Norah, a dedicated, determined and honest farmer.

She is based in Kapsowar, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest mango growing regions, lending it the nickname of “mango region.” For the past 3 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her earn a decent income.

Norah passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up: “I have to do something for my family,” she has said.

She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance organization that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money.

Through this loan, Norah will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase string beans, tomatoes, fish, pork, and chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank.

loans.name: Ria

texts.en:
From just 40,000 PHP capital, Ria started her food kiosk business. She offers coffee, juices, sandwiches, pasta, fresh lumpia and other snacks.

While she is busy managing her business, her husband is managing their rice farm. Ria said that they are working hand-in-hand to support the needs of their two-year-old child. They want to save for the future of the child, especially for the child's education.

To save more money, Ria wants to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business. She will buy pasta, bread, vegetables, noodles and juices. Ria is very optimistic that lenders will assist her in her business endeavor.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 32-year-old mother of three. They are currently living in a rural community and they earn their living through farming.

Due to financial hardship, Yolanda engages herself in the hog-raising business to help her husband in seeing to the needs of their family.

She would like to acquire more piglets to raise but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail an additional amount of 10,000 PHP to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

Having this financial assistance, Yolanda hopes that someday, she will improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina is applying for a loan of $700 to improve her business. She is married and she has 4 children. Her husband is involved in agriculture. She has a kiosk so she is taking out this loan to add more items to her store.

She is taking out this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, including candies, noodles, aqua, cigarettes, cooking oils, toothpaste and other things to sell, such as soft drinks.

She started her business in 2000 with a working capital of $200. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management capabilities.

loans.use: To buy candies, noodles, water, cigarettes, cooking oils, toothpaste and other things to sell, including soft drinks.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 55-year-old married resident of a rural village of the Kampong Chnnang province’s Rolear Phear district.

Sam has eight children and she earns a living through farming rice and raising buffalo. Having been in this business for 12 years, she can earn about USD $12 a day to make a living and can save about USD $3 each day for future needs. 

Sam has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles. Now she is applying for a loan to buy solar lighting for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy solar lighting for her family

location.town: Kampong Chnnang Province, Rolea Phear District

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 29-year-old married man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his wife and three kids: two sons and one daughter.

He works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. He would like to start a new business to improve his family's living conditions. so he decided to buy a rickshaw and start to transfer goods on it.

Rami took a out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for this work. By taking out this loan, Rami's income will increase and he will be able to improve the family's living conditions and buy all of the things that they need.

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for work

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
62-year-old Erlinda is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She has two grown children.

Erlinda operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sell items like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, seasoning, rice and toiletries. She has been operating the sari-sari store for quite a few years now.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy groceries like bread, chips, beverages, soap and rice. Erlinda can now improve her earnings and will be able to cater to the family's daily expenses.

In the future, Erlinda hopes that, with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit from her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like bread, chips, beverages, soap and rice

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana, age 47, is married and blessed with 3 children. They live in Lahore in a rented house.

Rehana's husband is a butcher by profession and buys livestock from the local market and then slaughters it, makes it into pieces and sells them at his butcher shop. He is hardworking and the only person earning an income in the family.

As his earnings are mostly consumed paying for the regular expenses, he is unable to save up. He how wants to buy a calf for slaughtering and selling the meat to generate income, but this time he does not have sufficient capital.

Rehana has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy a calf for slaughtering and increasing their income. Her husband plans to start saving for future purposes.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf for selling beef.

loans.name: Alicia Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Jerusalén. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alicia, tiene 48 años de edad,  está divorciada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores e independientes y el menor que tiene 17 años  y estudia en colegio. 
Doña Alicia es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y bisutería. Tiene un pequeño local en su casa, allí llegan muchos de sus clientes que le realizan  sus pedidos y también sus compras, ella también sale a recorrer por la ciudad vendiendo su mercadería, deja sus productos a créditos y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 25 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le agrada porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of Credit Group Nueva Jerusalén (New Jerusalem) meet every fifteen days in Nueva California, which is a neighborhood in Portoviejo city, capital of the Manabi province of Ecuador - known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarind.  Alicia lives in Nueva California.  She is 48 years old, is divorced, and her relationship produced three children - two older and independent, and the youngest, who is 17 years old and studying in secondary school. 

Alicia is a woman who has had to work hard to raise her children. She is engaged in commerce: she sells clothing and jewelry of all kinds. She has a small space in her home, where many of her customers come to place their orders and purchases.  She also goes out into the city to sell her goods,  leaving her products on credit and receiving weekly payments. She has done this work for more than 25 years, which has allowed her to raise her children on her own. This loan is going to be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. Alicia has been in the Credit Group from its beginning and she  likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 20-year-old single man from Deir El Balah. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohannad is a student in a local university where he studies English literature. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses. Mohannad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohannad will be able to write his seminars and reports easily. Mohannad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Voern is aged 46 and married with one kid, who is still in school. For the last 28 years, she has been farming rice and working as a garment worker. With the current business, she can earn about 35,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and can save about 12,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Voern has been a member of VisionFund for four loan cycles already, and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to support her family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a latrine for using in her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use so as to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to build a latrine for using in her family

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Speu province’s Borseth district, Sot is 57 years old and widowed with children. He earns a living through farming rice to feed and support his family. To supplement the income, he also weaves brooms. Having been in this business for 39 years, he is able to earn about 10,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day and manages to save about 3,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Sot is a first loan-cycle client with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sot wants to use his portion to build a clean latrine to use in his family. He hopes this loan will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to build a clean latrine to use in his family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a toilet and shower inside her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a well, pay for labor and buy a submersible pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toilet and construction materials for a drain.

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda Elizabeth es Licenciada en Administración de Empresa, soltera, sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y estudian en la Universidad, ella labora en el Área de Recursos Humanos, en la zona donde habita se desarrolla el comercio, las personas progresan poco a poco permitiendo el movimiento económico en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea.

Geoconda cuenta con su propia vivienda y agradece a Afodenic por darle créditos que fueron invertidos en las mejoras de su vivienda, logro poner piso y repellar las paredes interna, pero tiene otras mejoras en la partes exterior por hacerle, pues carece de repello y fino en las paredes, carece de baño, y sumidero para poder decir que esta cien por ciento terminada.

Con este crédito efectuará un sumidero en la parte exterior, inodoro y baño interno, para ello comprará cemento, hierro, inodoro, tubería y pagara mano de obra. Esta mejora permitirá gozar de mejores condiciones higienes a ella y su familia, así también a amistades que la visiten que sera muy agradable para ella mostrar comodidad en su hogar.

su próximo proyecto si Dios le concede salud y trabajo ademas de mejorar su vivienda es tener su propio negocio y ser una mujer empresaria para trabajar con sus hijos, así poder salir adelante en su economía.
texts.en:
Geoconda Elizabeth has a degree in business management and is single with two grown up children who are studying at university. She works in human resources. In her local area, people are progressing little by little, allowing economic movement in the town of Nueva Guinea. 

Geoconda has her own house and, thanks to Afodenic and the credit they gave her to improve it, she has been able to put in a floor and replaster the internal walls, although there are other improvements yet to be made for it to be one hundred per cent complete, for example, the exterior walls are not plastered, there is no bath and no drain.

A loan will help Geoconda to buy cement, steel, a toilet, pipes and pay for labour to fit an exterior drain, and a toilet and bath inside the house.

This improvement will mean that she and her family will benefit from better hygiene, as well as allowing her to make visiting friends comfortable in her home. Her next project, if God grants her good health and work after improving her house will be to have her own business and work as a businesswoman along with her children to move forward in her line of work.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, PVC pipes and construction material for an exterior drain.

loans.name: Martha Yesenia

texts.es:
Martha es una madre soltera de 25 años con un hijo de 8 años que encontró en el abandono de su pareja la mejor motivación para iniciar su propio negocio y salir adelante y poder brindarle a su hijo no solo una buena calidad de vida sino que también quiere darle la mejor universidad. 
Martha se dedica a realizar artesanías, produce y distribuye canastas en aluminio para empacar las materas y ya que su capital de trabajo es muy reducido quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar aluminio y clavos para realizar su trabajo. 
Como mujer joven es gran soñadora quiere viajar, tener una casa propia, generar empleo y quizás no son sueños que se cumpla de la noche a la mañana pero una donación de un prestador será un impulso para una madre soltera que no se queda esperando a que le lleguen recursos a su hogar si no que sale y se enfrenta al mundo buscando un bienestar para su hijo
texts.en:
Martha is a 25 year old single mother of an 8 year old son. She found in the abandonment of her spouse the best motivation to start her own business and get ahead to offer her son not only a good quality of life, but the best college education, as she wants to give him.   

Martha makes artisanal crafts. She produces and distributes aluminum baskets to pack materials. Since her working capital is very reduced, she wants to ask for a loan to buy aluminum and nails to do her job.
 
As a young woman she is a big dreamer who wants to travel, have her own house, and generate employment. Maybe they aren't dreams that can come true overnight but a donation from a lender would be an impulse for a single mother who isn't waiting for resources to come to her house but who is going out and facing the world  seeking the well being of her son.

loans.use: to buy aluminum and nails to make her baskets. She is a single mother who seeks the best benefit for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pipes, blocks, iron and pay labor costs to put in a sewage system.

loans.name: Scarlet Michelle

texts.es:
Scarlet Michelle es una joven estudiante de Psicología Clínica, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Hola mi nombre es Scarlet tengo 18 años de edad y vivo con mi madre en Manganagua Distrito Nacional, Santo Domingo.
Soy hija única de mis padres los cuales siempre se han esforzado en darme lo mejor; pero la situación económica los ha limitado mucho, debido a que mi madre trabaja para una casa de familia con ingresos muy mínimos para lo básico del hogar, y mi padre el cual no vive con nosotros trabaja para una institución pública donde le pagan muy poco para ayudarnos con los gastos.
Quiero estudiar Psicología clínica en la Universidad Católica de Santo Domingo, pero debido a lo mencionado anteriormente me veo trabas para poder conseguir mi sueño de ser una gran profesional.
Esta carrera me apasiona, porque es una carrera que permite conocer el comportamiento del ser humano, además de que el poder ayudar a las personas a superar sus problemas o barreras emocionales sería muy gratificante para mí.
Por esto he recurrido a ustedes, porque con su ayuda puedo lograr mi sueño de ser profesional, y echar adelante con mi madre, quien se ha empeñado siempre en hacerme ver lo importante que es ser profesional.
texts.en:
Scarlet Michelle is a young student of clinical psychology. She is requesting a loan to pay for her education costs. This is her story: Hi, my name is Scarlet. I am 18 years old and I live with my mother in Manganagua national district, Santo Domingo.

I am the only daughter of my parents who always have worked hard to give me the best. However, their economic situation has limited them a lot. My mother works for a family with very limited income for the household basics and my father, who does not live with us, works for a public institution where they pay him very little to help us with the bills.

I want to study clinical psychology at the Catholic University of Santo Domingo but due to the aforementioned, I see obstacles to achieve my dream of becoming a great professional.

I am passionate about this career because it is a career that allows me to know human behavior.  Also, learning how to help people overcome their problems or emotional barriers would be very gratifying to me.

For this, I have come to you because, with your help, I can achieve my dream of becoming a professional and getting ahead with my mother who has always worked hard to make me see the importance of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia  de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad en la que tiene  3 años de experiencia, pues siempre había trabajado con su madre en el restaurante de  su propiedad y por eso cuando decidió generar ingresos de manera independiente, lo hizo con el conocimiento que tenía en la preparación de alimentos, enfocándose más en las comidas rápidas, como mini-perros calientes, mini-hamburguesas, que prepara sobre pedidos de sus clientes que la ubican en su local para disfrutar de los deliciosos productos a los cuales agrega salsas que ella misma prepara. . Sus ventas las realiza de contado y trabaja en su oferta desde los viernes, hasta los domingos y días feriados, de 4 a 12 de la noche. Su meta es abrir otros puntos de ventas pero aún tiene el gran desafío de lograr obtener un fondo de efectivo para para lograr su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mesas, sillas plásticas e insumos especialmente salsas, que preparará para aumentar su productividad y ganar un poco más.
texts.en: Natalia is 28 years old. She works selling fast food, and activity she has 3 years' experience doing. She always worked with her mother in the restaurant she owned and that is why she decided to generate income independently. She did it with the knowledge she had about preparing food, focusing more on fast food such as mini hotdogs, and mini hamburgers that she prepares to order for her customers who find her at her locale to enjoy the delicious products she adds sauces to that she prepares herself. She is paid for her sales in cash and she works Friday to Sunday and on holidays from 4 to 12 at night. Her goal is to open other points of sale but she still has the big challenge of obtaining a cash fund to achieve her dream os prosperity. Right now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through it, she will buy tables, plastic chairs and ingredients, especially for sauces that she will prepare to increase her productivity and earn a little more.

loans.use: to buy tables, plastic chairs and ingredients, especially sauces.

loans.name: Pastorita De Jesús

texts.es: Pastorcita es una mujer de 55 años de edad que gracias a 3 créditos que ha solicitado en la corporación le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida, ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en momentos difíciles de la vida y siempre trabaja entre 10 y 12 horas diarias buscando un mejor progreso y el cumplimiento de sus sueños que son poder viajar, tener para comprar una vivienda propia y a pesar que el destino le quito a su marido hoy en día trabaja constantemente en venta de mercancía de productos por catálogo como productos de belleza, tratamientos capitales y productos de usos doméstico y solicita un crédito para comprar estos productos pues la falta de capital y la demora de pago de sus clientes le ha dejado con un reducido inventario y quiere nutrirlo para vender, este negocio lo lleva realizando hace 10 años y gracias a el puede disfrutar de una comida y una vida digna.
texts.en:
Pastorcita is a 55-year-old woman who, thanks to the three loans she has received, has been able to improve her quality of life.  She also has been able to help her children through difficult times in their lives.  She works between 10 and 12 hours a day to get ahead.  Her dream is to be able to travel and have her own home one day, although destiny took her husband away from her.  She works constantly selling merchandise by catalogue such as beauty products, hair treatments and other personal care items.

She is requesting a loan to buy these products because she is lacking capital and the late payments by her customers has reduced her inventory.  She wants to rebuild it so she can sell again.  She has been in this business for ten years and through her work she is able to put food on the table and enjoy a decent lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy catalogue merchandise such as beauty products, hair products and other personal care items.

loans.name: José Abad

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 55 años de edad que tiempo atrás perdió todo cuando tuvo que abandonar sus terrenos forzadamente, desesperado y asustado en un nuevo mundo lejos de su hogar, comenzó a vender productos para poder ganar un recursos para comprar un alimento y gracias a que es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y de esas personas que le ve el lado bueno a la vida, puedo montar un negocio ambulante de venta de gorras y medias con el que se mantiene hoy en día- 
A pesar de que aún lo aqueja fantasma del pasado como lo es violencia en el sector, este hombre quiere seguir trabajando y mejorar su validad de vida por tal razón quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercancía en gorras y medias y tratar de comenzar a vender productos nuevos. 
José solo quiere trabajar, se hace una invitación a los prestadores para que apoyen a este hombre que no desistió y no se dejó caer cuando lo perdió todo.
texts.en:
Jose, 55, is a man who was forced to abandon his land and find himself, desperate and fearful, in a new world far away from his home.  He began selling products to earn an income to buy food and thanks to the fact that he is a very hard worker, honest and optimistic, he was able to become a street vendor selling hats and stockings which is how he earns a living today.

Despite the fact that the violent past still haunts him, this man wants to continue working and improving his quality of life.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as hats and stockings and start selling new products.  Jose just wants to work.  An invitation goes out to lenders to help this man who did not give up nor fall down when he lost everything.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as hats and stockings.  Jose is a single man who was forced to abandon his land because of violence.

loans.name: Elcie De Jesus

texts.es:
Elcie una abuela adorable y trabajadora que lleva casi toda la vida 
Dedica a las artesanías, actividad que realiza en sus ratos libres y que aprendió de sus hermanas, es una mujer que desafortunadamente perdió a su esposo quedando viuda y encontró en la confección de acolchados un medio de sostenibilidad económica.  
Quiere solicitar un crédito para la comprar una maquina fileteadora, 3 vitrinas exhibidoras y el resto lo invertirá en material para llenar todas sus vitrinas que ubica en su hogar.
Su sueño es vender cada vez más y podría hacerlo gracias a estos préstamos pues exhibirá todos sus novedosos productos que son personalizados y no se encuentran en ninguna otra tienda.
texts.en:
Elcie is an adorable and hard-working grandmother who has worked making craft items for almost her whole life. She does this in her free time and learned it from her sisters. She is a woman who, unfortunately, lost her husband and is a widow now. By making quilts, she found a way of providing for herself economically.

She would like to ask for a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, three display cases, and to invest the rest of the money in the purchase of materials to fill all the display cases she has in her home. It is her dream to sell more and, thanks to the loan, she will be able to achieve this, as she will display all her new products which are personalized and to not exist in any other store.

loans.use: to buy three display cases, an overlock sewing machine, and materials to make her personalized quilts.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Asociación comunal los Ángeles  está conformada por  nueve mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Todos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, pero luchan día a día para mantener su negocio, ya que el medio que les permite sobrevivir en la vida, y proporcionarles a sus hijos una vida estable.
Gracias a su esfuerzos  y ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es  Petrona y tiene por actividad económica una fritanga, es una venta de comida corriente como tajadas, enchiladas, manuelitas, gallo pinto, carne asada, tacos, maduros, tostones. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias desde la preparación de la comida la cual empieza desde la 5: de la mañana hasta su venta por la noche. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. asociación comunal los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Asociación Comunal los Ángeles is made up of nine women and a man, responsible mothers and fathers raising twenty children. They are from  Malpaisillo,  located in the northers part of the region. These people are characterized as being hardworking, responsible, and eager to get ahead personally. All of them have different economic activities, but they fight day to day to maintain their businesses, since that what allows them to survive and offer their children a stable life.  

Thanks to their hard work and eagerness to get ahead Petrone is their coordinator. her activity is fried food. She sells food such as tajadas, enchiladas, manuelitas, gallo pinto, carne asada, tacos, maduros, and tostones. Her business is located in her house. She spends about twelve hours a day preparing the food and starts at 5 in the morning and sells until nighttime. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling edible products so that in the not so distant future she will be able to obtain better income. The Asociación Comunal los Ángeles is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer people of low income and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in buying edible products to sell fried food such as tajadas, enchiladas, manuelitas, gallo pinto, and carne asada.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria una mujer de 39 años de edad madre de dos hijos de 20 y 13 años de edad que sueña con poder brindarle una educación universitaria y sabe que tiene todas las capacidades para hacerlo y gracias a su negocio de venta de mercancía como sandalias, ropa para dama y productos de usos domestico lo lograra a pesar que para venderlos tiene que hacer largos desplazamientos.
En su negocio emplea dos personas y quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar mercancía y seguir teniendo una sostenibilidad de trabajo.
texts.en: Gloria is a 39-year-old woman and is mother of two children, who are 20 and 13 years old. It is her dream to let them have a university education and, thanks to her business selling sandals, ladies' clothes, and household items, she knows that she can find the means to do so. She will make this dream come true although she has to travel large distances to sell her merchandise. She has two employees in her business and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in order to keep her business running.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like clothes and sandals to distribute amongst her two vendors for selling in the streets.

loans.name: Octavio De Jesús

texts.es:
Octavio es un hombre que encontró en la venta ambulante de sombrillas, controles, pilas y accesorios para celular la mejor forma de brindar bienestar a su amplia familia conformada por su esposa y 5 hijos, inicio su empresa en los años 90 y aún sigue en pié a pesar de la violencia del sector trabajando día tras día una pesada jornada de 12 horas y todo sea por el bien de su familia. 
Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía variada entre sombrillas aprovechando la temporada de invierno, accesorios etc.
Octavio es un veterano y es feliz con su negocio quiere que este tenga sostenibilidad en el tiempo y el crédito será un apoyo importante para seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Octavio is a man who found a way of offering his family a better life by selling umbrellas, remote controls, batteries, and accessories for mobile phones in the street. His family consists of his wife and their 5 children. He started his business in the 90s, and still runs it despite the high level of violence in the area. He works for 12 hours every day in order to provide for his family.

He is asking for a loan to buy various merchandise, for example umbrellas, in order to make use of the winter season, and accessories. Octavio has many years of experience and he is happy with his business. He wants it to be stable and the loan will be an important help for him to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy umbrellas, remote controls, batteries, and accessories, to improve his economic situation because he has 5 children.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo de 73 años de edad, él nunca tubo la oportunidad de estudiar. Junto a su esposa procrearon   tres hijos.

Domingo se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de pescado desde hace 8 años, su esposa le apoya en esta actividad. Él decidió dedicarse a esto, porque un vecino siempre lo motivaba, él tiene un carro en el cual puede desplazarse a una distancia de 30 kilómetros de su casa para poder vender el pescado trabaja de 3:00  a.m a 2:00  p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar unos repuestos que necesita su vehiculo.  Para que este en mejores condiciones y así poder transportar mas segura y rápida su mercadería, siendo mas rentable.
texts.en:
Domingo is 73 years old. He never had the opportunity to go to school. He and his wife have three children. Domingo has been working buying and selling fish for eight years, and his wife helps him. He decided to take up this job because a neighbor kept motivating him to do so.

Domingo has a car which he uses to travel 30 km from his house in order to be able to sell fish. He works from 3:00 a. m. to 2:00 p. m. He is asking for a loan to buy some spare parts which he needs for his car. He wants his car to be in a good shape, so that he can transport his merchandise safely and quickly, to make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts which he needs for his car.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer de 63 años de edad soltera que depende únicamente de su negocio y gracias a esté su hija y ella pueden alimentarse y se da el honor de darle un estudio y un bienestar a su hija.
