Tiene una tienda de productos de la canasta familiar heredado de su madre y el cual ha venido modificando cumpliendo sus deseos de aumentar sus clientes, utilidad, ser más competitivo y realizar pequeñas reformas a su negocio para verlo más lindo. 
Y hoy Blanca se enfrenta al último reto que le dejo su madre y es vender productos diferentes a otros negocio y es por esta razón que solicita un crédito pues quiere comenzar a vender artesanías, vender accesorios y así atraer todo tipo de clientes que se miren todo lo que tiene y sepan que en esta tienda pueden encontrar gran variedad de productos. 
Su sueño es seguir progresando y convertir su negocio en un mini-mercado
texts.en:
Blanca is a 63-year-old single woman who depends solely on her business. Thanks to this business, she and her daughter are able to feed themselves, and she has had the honor of giving her daughter an education and good well-being.

She has a shop with family essentials, which she inherited from her mother and has gradually modified, fulfilling her desires to increase her customer base and usefulness, be more competitive and carry out small reforms to her business to make it look nicer.
 
Today Blanca faces the final challenge her mother left her - to sell products which are different to other businesses. This is why she is applying for a loan, as she wants to start selling crafts and accessories, and in this way attract all kinds of customers who will look at what she has to offer and know that they can find a great variety of products in her shop.
 
Her dream is to continue progressing and convert her business into a mini-market.

loans.use: to buy crafts stock to convert her shop into something different to the norm.

loans.name: Grupo La Fe Group

texts.es:
Asociación comunal grupo la Fe, está conformada por nueve integrantes  madres responsables, con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Estas personas tiene diferentes actividades económicas, pero luchan día día para salir adelante y mantener sus negocios y sus familias.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Julia y  tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada, como pantalones, camisetas, shores faldas, camisolas, vestidos, blusas, ropa de niño, ropa de cama. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en pacas de ropa de calidad de segunda mano para tener variedad para sus clientes, y  que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. la Asociación comunal Grupo la Fe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos  recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal association group "la Fe" is made up of nine members, responsible mothers, with twenty children to care for. They come from Malpaisillo, which is located in the northern zone of the region, and they are characterized by being hardworking and responsible and by their desire for personal achievement. These people have different ways of making money, but they fight day in and day out to get ahead and to support their businesses and families. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Julia is the coordinator, and she works selling secondhand clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, t-shirts, dresses, blouses, children's clothing, and bedding. She works some ten hours per day selling her product. The objective of her loan is to invest in bundles of good-quality secondhand clothing, so as to have variety for her clients, and so that in the near future she can make more income. The communal association group "la Fe" is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with few resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a measure of decent work.

loans.use: to invest in bundles of secondhand clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, t-shirts, dresses, blouses, children's clothing, and bedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, brick, and sand to build his house.

loans.name: Cristo Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Cristo Nos Ama está conformada por trece integrantes doce mujeres y un hombre, madres  y padres responsables con treinta hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en la actualidad luchan día a día para salir adelante, todos tiene diferentes actividades económica el cual es su medio para la subsistencia de sus hijos. y el cual les ayuda  a darles una vida digna.
Gracias a sus ganas de superación personal la coordinadora es Dominga y tiene por actividad  económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, aceite, frijoles, azúcar, ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su productos.  el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal Cristo nos Ama esta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva le ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Cristo Nos Ama" (Christ Loves Us) is made up of 13 members: 12 women and 1 man. They are responsible mothers and fathers with 30 children under their care. They are originally from Malpaisillo, a town located in the northern zone of the region. They are hard-working, responsible, and have a great desire for personal success. They all perform various economic activities which are their means to provide for their children and to give them a dignified life.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, Dominga is the coordinator of the group. She works running a small grocery store where she sells food like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, and beans. She works in her store for 12 hours each day offering her products. The objective for her loan is to invest in working capital and to supply her business for buying and selling food products, so that in the not too distant future she will be able to obtain a better income. The communal bank Cristo Nos Ama thanks the Kiva lenders for the assistance they offer to people with limited resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that people can find a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest it in her grocery store and buy food like: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, and beans.

loans.name: Dúo El Calvario Group

texts.es:
Dúo El Calvario
Formado por Ligia y Jorge, Ligia es propietaria de un moto taxi es originaria del área de san Martin, es bien puntual para pagar y está agradecida con Fape Y Kiva por el apoyo que le están brindando para superarse y la oportunidad de tener un negocio para así obtener más y mejores ganancias, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi, les agradese por su ayuda.
texts.en:
The Duo "El Calvario" was formed by Ligia and Jorge. Ligia owns a taxi. She originates from the San Martin area and is very punctual in making payments.
She is grateful to Fape and Kiva for providing her with support  to better herself and for giving her the opportunity to own a business, so that she can increase her profits.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for her taxi and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for their taxi in order to run a transport service.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 24 years old, married, and has three children attending school. Being a mother, she is responsible to provide the necessities of her children. To generate income, she operates a motorcycle transport to provides service to her passengers, and also is selling vegetables within her community. This is her way of helping her husband in gaining income. 

To continuously operate the motorcycle, she needs an additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy gasoline and spare parts for the motorcycle.  She also wants to buy various vegetables to sell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts for the motorcycle, and various vegetables

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 62 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonora has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more coffee, sugar, and milk for her cafeteria.

Leonora has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, sugar, and milk for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Erick Oseas

texts.es:
Erick es un joven de 21 años de edad que estudio bachillerato. Vive con sus padres y dos hermanos.

Erick se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, este oficio se lo enseño su padre, también se dedica a la costura elaborando pantalones para caballeros este trabajo lo realiza en su casa, a tan solo 2 kilómetros le que para trabajar la agricultura.

 Erick manifiesta que quiere dedicarse al negocio de compra y venta de ganado para incrementar sus ingresos, por lo cual ha solicitado su crédito a CREDICAMPO, para comprar ganado de repasto.  

El sueño de Erick es mejorar su negocio y así también la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is a 21-year-old young man who finished secondary school. He lives with his parents and two siblings. 

Erick has worked in agriculture for the past 8 years. This work was taught to him by his father, and he also works sewing men's pants, work that he does in his house, and he works in agriculture just 2 kilometers away.

Erick states that he wants to work buying and selling cattle to increase his income, so he has asked CREDICAMPO for a loan to purchase grazing cattle.

Erick's dream is to improve his business and, in turn, his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grazing cattle.

loans.name: Al- Noran Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Noran. It consists of four women. They live in Sana'a, Yemen. This community is hard working, and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Faiza is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old single woman, living with her family in miserable conditions in Sana'a city, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her family with a better future. 

To achieve a better future for the family, she decided to work sewing clothes inside her house for the local residents in her area. Faiza has only one sewing machine, and a small amount of sewing materials inside her house. When the power is cut, Faiza stops her work because she doesn't have another power source to continue. She doesn't have enough money to purchase a power generator. 

For this reason, Faiza applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a power generator for the house to help her in achieve her business goals.

Faiza looks forward to expanding her business more by purchasing many sewing machines and sewing materials.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz, 30, is married and has four children. Her husband has run a general store in Lahore from the past four years. He is hardworking and polite. He has established himself well in the community in just four years, and has a good customer base. He is the sole earner in the family, so he has decided to start saving for their future. He wants to give his children a higher education. 

He now has inventory to buy for his store, but he is short of financing. Shahnaz has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy inventory for his shop. 

They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their assistance through the loan.

loans.use: To buy inventories for the general store.

loans.name: Ma. Aileen

texts.en:
Ma. Aileen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Aileen is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Aileen has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients like peanut, margarine, sugar and cooking oil.

Ma. Aileen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like peanut, margarine, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect sewer pipes and install a bathroom.

loans.name: Yoern's Group

texts.en:
Yoern, 48, lives with her husband and eight children in a rural village of the Kulen district of Presh Vihea province, Cambodia. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice and cassava for 30 years. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for the future.
 
Yoern is just with VisionFund for this for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a solar panel for lighting in her house. She hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for lighting in her house.

loans.name: Mujeres De Confianza Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal Mujeres de Confianza está conformada por  ocho integrantes mujeres responsables con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, ellas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Ellas se dedican a sus diferentes actividades para sacar adelante a sus familias, lamentablemente son personas con pocos estudios, por falta de recursos económicos, por lo que en la actualidad luchan para brindarles  a sus hijos la educación que se merecen y la estabilidad en todos los sentidos.
Gracias  a sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Reyna  y tiene por actividad, económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella dedica  a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es comprar un lote de cerdos en pie, concentrado, vitaminas Etc.  Reyna agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Confianza communal bank is formed of eight members who are responsible women with ten children in their responsibility. They are from El Sauce, a place which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized as hard-working, responsible, and with the desire for self-improvement. They work in different jobs to get their families ahead. Unfortunately, they are people with limited education, for lack of economic resources, so that currently they struggle to provide their children with the education they desire and stability in all its meanings.  

Thanks to their desire to get ahead, Reyna is the coordinator, and has as her work raising and selling pigs. The business is located in her house; she works in this business for eight hours every day, offering her products to established and occasional customers. The objective of the loan is to purchase a batch of pigs, concentrated pig feed, vitamins, etc. Reyna is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of pigs, concentrated pig feed, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Casiguran, Aurora. She is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. Two are in the elementary level, while the youngest is not yet attending school. 

Wilma’s source of livelihood is through palm leaves. She is making roofs and even walls of native houses. Her husband assists her in the business. When the couple is done with the palm leaves, Wilma works as a day-by-day worker with her co-villagers; she does the laundry and takes care of other people’s children. 

To have more produce and buy more palm leaves, Wilma is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders. It will be very helpful to her family if this loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy more palm leaves

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey, 28, is a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. He is married and has five children. The oldest is 8 while the youngest is 1 year old. 

Jeffrey operates a sari-sari, or variety store. He sells basic commodities like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. 

Jeffrey is asking for a loan to buy various supplies like seasonings, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods.These are essential in improving and creating higher yield. 

Jeffrey would like to expand his sari-sari store business to provide his family with good food and quality education for his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy various supplies like seasonings, sugar, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Dúo En Dios Confiamos Group

texts.es:
Dúo En Dios Confiamos
Formado por Rosa Y Mayra ambas del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. Rosa se dedica a la crianza de pollos Marranos y elaboracion de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años ella es muy puntual para pagar y solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para ampliar aun mas sus negocios.
texts.en: The En Dios Confiamos group is formed by Rosa and Mayra, both of the San Martin Jilotepeque area.  Rosa has worked raising chickens and pigs, and making typical woven cloth for a number of years and is very punctual with her payments. She asks for a loan to purchase raw material to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make and sell typical woven fabric.

loans.name: Jel Al- Ghad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Jel Al-Ghad. It consists of four young women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Hanan is a hardworking woman. She is a 27-year-old single woman living with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is the leader of the group. Hanan has a university education. Due to high rates of the unemployment in the country, Hanan couldn't find a job to help her parents in covering some of the family's expenses. She didn't surrender to that, but she has a strong determination to make a better future for her family. From this point, she decided to learn many courses in the dressmaking and sewing arts to start her own business inside her house through purchasing many sewing machines and sewing materials. 

Now Hanan is a professional tailor, and she has many customers. Unfortunately, she doesn't have the enough sewing equipment and materials to enlarge her business more. She needs financial support, but her parents do not have  enough money to support this. 

For this reason, Hanan applied for a Youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials such as fabrics, thread, zippers, and buttons in order to enlarge her business to be able to attract many customers.

Hanan looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a small dressmaking store outside the house, and buying many sewing machines and equipment to work in a better way.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials, such as fabrics, thread, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is age 54. She is married, with four children between the ages of 20 and 9 years. Two of them go to school. She has a shop, and has been running that business for six years. 

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette is 50 years old. She is married and has six children between 25 and 9 years old. Three of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been working in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy salt, sugar, rice and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, rice and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking mother of two and a very supportive partner to her husband, Adoriano. She is from Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines, and she is one of the factory workers who benefits from CCT’s employment assistance through Covenant Community Service Cooperative* and loan assistance through CCT Credit Cooperative.

Maricel works as a garment production worker. She plays an important role in garment making processes from cutting to sewing, pressing, packing, tagging and shipping.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Maricel is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Maricel is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for their needs and expenses, and also to sustain the education of her children.

Maricel wants to become more efficient in her field of work. She also hopes that her family will always stick together and has sufficiency in everything. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for their personal needs and household expenses.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey age 50 years; he is a farmer engaging mainly in pineapple growing. He is a new client, and has applied for a loan of ugx.1,500,000 to be able to buy fertilizer so that he can produce high quality pineapples. He also does coffee farming to supplement his income. He started tea farming on 10th October 2014 in a rural setting, but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. 

His customers are people around Bushenyi town, and their continued support and his tireless effort have helped his business to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income, and in the long run to able to look after his children, ages 18, 15, 12, 9 and 6 years. Four attend school.  His major challenge is an unfavorable climate of poor weather, but he has learned to manage it.

 Pictured is Godfrey with his wife in their pineapple garden.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Her name is Eleonor, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She has four children who are in college, high school and elementary school. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.  

Eleonor is in the food business. She has been operating a canteen for a number of years already. In the Philippines, a canteen is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working people usually buy their meals at a canteen, sold at reasonable prices for convenience and to save money rather than cooking at home. They eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. 

Eleonor is a good cook and that is why her canteen is popular in their area with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Eleonor is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients like pork, fish, chicken and seasonings needed for her cooking. She believes that with this financial assistance, her sales and earnings will increase. She is thanking God in advance for your great help.

Eleonor dreams to build and expand her business to secure the education of her children. She wishes for her children to have a bright future. She prays for a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fresh meat, vegetables and other ingredients needed in her canteen.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose is 46 years old. She is married and has three children between 25 and 17 years old. 

She sells food and has been selling in a business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and dried fish

loans.name: Gracita

texts.en:
Gracita is 57 years old. She lives in Mcarthur, Leyte. She has three children, two of whom are adults while the youngest is 17. 

For 30 years now, she has been farming rice and raising ducks for a living. Ducks are the sources of balut (a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell, considered a delicacy in the Philippines). The demand for duck eggs is quite high. However, Gracita's finances are limited, so she is asking for a loan to buy feed and ducklings to further expand her business.   

With the loan, she will be able to make her business stable. Her income will then be used for healthy meals and savings. In the future, Gracita wishes to have a prosperous business and to live an abundant life.

loans.use: to buy feed and ducklings.

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is married and has two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 20 years, she has operated a cashew nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mwanatibu is requesting a loan to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 27 years old. She is married, with two children, ages 4 years and 3 months; they don't go to school yet. 

She has a shop, and has been selling in a business for three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, soaps and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soaps and cooking oil

loans.name: Sonim's Group

texts.en:
Sonim, 31, is married and living with her two children in a rural village of the Kulen district of Preah Vihea province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice and bean. She has been in this business for 13 years. The current business earns her about 60,000KHR. 

Sonim has just joined with VisionFund for this cycle, and now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Sonim wants to use her portion to buy a solar panel. 

She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 43-year-old woman from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married with five children, ages 14-23. For the last 10 years, Nenita has engaged in a Sari-sari (variety) store business in her neighborhood. She sell items like canned goods, candies, seasoning, spices, biscuits and toiletries to her neighbors. 

She is asking for a loan to re-stock her store to attract more customers. She will buy in bulk toiletries, seasoning, condiments, candies, chips and detergent.

She find hope in her loan. This is her only way to make her dream of sustainability possible. Any income from this business will be for food, school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, seasoning, condiments, candies, chips and detergent

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 59 years old. She is married and has one child who is 20 years old. 

She sells food and has been selling in a business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Oern

texts.en:
A 47-year-old mother of six children, Oern resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. 

To support her living, she has been growing rice for 22 years. The current business earns her about US $11 per day.
 
This is the first loan for Oern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for her son’s tuition fee in university. She hopes this loan will enable him to have a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee in university.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Al- Osama Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Osama; it consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Salwa is a 37-year-old married  woman, and a mother of 10 children. She is the leader of the group. Salwa lives with her family in their own old house, which threatens to collapse at any time because it is very old. The income of the family is very low, and it is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. The renovation of the house takes a lot of money, and Salwa's husband doesn't have enough money to do that. 

For this reason, Salwa decided to help her husband to do the maintenance and renovation for the house. As a result, Salwa is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials to renovate her old house.

Salwa's dream is to renovate all of the house to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina lives in Suai; she is married, and she has four children.  She is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. 

She is selling chickens, and she also selling local produce, so she is taking this loan to buy more chickens, bananas, and other things to sell. Etelvina has been involved in business activities since 2006; she started with her own working capital of $100. 

She is earning a good income from selling her chicken and local produce because many people like to buy it,  So she is still happy to do her business. She also has animals like a cow, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens, bananas and other things

loans.name: Estrella 2 Group

texts.en:
María is Estrella Group 2 leader, the group is composed by ten women, they are from Ethnicity Ixil Maya, and they will invest their loans in retail, agricultural and education. They have 3.9 children on average. Their loan amount average is Q 4,940.

She has four children, two women and two men. Two of them live in other city and study at university level, one is studying for Public Accountant and the other for Social Worker, and they have part time jobs to help with their expenses. The other two study Diversify Secondary level, one is studying for Preschool Education Teacher and and the other for a Certificate in Management.

The loan will let her support her children to continue their studies, it is of Q 10,000.

loans.use: to support her children to continue their studies

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 47-year-old woman, and a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. She is married, and has three children ages 17, 15, and 7 years old.

Imelda engages in a direct selling business. She sells Avon products like beauty soap, body spray, and lotion. In addition to selling Avon products, Imelda engages in a buy and sell business. She sells rtw (ready to wear), like shorts, pants, t-shirts and whole dresses. Due to a lack of capital, Imelda is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of rtw (ready to wear), like ladies jeans, shorts, dresses and Avon products like body spray, lotion and whitening soap. These are very essential in attaining a higher income, and eventually being be able to answer the family's daily expenses.This also helps her finance the education of her children.

Imelda hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rtw (ready to wear) like ladies jeans, shorts, dresses, and Avon products like body spray, lotion and whitening soap

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 21 years old. She is married with a 2-month-old child. She has a bar in which she sells a type of beer called turbo; she has been doing this business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and turbo king to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in this same business because she needs to expand her business in order to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy more beer and turbo king.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is a married woman with children who still attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.

She has operated a kiosk retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay loans. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Hoern

texts.en:
Hoern is a 63-year-old mother of six children; she earns a living by farming rice, while her husband raise cows to gain extra income to support the family. She has been in this business for 35 years, and the current business earns her about 60,000KHR per day to feed the family.
 
Hoern is a second cycle client with VisionFund. She wisely and successfully used her first loan from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business. Now she is leading her group to ask for loan. 

As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron bars and more in order to build a room in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement posts, wire and more in order to build a perimeter fence.

loans.name: Dúo Merlos Group

texts.es:
DUO MERLOS
Sigue siendo representada por la señora Gregoria quien  desde ya  8 años se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño local ubicado en su domicilio,tambien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años doña Gregoria expresa que a Dios gracias  puede servirle a los pilotos de buses de su localidad quienes la visitan  para desayuno, almuerzos y cenas,doña gregoria esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos ya que nececita mas capital para aumentar sus venta.
texts.en:
The "Merlos Duo"
The "Merlos Duo" continues to be represented by Gregoria who, for eight years, has made a living selling meals in a small restaurant in her home. She has also been making a living selling cosmetics for a number of years. Gregoria is very grateful to God. With his help she is able to serve local bus drivers every day when they come to her home for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Goregoria is applying for this loan as she needs more capital in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Alphoncine

texts.en: Alphoncine is 48 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 16 years, and all of them go to school. She sells food stuffs and has been selling in a business for 3 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic inputs to fertilize his banana plantation.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is 59 years old. She is married with 7 children aged between 19 and 30 years; one of them goes to school. She has a restaurant and has been working in the business for 6 years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassavas for making more food for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassavas for making more food for sale.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Channy, 35, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Mung Russey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Channy and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for 15 years, earning about 70,000KHR per day to spend for family’s needs. 

This is Channy’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her family’s business

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: Precilla’s source of income is making roofs and walls through palm leaves. Her husband is also participates in this activity. They have been in this activity for five years and now earn at least Php 4,000 a month. The couple is working hard to finance the education of their children. Two of their children are still attending school, two others, already have their own families, and their youngest is not yet attending school. To produce more walls and roofs made thru palm leaves, Precilla is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from KIVA lenders to buy palm leaves, string and other materials needed in the business. Precilla is optimistic that lenders will approve her request for she wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy palm leaves, string and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the tuition fee and buy some supplies for his studies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma has been helping her husband working on their own farm to make a living.

She had her previous loans that helped her in improving their farm to earn a better income for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loans used for farming. She planned to reopen the vacant store and sell grocery goods in their community. She used her generated income from farming for buying goods. 

She took a new loan recently, to buy additional grocery goods for her store to increase her sales. She hopes to improve her business and be able to support the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods for her store to increase her sales.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is 31 years old. He is married with a three-month-old baby. 

He sells shoes and has been running this business for 5 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more shoes to resell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to resell.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is divorced without any children. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours, pupils, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nuru dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of maize flour, 10 kgs of beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of maize flour, 10 kgs of beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es:
Dora de 29 años de edad, quien estudio hasta el 4 grado de educación básica, actualmente se encuentra casada, con su pareja llevan ya 9 años de estar juntos, tienen dos hijos, su esposo se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la pesca artesanal.

Dora posee una tienda que es donde genera los ingresos para su familia, además cuenta con un molino de nixtamal, con la tienda ya tiene seis años de tenerla funcionando en la comunidad y el molino desde hace 4 años, y actualmente también se está dedicando a la elaboración de matatas artesanales, estas elaboradas con cáñamo, las cuales distribuye en sus misma comunidad y sus principales compradores son los pescadores de la zona. 


El préstamo solicitado es una parte para la reparación de la vivienda y el resto para compra de material de cáñamo para la elaboración de las matatas y si es posible invertir una parte en la compra de más mercadería para la tienda.


Ella y su esposo tienen como sueño principal que sus hijos sean unas personas de bien, que se logren superar académicamente y logren cumplir objetivos y que sus negocios crezcan día con día para que no les falte el sustento diario a su familia
texts.en:
Dora is 29 years old and studied up to Grade 4 of primary school. Today she is married and has two children. She has been with her husband for 9 years. Her husband grows basic grains and fishes on a small scale.

Dora has a store where she generates income for the family and she also has a nixtamal mill. She has had the store running for 7 years in her community and the mill for 4 years. Currently she is also making handcrafted bags. She makes them with hemp and distributes them in her own community. Most of the buyers are fishermen from the area.

She is requesting the loan partially to make repairs on her house and the other part to buy hemp to make the bags and if possible invest part in buying more merchandise for her store. She and her husband have ta big dream of seeing their children become good people and that they excel at their studies. They want to fulfill their objectives and expand their businesses so that they don't lack for the daily sustenance of their family.

loans.use: to repair her house and the rest to buy hemp to make bags.

loans.name: Siem's Group

texts.en:
Siem is age 35 and married. She has five children. Living in a village of the Moung Russey district, Siem has been farming rice for a living. Having been in business for 17 years, she manages to earn about 80,000KHR per day to feed her family and children. 

This is the sixth loan for Siem with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jimmy Jonathan

texts.es: Jimmy  de 26  años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la  carrera de ingeniería química,  estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres, Jimmy   con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser un buen ingeniero químico.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jimmy  se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en: Jimmy  is 26 years old, single and has no children. He is a pleasant student majoring in Chemical Engineering. He is studying hard to reach his goals in life. With the help of his parents and a lot of dedication to his studies Jimmy is getting good marks so he can become a good Chemical Engineer. He will invest the loan in paying for his university tuition and buying the school supplies that he needs. Jimmy is very grateful for the loan and says good-bye with many wishes to complete his proposed goals thanks to Kiva and Edaprospo.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 29-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. 

He works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. He would like to start a new business to improve his family's living conditions. So he decided to buy a rickshaw and start transferring goods with it.

Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to work with. By taking this loan, Ahmad's income will increase and he will be able to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 46 years of age and married to a farmer. They are blessed with four children: one of them is already married, while the others are still studying. Adora helps her husband in their daily expenditures thru her handicraft business. She supplies raw materials of the handicrafts that are being exported. Most of the raw materials are sabutan leaves, flowers, coconut husks, and broom sticks. Since she is the only supplier in their area, there is a need to increase her production because the demand of her customers is also increasing. 

With that, Adora is requesting for a loan of Php 25,000 from Kiva lenders, which she will use to buy sabutan leaves, coconut husks, and broom sticks. She hopes that lenders will approve her request.

loans.use: to buy sabutan leaves, coconut husks, and broom sticks

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 59 years old. She is married with nine children between the ages of 39 and 20 years; all of them are married.  

She sells food stuffs, and has been running this business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman, and is blessed with five children, all of whom are adults. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanauba has operated a weaving  business, making mats for sale, at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other weavers to be her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase reeds and packets of dye for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase reeds and packets of dye
